Reviews.Title: “Great room, not so great staff”
Reviews.Author: KW2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Location in the quarter is near its edge but everything is very walkable. The suite was large, very clean and modern and excellent bathroom. The staff was just do-so. Not eager to please at check-in. Getting bags from being checked took one hour. Getting car from valet took over 10 minutes. But I would come again because of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot”
Reviews.Author: travelgal_0511
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past April. While the price was right for NOLA, there were issues. The room itself was o.k., but very dark. The shower was the real problem. The plumbing was not done correctly, so getting the shower on and off was difficult and everything was loose. The plumbing had not been secured to the studs. Nice Kohler shower - just installed poorly. On a good note, the breakfast was really good and the location is good. I doubt we will stay there again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms for the Money”
Reviews.Author: FriendswoodTraveller
Reviews.Content: A group of friends stayed at the Iberville Suites for three nights last weekend and had a great experience. As you'll read, there are several floors going through a renovation right now but it caused minimal disturbance. The renovated rooms were very impressive, especially for New Orleans. I've stayed at many of the hotels in the New Orleans area and came to expect musty dated rooms. You won't find that here. All three of our rooms had a front living room with flat screen tv's and couches. Next was the bathroom area with the small kitchenette. The shower was nice and large with plenty of flow on the 9th floor. Lastly was the bedrooms that had a king size bed and flat screen tv. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning worked very well. I wouldn't think twice about staying there again. The rooms were nice and new, the staff was friendly and the Ritz facilities were exceptional. One side note, don't expect much from the breakfast buffet. It was really just fruit and muffins. I would suggest venturing over to the Ruby Slipper Cafe for breakfast or brunch. It was outstanding and worth the wait in line.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT FOR CORPORATE CHANGES SEP 17”
Reviews.Author: Helgu
Reviews.Content: Just called the hotel because it is becoming Courtyard by Marriott around Sep 17. They confirmed some of the Ritz Carlton privileges will no longer be available - specifically gym and pool. This substantially alters the hotel offering as described online so just letting you know!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brett B
Reviews.Content: I can not speak to the rooms that have not been renovated but the one I stayed in had been renovtaed and it was very nice. The beds were comfortable and the room were spacious enough for 4 people. We were on the 10th floor and we did not see any construction nor hear any noise from the construction. There is an exchange of elevators but it nothing to get upset about. The only issues that we had was the bathroom door is a sliding door and does not block sound very well and most of the staff is just OK. I would stay in the Iberville again. The price is very reasonable and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Renovated Suited”
Reviews.Author: cjqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time at Iberville Suites last week and absolutely loved this hotel. There were some minor inconveniences but the newly renovated suite made up for those. I stayed in a corner room on the 10th floor and heard very little construction noise during my stay. Actually, this was the quietest hotel I've ever stayed at in the quarter. Yes, water was turned off two days of my stay from 1-3 but I was out and about during those times, so it didn't affect me. The suite smell fresh and was decorated lovely. There was a granite wet bar as well as granite in the bathroom with lovely tile work. The bed was very comfortable and I had a view of Canal St. There was plenty of room to spread out for me and my family. It was a little confusing taking 2 elevators to get to the room but again, the lovely suite more than made up for that. We took our car out a couple of times during our stay and the valet were very quick and good with directions. I have stayed at over 10 places in the Quarter and Iberville is my favorite so far. The location is great. I just hope the prices don't go up too much after the remodel as there was a sign that Marriott was taking over out front.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in 50 years!”
Reviews.Author: Ddh59
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel experience I have ever had and I have 4 more nights of this dump. Construction noise all day and evening, no water scheduled from 1-4 but didn't get turned on until 5:30 today this is occuring each day of our stay. Even the little things are missing. No note paper or pens anywhere in the hotel, not even the front desk! Rude front desk personnel and it takes 2 elevators to get to your room! Never will I stay here again and I will tell everyone I know about my experience!

Reviews.Title: “Second time and looking forward to a third!”
Reviews.Author: Marisa M
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Iberville Suites, once was in 2009 and again here in 2012. Both times I was treated beyond great by the staff! Yes the hotel is currently being renovated but the workers are working as fast as possible to get it done so that everyone can experience the updated beautiful rooms. I stayed on the 10th floor which was one of the first floors to be finished and I LOVE the new rooms! They are spacious with a very large walk in shower and flat screen tvs with wireless phones. There is some road construction going on but I just avoided those area's and still had a great time! I can't wait for the entire remodel to be done because I will for sure be back to see how the lobby has changed!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton just get on with it.”
Reviews.Author: mexicohangover
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here. Strange experience. Room was below average by New Orleans standards. They are owned by the attached ritz-Carlton and the whole property is being worked on. Elevators are crazy. Up to 5 walk over to other set of elevators and go up to 6th floor. Just needs the Ritz to take the whole thing over. Nice location but that is about all I can say.

Reviews.Title: “I'll give you the pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: pinkbeachflamingo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7/12 thru 7/16. Great location. Close to Bourbon St but not too close! Rooms are still quiet. Construction was still in progress but I did not hear anything on the weekends. Work could be heard during the week. Located in same building as the Ritz-Carlton so it was nice to utilize their lounges for drinks and visiting. The bathrooms looked updated, however the rest of the suite was a bit dated. Old school TVs and phones. Staff was helpful & friendly. Ordered room service once, which is provided by the Ritz and the service was excellent. The complimentery breakfast was coffee, juice, packaged muffins, granola bars, and some fruit. Decent price, decent hotel, great location, and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7/12-7/16 Great location. The hotel was under construction. There was drilling early in the morning. It would be nice if the hotel gets a vending machine and a microwave. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure”
Reviews.Author: Wanda F
Reviews.Content: I am a very liberal person and very understanding on reviews. But very divided on this one. Room hot but did get fan. Hall had bags of dirty laundry. Front desk did not seem very concerned about hot room. No vending machines for drinks and ice machines few and far between. Did love two rooms though couch pullout not comfortable. room very worn although they are remodeling and hopefully when finished will create a more condusive enviroment for concern for customer comfort. will stay again but quite disappointed. Felt like room comfort was based on what you paid for room. Have stayed at many different new Orleans hotel through years and this was most confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Erika C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an amazing location. Bourbon street is one block down and Canal is one block over. Check-in The check-in was smooth, we prepaid for the room, so we just left a credit card for incidentals.There is a makeshift desk on the ground floor on the iberville st side but the staff was very friendly and helpful during the entire trip. We had small bags so we carried them to our room ourselves. When we first arrived we were on the dreaded 6th floor that required us to go to the 5th floor walk for about a minute or two and then get in another bank of elevators to go to the 6th floor. This didn't last long and we asked to moved to a different floor. We were moved to the 5th floor rom 506 and it was close to the elevator so this was nice. The only problem with being on the 5th floor is that you hear alot of foot traffic from people walking by trying to get to those 6th floor elevators. We weren't in the room much but I thought I should mention this. Also we never heard any construction and we were here for 4 days/3nights. Dining/Room Service We didn't order room service and I can't even say that I saw a menu for it. We did eat in M Bistro next door in the Ritz Carlton. The wait for a table was horrible. Did I say horrible? Yes horrible but the food and our waitress made up for it. Granted we were here during the Essence Festival so I expect things to be backed up but this place was not packed. We waited at the podium almost 5 minutes before anyone acknowledge us and a manager even walked by us and never said anything to us. I would have appreciated him saying that he was working on a table or that he was trying to find out what the hold up was but we got nothing. If you come here please try the shrimp and grits or the jambayla empanades. Both were really good appetizers. I would highly recommended coming here and the great thing is that you don't have to leave the hotel as the two of them are connected. Room We had a 1br suite with a Queen bed. The Queen sized bed was very comfortable, we had a view of the courtyard. The pull out sofa was very had according to my girlfriends. We called housekeeping and they brought up some additional linens in an attempt to cushion the bed. There is a smal refridgerator and two tvs in the suite. There is also a sink in the living room area of the room. The bathroom was nice, they use bath and body works products. The shower however leakes and we had to keep putting towels down on the floor to soak up some of the water. Valet/bellman We used them to get a cab on two occasions and they were helpful. They also stored our bags until it was time for us to leave and they had a cab ready for us at the time that we told them we needed to leave for the airport. Check-out This was easy as we had no additional charges. The hotel is very serious about their Noon Checkout. There is no video check out so you have to go downstairs. At about 11:59, housekeeping knocked on the door to see if we were still in the room. We told them that we would be out of the room within the next minute or two. I have to give you a heads up, when we were leaving there was a sign on the building saying it was changing to a Marriott Courtyard/Iberville. I would definitely recommend this hotel and feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value..... Perfect for Family or 2 Couples”
Reviews.Author: MissShotcaller
Reviews.Content: I had read so many of these reviews that were negative and just couldn't imagine the Ritz Carlton would be attached to anything so awful...and I am glad I went with my instinct!! I had no issues with this hotel at all ....truly thought it was wonderful for the price and you cant beat the location. We had 2 couples, and had a 2 room suite that was clean, perfect french quarter location, and we got to use the pool and spa and fitness facilities of the Ritz Carlton. Check in was a breeze, the staff was all very friendly and whenever we needed anything, we got it very timely. Our room was a tad older, yet it was clean, no odd smells and really very charming for the french quarter. If i wanted modern, i would have stayed at a New Canal Street Hotel. The room has minial frills but thats was fine with us. They do offer room service, which we did not use. We got a comfy bed, a roomy room and bathroom and the TVs worked!! The continental breakfast is very very basic... muffins (3-4 different types), juice, coffee, bananas, apples and thats about it but seriously, there are so many inexpensive little neighborhood diners for breakfast I was eager to eat at, this was not an issue. We did grab a muffin or 2 which made a good snack later! The gym facilities where flawless, the pool was indoor and small but refreshing...the hot tub was nice after a long day walking! We also enjoyed the lobby sitting areas of the Ritz Carlton as this hotel is attached to it. I did note a "Courtyard By Marriott" coming soon Sign on the Iberville Side and they are redoing the lobby of the Iberville so I am guessing, they are about to change over soon. I got my room for 99.00 a night thru the Iberville Website and this was a bargain for 2 couples to share the 2 room suite!! The rollaway in the living room made our situation work well. The location is 1 block from the Canal Street end of Bourbon Street so we were right in the Quarter and yet the Canal Street and St Charles Street Cable Cars were right out front thru the Ritz Carlton Side... Excellent for site seeing!! I would highly recommend this hotel and hope they keep this all suite hotel lower priced for budget minded travellers....perfect for small families or 2 couples.... to have a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: jbintexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights June 18-21 at Iberville Suites and considered it a great value for the price of $80 + tax per night. The location was perfect as it was one block off Bourbon but far enough away to be very quiet. The hotel is under renovation and noticed that it's the 8th, 9th and 10th floors currently being worked on. There was some noise in the mornings but really didn't bother us. The room was big with living room, wet bar area, bedroom and bathroom. Very accomodating for 2 people. The AC worked well which is important during summer in New Orleans. The water pressure and hot water didn't always work so well. I think they turn it down or off during the day as there is no hot water much less water pressure. Take your shower in the morning or evening! Breakfast was not worth it at all. Coffee was really bad which is unusual in New Orleans. Banana was the best thing! The bar in the Ritz was very nice but drinks are a little pricey. Overall, I would stay here again for a comparable rate. Eat at Deanies across the street but be prepared for a long wait. Also, ate twice at Acme's right down the street; try the grilled oysters as they are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and great location, but dark and grimy.”
Reviews.Author: YouCantHandleDaTruth
Reviews.Content: Got a one bedroom with a suite for $90 a night. The hotel is undergoing renovations until September so maybe it will be better after these are complete. Don't come here if you need a flat screen tv, big breakfast, and extremely comfy bed. And if you are a clean freak, this place might offend. I would stay here again because it is a great deal as far as hotels in/near the quarter are priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Chad M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a single night as we were driving back from Florida to Texas. We definitely were looking for a higher star rated hotel and unfortunately that is not what we got. It appears that the hotel was undergoing renovations: the entrances were not marked, the rooms were dated and musty, the bed was mushy with a big dip in the middle. Calling down for the car was an exercise in frustration as neither the front-desk, valet, or hotel operator answered the phone over a 10 minute period. Last but not least, I had a Wi-Fi hotspot taken out of my car after I handed it over to the valet service. The claims department for the hotel is on it, and I believe they will address it. On the positive side, the location was great and the food and service at the Ritz Carlton was great. In summary, I expected a whole lot more service and polish for a hotel that shares space with the Ritz and for over $200 / night.

Reviews.Title: “Goo stay.”
Reviews.Author: Valerie34099
Reviews.Content: Suite was large, quiet, and clean. They were doing renovations but there was no real noise. This property shares space with the Ritz hotel and is very upscale. Great location, 2 blocks from Bourbon street yet not a hectic area. Everything in the room was nice quality aside from a desk chair that was missing the arm. The only inconvenience was that we had to take 2 elevators to get to our suite. It was well worth it. Tip - request an inside, courtyard room. We heard no street noise at all and were on the fifth floor. The continental breakfast is very minimal and they notified it is a modified one due to the construction and the lobby being temporary relocated. We got a great price so cannot complain about that.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for quick stay”
Reviews.Author: holymoni
Reviews.Content: Took a trip to NOLA in May with 3 friends. We had booked this hotel for Jazzfest lodgings for an unbelievably low rate. Valet parking, the only option, for $27 (yikes) a night was handled easily by friendly doormen. It was hard to find entrance though! Street was really narrow and not well marked. Elevators up to room were weird-had to take 2 to get to the lobby? Marble floors and huge antique chandeliers did make the lobby look grand, like old school grand-as was the hotel itself. My friends were very upset about the $15 fee to use wifi there..that seemed very excessive!!! We booked a King "suite" which ended up being a tiny living room with a sleeper sofa that led to a King bedroom separated by a bathroom and door. The view out the window was an air conditioning unit on the roof,,,haha. all that said...the room was spotless, beds comfy, and location in Nola could be beat for our price. Staff was very friendly and greets you everywhere, even remembering your name!! Our only problem was our air conditioning which was inadequate. We called the desk at night to get a fan or something and there was no one answering phones. After 30 rings, it transferred to the Ritz Carlton, where the girl told us there was really nothing they could do about it??? okkkayyyy..... so we sweated it out and since we were there for just a few days, we were barely in our room anyway. The location was right in the middle of everything! Bourbon street a couple blocks away, Canal street a block away to the street cars/busses. Tons of good restaurants within walking distance, Acme Oyster house and Deanies seafood are right there, we walked to Mulattes about a mile away which was totally worth it. Walgreens, McDonalds, and Starbucks right on/across Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Iberville Suites”
Reviews.Author: Carl S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites for three nights in May. We had read the good and the bad reports that were posted. Our experience was very good. Yes, the carpet was a little worn and the room had the apperance of some use. However, the room was clean. SERVICE WAS OUTSTANDING. We were pleasantly greeted by every employee. When we requested anything, it was handled promptly. It was similar to Ritz Carlton service and attitude. The construction and renovation work that was in process was hardly noticed. In addition, we were able to use the services at the Ritz at no additional charge. The confusion of walking the hallways to our room added to the charm; in that, we met a lot of fellow guests who were also lost but pleased with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as hoped”
Reviews.Author: Jlynnscott
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was too far from Bourbon Street but I was wrong. It's two blocks away. The Quarter is actually pretty small. The hotel was fine in every way, vintage but redone, clean, nice bed, perfect location, courteous help. View was certainly of the French Quarter, however, remember that is a view of the roofs, not a balcony overlooking Bourbon Street. I read mixed reviews so was worried but my experience was pretty much perfect. The ony odd thing was trying to print boarding passes --you have to go into the adjoined building (the Ritz) and pay for computer access. You can probably avoid this altogether and just do it at the airport but I like to have mine in hand. I would recommend it and would not hesitate to return. Nice to know a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, worst continental breakfast EVER!”
Reviews.Author: BD1963
Reviews.Content: First, I am a travel agent. I have stayed in many hotels and this one was really bad. I was told they are renovating (though I saw NO renovating being done) and that was why we had to go up two different elevators and a "maze" of hallways to get to our room. The hotel clerk was okay but the front desk was in disarray. I had to ask her NOT to put us in a room next to a stairwell and her response was "oh, okay, I have to redo your room then" - glad I asked! The room was big enough but dirty carpet, dirty couch with green stain on it, dusty furniture, and mold in the bath - just GROSS. Continental breakfast was a joke - a few apples and bananas and prepackaged muffins. Cost them all of a $1 and charged us $$$ in room rate! Until they actually finish their so called renovations, don't waste your money on this hotel. There are much better hotels in the area at a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: knevins
Reviews.Content: Great rates, but during our stay their renovations were going on. The front desk did not tell us that the Jack Hammer would be renovating the rooms above during the day. The noise was continuous for 5 hours and 2 days. Continental Breakfast was Orange Juice, Coffee, Water, Prepackaged Sara Lee Roll, Bananas and apples. This in a city where they have a strong culture in food. The front staff were ruff and very professional. The phone was broken in our bedroom. So when I call front desk to report for engineering, she told be to call back later. I said no, please send them between 12 and 3pm when I am out. She said she would see what she could do. Very unprofessional...would not recommed.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: reescares
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a business trip at this lovely small hotel. It is connected to the Ritz-Carlton but far less expensive with all of the amenities. The rooms are classic NOLA--drapes, antique furniture, good linens on the bed and towels are soft and fluffy. The lobby is confusing and you must get on two different elevators to get to the rooms. Breakfast is included and is rather uninspiring--defrosted pastiries, juice, yogurt, cereal, coffee. The location is ideal--in the French Quarter without being too close to noisey Bourbon Street and one block off Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Perla G
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Iberville Suites in the French Quarter. It was a great location with really pleasant staff and a very comfortable suite. Yes, it is in need of renovation that is starting later this month, but the bed and amenities were very comfortable. An added bonus was the continental breakfast each morning from 6:30 to 10:30. It is in the same building as the Ritz, so you get to use their facilities. We would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: telegirl68
Reviews.Content: This is not fancy hotel, but it's also not as crappy as many of these reviews make it sound. The hotel is in the same building as the Ritz Carlton and shares many amenities, notably the excellent health club and spa. The pool is a small, exercise lap pool, and not a family or party pool, by the way. The hotel is mostly suites, but we got a sort of large double with a half wall dividing the two beds. The tv was a relatively new flat screen. The beds were nice, with reasonably new and crisp linens and okay pillows (not down, but lots of them, and some firmer than others). Nice furniture. There was a small refrigerator in the room, so we were able to keep some tea makings. Shower was good pressure, plenty of hot water, a large shower head. There was also a bathtub. there's room service, but we don't know how it was, as we never stayed in to eat! The lobby is large, comfortable with nice sofas. Don't know about parking, we didn't need a car because the hotel is perfectly located to almost everything. Across the street is the Sheraton, from which shuttles depart to jazzfest every few minutes (for $18 per person) and one can buy tickets (for $85, which is more than the fix cost online, but still convenient). A negative for this hotel is that there is a $15/day charge for wireless, although it's free in the lobby and it seems to be true of all the hotels in NOLA. Also, it seems they're in the process of remodeling, which may mean discomfort for some guests at times. All in all, though, a hotel with an upscale appearance, most amenities, and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DelawareKelly
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasurable stay at the Iberville Suites. The location was perfect. One block off of Bourbon and walking distance to just about everything else you wanted to do. The rooms were OK, nothing fancy and probably need a little updating. Carpets were stained and the TV's are old. The rooms were very clean though. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. It was like a slice of heaven and the pillows were just as wonderful! We went with another couple and they commented on how wonderful their bed was too. Both of us stayed on the 10th floor. Free Continental breakfast in the morning was great. Loved waking up, feeling extremely groggy and hungover and being able to slip downstairs for cold OJ, coffee and a bagel. Perfect! The housekeeping staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. Bell staff were great! Front desk staff was just OK. Not great, not horrible. Just not much personality. All in all, we had a great stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: dianasroad
Reviews.Content: The suites have a certain boxy feel, and the bathroom was a bit small, but overall we loved the Iberville Suites. These are true suites with separate bedrooms and sitting rooms. Wet bar and refrigerator are included. Beautiful building, beautiful interior, polite, competent staff. Everything was clean, quiet and very comfortable. (we were on 9th floor -- don't know if higher is better, noise wise. I wouldn't think noise is a problem anywhere in this hotel, unlike some others). Iberville Suites is a perfect retreat in the French Quarter. A block for the Canal Street and St Charles Street trollies. We also loved being an elevator away from Davenport Lounge. We stopped in there every afternoon. We didn't see any signs of the problems some other guests have mentioned on this site. We did not use the Ritz Carlton Spa but we did check it our. It was very nice. All the exercise equipment, as well as the pool and spa tub are included with your stay at Iberville. Massages, etc. are priced about the same as other upscale day spas I've seen All in all, I'm very glad we made this choice! p.s. I understand this hotel will undergo a renovation in 2013? Prices will surely increase.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: Christy P
Reviews.Content: Just one block off Bourbon St., this hotel was a great location for walking in the French quarter. The beds and pillows were the most comfortable of any hotel I have stayed in. The carpet had a few stains, but the room was kept clean. Affordable and attached to the Ritz Carlton, so enjoyed their amenities as well. Free continental breakfast until 10:30. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but needs to renovate the rooms”
Reviews.Author: robertf11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location on Iberville Street. It is only two blocks from Bourbon Street which means that you are close by but you don't get the noise and smell. The first room that we checked into hadn't been cleaned very well. There was hair left in the tub and the room was extremely dusty. The couch looked like someone had tried to rip it apart and the pictures that we were once on the walls had been removed so that the only thing left on the walls was the picture hooks. We called the front desk and they brought us keys to another room within minutes. Our next room on the same floor (8) was cleaner. I have stayed at several hotels in New Orleans and they all seem to be a little dirty. For the price you would think that they would clean them better.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Allensu
Reviews.Content: We were extremely anxious about staying here after reading the reviews. We stayed from April 23-27, 2012. We contacted the Iberville Suites regarding our concerns and asking for a room on the 10th floor since the reviews were less criticial from folks staying on this floor. We received an immediate reply from Laura Orfield, Director of Revenue Management. She advised that no renovations had been completed on the 10th floor and renovations were not scheduled until May 2012. We were most impressed with the immediate response to our concerns. When we arrived we were met by an extremely courteous and helpful front counter staff member. We stayed in Room 1009 to which we were extremely pleased. Yes there are some stains in the carpet however it appeared that the carpet had been cleaned. There were some mismatched beige towel sets however they appeared freshly laundered. Everything in the room was in working condition. Yes, the TVs are an older version however they worked perfectly. The bed was extremely comfortable with extra pillows and crisp linens. This hotel is situated in the French Quarter making it easy to walk to attractions and restaurants. The continental breakfast (which was included) consisted of fresh orange juice, coffee, bagels, toast, muffins, yogurt and cereal. What more would anyone want? Having a suite was a bonus for us as my husband is an early riser and he could close the door and allow me to sleep in. The conceige staff were friendly and helpful to us. All in all, we couldn't have had a better place to stay which made our trip so very enjoyable. We would return to this hotel if ever we come back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Staff nice but hotel really needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: AttyVette
Reviews.Content: Nice staff but hotel room was very dirty looking, (carpet and walls) and bathtub drain plug broken with hair left in bathtub drain..gross! Mold in corner of tub on tile surround and on shower curtain, tile floor cracked in several places and rough to walk on..for over $300 dollars a night for one person, I expected better than the room was! Last year, I stayed at its sister hotel the Ritz-Carlton ( they are connected by the third floor) and when I was here last year, the Ritz-Carlton room was a night and day difference from the Iberville Suites hotel room. The Iberville Suites website states they will start renovating the hotel starting next month so I suggest stay elsewhere until the renovations are complete as you can pay this same amount at other hotels that have rooms that have already been updated ( ie. Ritz-Carlton). That being said, the location is close to the French Quarter so if that's what you are looking for and you don't mind paying for a room that's not renovated yet, then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JL4350
Reviews.Content: Our room was very dirty with old, stained furniture and linens. We were very disappointed with this hotel. Others in our group felt the same. The location, however, is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: lawre3
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, front desk staff were rude and unhelpful. It was clear they hated their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonBocagrl
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of mixed reviews regarding this hotel which made me uneasy. However I would say it was great. The rooms look just like on the website with a bedroom and living area seperate including a wet bar with fridge and sink. The room also had an ironing board and safe, if that is helpful to anyone. I will say that the carpets seem to need a good deep cleaning, however I did not feel like the room was dirty. The one weird thing that happen was we did not get the same amount of towels back clean from the maid and she forgot bath towels one day. We called down to the desk and they had them up in minutes. The best thing was that it is attached to The Ritz Carlton. You were able to use their gym, spa, lounge, etc. There is a great bar over there and a lively entertainer Thurs-Sat nights. It was great to have that attached. The breakfast that was provided was ok, enough to get you going for the day, coffee, juice, yogurt, dry ceral, bagel, toast, muffins. The location is fantastic within walking distance to everything, and for the price I dont think that it can be beat.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, worth it”
Reviews.Author: Melvillean
Reviews.Content: In the world of overpriced French Quarter hotels, Iberville Suites compares favorably, despite its sketchy location. It's a short walk to most New Orleans sites/restaurants, the rooms are large and clean, and they do offer a continental breakfast. For all that we paid $125/night, plus $34/night parking (and a slew of state and local taxes, no fault of the hotel). The staff was a little off, though. We received a call to say our rooms were ready, arrived about 30 minutes later, and they made our 85-year-old parents wait an additional 30 minutes for their room. For the poor service, I'm not sure I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jackman61
Reviews.Content: No complaints about our stay at The Iberville Suites. After reading many reviews about this hotel, I knew what to expect before we even boarded our flight to MSY. Location - Perfect. A couple of blocks away from Bourbon and the streetcars on Canal. Once you get to the French Quarter you realize just how compact the area is. Even a hotel like this, which is technically on the outskirts of the Quarter, is literally a two minute walk from all the tourist activity on Bourbon. The area surrounding the hotel was perfectly safe and we never felt threatened at all. I read many reviews that questioned the safety of this area, but those warnings turned out to be unjustified. Staff - We found the staff to be accommodating and friendly. No issues with rudeness or surliness. The valets outside were always eager to talk and greet us, same with the clerks at the front desk. The Hotel - Although the lobby is quite beautiful and spacious, our room needed a complete renovation. The furniture was worn, the television, although we did not even turn it on, was probably 15 years old, and the walls were in dire need of a paint job. The couch in the room had rips in it, the dresser was missing a handle, the bed was uncomfortable, the blankets were pretty much garbage, and the carpets were permanently tarnished due to age. With all that being said, and I know it may be hard to believe, but we had no real issues with the room. It was fine for us and our needs. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. It's really all about your expectations. No, this hotel is not the nicest in the Quarter, but it certainly not the worst. It's not the Ritz-Carlton, which coincidentally is right next door, but it's not a Super 8 either. We have no regrets about staying at The Iberville Suites. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to visit New Orleans without spending a fortune on hotel accommodations. Also, the complimentary breakfast was good; plenty of bagels, muffins, cereal, yogurt, coffee and orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Here's a balanced review to put other reviews in perspective.”
Reviews.Author: Dulcinea10
Reviews.Content: There are lots of reviews on this site for Iberville Suites: about half say the hotel was great (for the price and location), the other half say it smells, is dirty and worn out. I'd like to put these reviews in perspective, having observed the hotel with those reviews on my mind. 1. Superficial hotel appearance: very nice once you find your way to the Iberville! It's hidden inside of the Ritz Carlton, and although I entered on Iberville St. where the sign for the hotel is, I could not get to Reception b/c I did not have a key card to use the elevator! i had to walk around to the Ritz, and got hopelessly lost in their maze of corridors and different elevators. Very nice lobby areas and fitness center, except for the cockroach strolling across the 1st floor fountain lobby. (But it's New Orleans and the buggers are everywhere down there. No sign of bugs anywhere else.) The Iberville lobby, on the 2nd floor, was very nice looking, with lots of seating areas, eating tables, and a single computer station that's pretty horribly slow, with a free printer if you want to print boarding passes or the like. Another reviewer mentioned a funny smell in the lobby - I admit, I smelled something as well, sort of an industrial cleaner or chemical odor, but couldn't quite place it. It's not so strong as to be problematic, but it is noticeable when you come off the elevator. 2. Room appearance and amenities: The room is a full fledged econo-suite - you walk in to see a little kitchenette (with coffee maker and mini-fridge) on one side, then enter a little sitting area with couch and TV. Then you pass to the main bedroom area, which also has a TV. Around the corner is a little desk area, before entering the bathroom. My bathroom was HUGE with lots of unused space. At quick glance, the bathroom was really nice with stone floors and everything in muted stone brown/tan colors, with nice Bath & Body Works soaps, etc and a huge number of towels. However, on closer inspection, you could see the wear and tear on the sink, which was very small without much usable space and looked old and worn. There were wear spots around the edges of everything in the bathroom and the bedroom. Towels were thin and small. Back in the suite area, the carpets were clean and vacuumed, but looked very old and worn, with stains here and there, as noted by other reviewers. The bed appeared nicely made up with white sheets and attractive matching bedspread and throw pillows. And lots of pillows, which is usually a good sign. Yes, internet is $13 a day so I didn't use it and couldn't find any nearby free wi-fi points. Yes, the view stinks - mine overlooked a parking garage. I think the Ritz just stuck this economy hotel on its ugly side to attract economy clientele. 3. Room comfort: The bed sagged and I could feel the springs a bit. I have a bad back, and the bed was not so horribly saggy that I couldn't sleep on it, but it was not the most comfortable I've experienced. The pillows were nice and cushy. Sheets were scratchy and thin, and had an industrial detergent odor that was a bit off-putting. A clock-radio alarm with CD player is included. The couch was comfortable enough to sit and watch TV (an old CRT) - I brought a throw blanket to cover the couch, more because of germs but the couch was a tad scratchy as well. My room was perfectly clean the entire stay, no complaints there, unlike a few other reviewers. Guess it depends which maid you get. 4. Breakfast: typical. NO SIGN OF WAFFLES, unlike reported previously. Bagels, bread, muffins (gross), cereal, yogurt, tea, apples, coffee, orange juice. So more food than reported by some but less than by others - maybe it varies? Nice large eating area seemed to accommodate everyone. 5. Fitness center is provided by the Ritz. It has spring water if you want to bring a bottle to refill. Decent size and separate rooms for cardio versus weight equipment, plus a separate room for doing your personal mat-based workout. Pool and jacuzzi. Got a little crowded a few mornings between 7 and 8. Seems abandoned in evenings. 6. Location: Iberville St and Dauphine is located one block north of Bourbon St. The neighborhood is a little dicey after dark, I didn't feel comfortable as a single woman walking around with a purse by myself. Go down just 2-3 blocks (NOT on Bourbon St!) to Royal and Chartres and you'll be in a nice touristy area. 7. Summary: Everything is relative - if you expect nothing more than the Days Inn, you'll be pleasantly surprised. However, since it's attached to the Ritz, maybe you'll expect it to be higher end, so you might be disappointed by the state of the rooms. As usually is the case, the truth lies in the middle of the extreme reviews provided by travelers on this site. There are pros and cons, yes, its a bit worn down looking and could use refreshing, but given the price and location combo, this place is a pretty darn good value for being so close in proximity to great New Orleans attractions.

Reviews.Title: “It is a good place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: skittishsquirrel
Reviews.Content: If we had intended to spend much time in the room I wouldn't have been very pleased. It was small and the room was in serious need of a deep cleaning. It had obviously been cleaned before we got there but the room smelled funny when we walked in, the grout in the bathroom needed to be bleached and scrubbed, the picture frame was falling apart, there were handprints all over the window, and there was at least 1/4 inch of dust under the bed. I could hear every word people walking down the hall were saying, housekeeping staff included. And one of the desk people kept giving me nasty looks. The other members of the staff were very nice and friendly. The breakfast is served longer than normal and is beautifully arranged. And I felt very safe from random scary people since you have to go past 2 sets of employees on 2 different floors to get anywhere near a guest room. And it was a block off Bourbon for a great price with a beautiful view!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lori L
Reviews.Content: We were on a group tour and this was the hotel we stayed in. This was suppose to be a suite. The rooms were tiny, dirty, very small. Had a double bed and a pull out couch. Barely enough room to get around! The carpet was disguisting, housekeeping did a very poor job. Night manager was an idiot and no help at all. Had no personality and was not willing to help some of the people in our group. They had booked people in the wrong rooms. I would not recommend staying at this location at all. Continental breakfast was lacking. No protein or fruit. Service at this hotel is terrible. Again, I would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive about this hotel. Very nice rooms. Ours had a private living area separate from the sleeping area with separate televisions, a fridge, and a safe. The bed was comfortable with nice linens. The soap in the bathroom was Bath & Body Works brand which had a lovely scent. Best of all our dog was welcome there. One of the staff took a special liking to him and bought him a toy and some treats for the long ride home. That act of kindness meant so much. Awesome! Extremely close to Bourbon street. Valet staff are excellent. Light complementary breakfast. I loved it there.

Reviews.Title: “P J Tours Terrible group experience”
Reviews.Author: PjtoursNashvilleTn
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience with the hotel, a couple of rooms with 3 guests had 1 bed. Several of my guest had to go to the front desk because there was no toilet paper in their Rooms!.Filthy carpet iin 2 rooms (1 was mine) bag delivered to wrong room, we have spent 3 hours looking for it!! Never again to the Iberville suites

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Hotel With Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BubbieTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a very spacious suite at an affordable price. This facility shares restuarant, health club, and spa facilities with the Ritz Carlton. A nice continental breakfast is included with the room. The breakfast area is quite roomy. The locaton was great as it was only 2 blocks off Bourbon street. We arrived early and checked our luggage. When we arrived late afternoon, our luggage was in the room. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: MadmanOntario
Reviews.Content: I looked for a while to find an affordable hotel in the French Quarter until I came across this one. I enjoyed it. It was older and had alot of character to it. The Breakfast we had once and it was good. They provided paper cups for coffee so you could run down to lobby in the morning to bring it up to the room. The pool and hottub were nice but wish they were outside. The only thing I felt was missing was a outdoor space to sit and enjoy the weather. But I do see how that is hard to come by in the French Quarter. Walked our butts off but with all the food and drinks needed it!

Reviews.Title: “Iberville Suites was sweet!”
Reviews.Author: ajcgocats
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Iberville Suites during the SEC basketball tourney. They allowed us early check-in - put all 3 couples together and made sure we were satisfied with the location of our rooms. Everything is close to the hotel - so walking was our best option - the continental breakfast was very good with plenty of seating and variety. Having the Ritz bar and restaurant connected made it easy to grab a bite or drink. Shelita Foe and Taurean Mingo were especially helpful and professional to us. We left a phone charger in the room and returned later that day to try and retrieve it. They were checking in a large group and someone was already in the room. They made phone calls and went up personally to retrieve the charger for us. All the while, keeping the new group moving and satisfied with their progress. Rooms were very clean, quiet and comfortable. Definitely will revisit next time we go to the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “overall good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IvanVi
Reviews.Content: This place has some pros and cons but I think the pros win. The location is excellent for it's proximity to Bourbon Street although a bit of a hoof to Jackson Square. I like walking so it was fine for me. The use of the Ritz facilities is a huge bonus. We used the gym and pool, plus charged drinks from the lounge to our room. The Iberville lobby is lovely and grande but has a very noticeable strange musty smell, not sure why since the Ritz smells fine and they are in the same building. ??? Air freshener or a scented candle would help.The rooms are a little run down but more than adequate for what you pay. The staff was helpful and not at all rude like some have stated. The breakfast was good enough. Someone earlier said there are no rollaway beds; this is not true. We used one because the pull out sofa had springs that stuck through the mattress so bad it felt like a medieval torture devise. Regardless of any negatives I've stated I would stay here again for the location, extra space and connection with the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: RonPatti L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and very much liked our room, service and atmosphere of the hotel. It is different to go thru 2 different elevators but it this was a vacation. The staff are helpfull and friendly. We would recommend this hotel and look forward to coming back to NOLA again. Prices were good and we utilized our AAA discount as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: cmbass
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff from the valet parking, bell hop, housekeeping and front desk were extremly helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and quiet. It is connected to the Ritz Carlton and so we were able to partake in their amenities. The indoor jacuzzi and resistance pool was a nice place to relax each evening after touring New Orleans. It is conveniently located. One block from Bourbon St and the Street Car pick up was right across the street. I understand that new furniture has been ordered for the rooms,but the furniture in the room was just fine. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Iberville OK but Showing Its Age”
Reviews.Author: Bushed77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Iberville Suites last year (Easter weekend) for 5 nights, because a sale price on Expedia made the trip more affordable than some other "name" hotels we were considering. No major complaints; the room was large, check-in was average, front door staff were usually around and helpful when available, and the computer near the front desk was helpful (a second one would be nice to avoid waits). We had an issue with the bathroom, which was fixed within the hour. Location was very good. Room seemed clean. Hotel felt safe. But the room was a little tired and worn and could use some freshening up (new carpet, a bit of paint, maybe a few furniture repairs/upgrades?). We might stay here again if the price is really competitive, but we're staying somewhere else for our next trip to NOLA this April, where we feel we can get better value for the money (no "special" available from Iberville when we booked for this year).

Reviews.Title: “Why pay Ritz prices”
Reviews.Author: Shain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Ritz; you enter through the Ritz front door (with the doorman opening the front door and saying "welcome back") and step into luxury all the way to your suite room, which is $100 cheaper than the non-suite room at the part of the building that is denominated "Ritz." The suite is big enough for a couple and a child; unfortunately they have no rollaways so you can't fit a second child. The bathroom is well-appointed although relatively small. The room has a refrigerator and coffee maker, a separate room with the sleep sofa that pulls out to become a single bed, and a full closet with a safe. It was very quiet and the beautiful Ritz lobby, shops and spa are available to you. Also, you get a free continental breakfast. The hotel is a block from Bourbon street but still relatively quiet, and the Ritz internal outdoor courtyard is an oasis of peace and calm. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great quarters on the Quarter for good price.”
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Iberville Suites which borders Canal Street and Iberville St. which is the first street of the French Quarter . Of course parking cost is $30. a night, but you can come in and out as much as you like. One may not need to go in and out since you are right in the center of all the activity. This location is walking distance to everything and the street cars are all on Canal Street; so there is a parking facilty across the hotel for $20.00 a night but you cannot come & go. The friendlist staff were the valets. They always know where the good food is. The front desk staff, however, never looked up or said "hello". All business. The suite was clean and nice with a nice elegance. This hotel shares the building with the "Ritz-Carlton"; so we actually walked in through their doors most of the time. We got a great rate for our stay during Spring Break week in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “old, dirty and grumpy”
Reviews.Author: RXMAN2
Reviews.Content: Saw this 4 star and suites and attached to big name hotel so thought even though $299 per night, worth it. I was so wrong. Arrived and while 3 doormen talked, struggled into the building with 2 suitcases and a heavy camera bag. Got up stairs to the main desk and hardly a smile. Went to my room and the carpeting was soiled, the bathroom was old and the TV was from the Dick Van Dyke era. Also the suite part was very small and as I was planning some entertaining, went back down to the desk and asked for larger room. She did not say a word to me but handed me a new key. Went to the larger room which was good but everything else the same..stained rug, old furniture, old fashioned bathroom, old tv. A real disappointment. Well, I thought, at least I get a "free" breakfast. When I went down the next morning, the breakfast consisted of coffee, juices and bagels...that's it. I have had better at Comfort Inn. Throughout my 4 nights, the staff was very unfriendly and I have to assume the management does not care. Stay away. It is an overpriced hotel and I just don;t get the ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cheetahtraveler
Reviews.Content: The location here is excellent. Its just a block away from Bourbon Street in the French Quarter, so it is a little quieter here at night. The lobby is beautiful, but the rooms are definitely quite old and dated. A little renovation, especially in the bathrooms would take the rating up a notch.

Reviews.Title: “3 Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: thepearofus
Reviews.Content: lovely 3 day stay at the Iberville Suite in the French Quarter.Lots of room. Enjoyed and used the Ritz Swimming pool and facilities every day Free Continental breakfast in the lobby every morning till 10am Staff very friendly and helpfull offering advise on where to visit Enjoyed our stay and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Location: great; the room: ehh”
Reviews.Author: elpaso_big_family
Reviews.Content: I was excited to be close to the French Quarter. The lobby of this hotel is beautiful. Check-in was flawless. I made my way to my room, opened the door, and turned on the disappointment. I was hoping the room was going to be as gorgeous as the lobby but no. The TVs were the old tube types - no big deal. The bathroom was alright. It was cramped with an old plain-jane tub. The bed had a big depression in it so that when you slept you rolled into the low spot. Hopefully they renovate and update old worn out mattresses. When I go back to the French Quarter I'll be looking for another place to stay. The continental breakfast was nothing to get excited about. Muffins, bagels and toast, cereal, juice and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good location however needs updating”
Reviews.Author: PeghandleMike
Reviews.Content: The lobby and common areas are well kept & are filled with grandiose furnishings. However,the rooms are showing their age and need sprucing up to say the least. The carpet and furnishings were worn. There was a large tear in our sofabed. TV's need to be upgraded to flatscreens. The interior rooms are quite dark and our exterior room overlooked deserted buildings and a parking lot. Also, had problems using the Wi Fi. On a positive note the beds and bedding were extremely comfortable. The water pressure was great with plenty of hot water. My interactions with the front desk found the personnel to be professional but not very cordial. Free breakfast was pretty good. It consisted of muffins, bagels, toast, coffee, milk, juice, etc. The hotel is located very close to Bourbon Street but is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: lololives
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent four nights at the Iberville Suites and overall we thought it was a good hotel. Our visit started off a little rocky because we had booked a double room and were given a single. We had booked through travelocity and were very lucky we had because they had records of our initial reservation and called on our behalf to straighten it out. I was annoyed that when we tried to correct the error ourselves we were told by the person at the front desk that there were no double rooms available but when travelocity called suddenly a double room was available. It was a bad start to feel like we'd been lied to or at the least the front desk had been unnecessarily uncooperative. Nonetheless, the problem was corrected and from then on everything went smoothly. The room itself was nice and I loved that there was a little divider between the two beds to give each person a little bit of privacy. The only thing that was bad about it though was that my sister couldn't see the television at all from her bed, so from a design perspective it was kind of stupid, but we didn't watch much TV anyway. The room was clean, comfortably and nicely decorated. The shower was great - and we showered twice a day because of the heat! The Iberville shares a building with the Ritz Carlton and it was cool having their spa and restaurants on site as well. We spent almost our entire vacation outside of the room and this was a good home base location because everything was in walking distance. Of course, what is within walking distance changes based on the weather and during our visit it was crazy hot and humid (especially coming from the Pacific Northwest) so some of the walks seemed long and exhausting. We were no more than a mile or so from any of the things we wanted to do in the French Quarter, but towards the end of our trip started using taxis for the short drives because it was so blasted hot. The hotel offered a continental breakfast each morning which we only tried twice but it was good. In fact the malted waffles were delicious. For a free breakfast it was great - they just had the standard stuff but it's always nice to get a free breakfast, though in New Orleans eating is so much a part of the trip we didn't want to waste it on yogurt and orange juice from concentrate! The hotel lobby is really nice and we sat and planned out our day a couple of times which was really fun. I would recommend this hotel if you're wanting to stay in the French Quarter for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you're looking to stay in the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: JENJG91
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay at the Iberville Suites due to being in New Orleans for the Rock n Roll Marathon. Had called and reserved a room with 2 double beds back in January. When we arrived for our stay, I was told they had no double rooms available but they could put us in a King suite which had a pull out sofa bed and they would give us a roll-a-way bed free of charge. The suite was definitely a very nice size. The furniture and decor were definitely outdated, but the room/linens/bathroom were clean, something I am extremely picky about when staying in hotel rooms. Staff was friendly, but we did have to call the front desk three times about bringing the roll-a-way bed up to the room for my youngest daughter. My other daughter slept on the pull out sofa which had an extremely thin mattress and was very uncomfortable. King size bed was pretty comfy. Location was very convenient to the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. We did not use the valet parking but instead parked in the public parking across the street from the hotel which was $24.00 per day. All in all an okay hotel if you only plan on staying 1-2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: BudGirl17
Reviews.Content: First, I will start with the positives, which are the people at the front desk and in their room service teams. They were extremely helpful and incredibly nice. They did the best they could to help us out and were always just as nice as could be, especially a gal named Shelita. With the problems I had with my hotel room and that of the others that stayed there, she tried her best to help us with the problems and was always just as nice as can be. She put the problems into the file under my record and asked me to follow up with the manager in the morning. She followed up with me on the problems in my room the following night when I called to let them know that they hadn't fixed the problem and there was water on the floor again as well as, the problems with the key cards that continuously ceasing work (even the one that stayed in my wallet the entire time wouldn't work) and she asked me to please speak with a manager before I left, which I was hesitant to, but did the day we were leaving. The Spa at the Ritz is absolutely incredible and I had a wonderful experience there. It is sort of attached to the Iberville Suites. Sadly, that's about all the positives that I can say for the hotel. The lobby or even the bathrooms in the lobby of this hotel don't represent the rest of the hotel AT ALL. Issues at the hotel: Two different days I had water all over the bathroom floor, due to a leaky faucet. James, from the Ritz, came over to try to help but told me it would be partial day job that they had to get inside my faucet. He said they'd be back during the day, the next day, to fix it. However, I came back from my meetings the following evening to a soaked bathroom floor again. The same night at the original water incident, I came back to find black soot and crumbles of 'something' all over my makeup and what I had on the little vanity in the bathroom. It ended up that they changed a light in the vanity and that was what came out of the light as they were unscrewing it and they just left it all over my makeup and such. The hotel itself is old and really needs to be updated. The beds were hard as rocks and after three days I am exhausted upon arriving home. The tv's are the huge old box tv's and four of my channels on the bedroom tv didn't even have sound! When I arrived on the first day, I had two dirty towels, with what looked like recent make up removal stains on them, were hung over the towel rack. It made me wonder if the sheets had been changed if the towels didn't look like they'd been washed. On the last day of our three day stay, I went to use one of the wash cloths and it took had stains on it that were extremely apparent that also looked, again, like ladies makeup removal stains. This picture is posted attached to the file. I tried to get a good picture but the lights were dim in the bathroom. For the conference that we were on, we were placed at this hotel and if I'd been able to transfer to another hotel (our convention was spread out at 6 or 7 different hotels) I would've moved and probably should've after my first night in this hotel. It truly is a shame because the team they have working there are so incredibly nice, it's just a shame that the product they are working with, isn't as nice. The day I left, I did speak to the front desk about the problems I had with my room, as Shelita had asked me to do, and the gal at the front desk tried for several minutes to find an available manager, but she couldn't find any of the managers that were on duty to help her, but the one thing she did do was to give me half off the first night I had the water problems. She was also incredibly nice about the problems. I think the team that works here is doing the best they can with what they have.

Reviews.Title: “Grat location for mardi gras fun”
Reviews.Author: Brieana1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite with another couple which made the $200 rate make sense. It was comfy and with a good breakfast included it worked well. The staff seemed a little over-worked when we were checking out and not all that ready to deal with guests. All in all a good option to see the French quarter and celebrate mardi gras.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price!”
Reviews.Author: jonts74
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before. Prices are always good (that was what attracted us there before). Location is 1 block from Bourbon & Canal Streets in the Quarter. The suite rooms are big enough for 3 to stay comfortably. Had 2 double beds and a pull out. The 2 queen rooms are not suites, but still had enough room for a roll-away bed and 3 could still room comfortably. Only complaint (did not impact us at all) was one of the rooms was missing both smoke detectors. Front desk staff has always been super friendly and helpful. Free breakfast is very nice - continental on steroids. Connected to the Ritz - which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Haven During Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Jhyatt7288
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Iberville Suites during Mardi Gras 2012. It was a great location--very close to Bourbon but far enough away for peace and quiet. The only downside was the valet service. It was extremely slow, but that's one of those things you have to expect during seasonal times. The hotel also provides a simple continental breakfast, which is a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Basic price, reasonable services and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Austinprogress
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Iberville just before Mardi Gras for 400 USD for 3 nights. Great location, perfect price-performance ratio. The non-stylish rooms are spacey enough, however dark: going to interior yards. Reasonable clean if you stay on a renovated floor (10th)!. Personnel is very friendly and helpful, where they can. This is a low service place, but if that's what you want you get it. Breakfast is all "plastic" and industrial, environmentally totally unfriendly with individual packages for cereals. Valet parking is expensive but very friendly and efficient, but you could park in the public space across the street as well. Some people complain: They don't have flat screen-TVs! Well, if you come to NOLA to watch TV you might consider better to stay home. (Cheaper and healthier).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with everything. The continental breakfast includes making ur own Belgian waffles. However, on our check out day, unable to get valet on the phone, so we went downstairs where we and others waited over 25 mins. With no one there. When employee did show he had no back up. Since this hotel is definitely associated with the Ritz-Carlton next door, we figured they must've needed the employees over there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: sheilah h
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay to enjoy New Orleans. If you want to be in the French Quarter and have a quiet place to sleep, the Iberville Suites is the perfect place. One block from Bourbon street and one block from Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Low price but low rent quality”
Reviews.Author: baustin5
Reviews.Content: A shadow of your former self. Last stayed here before Katrina. At one time was an excellent place to stay at a great price. Not so much anymore. Still a great location and the staff does the best they can with what they have. But the pleasant and helpful staff could not overcome old carpets, wall moulding held on by tape, stained and scuffed walls, rooms with outdated tv's and bathroom fixtures. Room lighting was dim and only made things that much more dreary. Still reasonably priced but no bargain. You now really get only what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: GinDandy
Reviews.Content: I am shocked this property share a building, spa, etc with the Ritz Carlton. With moderately high expectations, I found myself in a worn, dusty room with poor quality furnishings and linens. When I spoke to the front desk and complained about the state of the room, she said they were getting ready to renovate and offered to move me. My second room had newer furniture, but was so dusty, I could wipe my finger across the headboard and nightstand and leave a visible trail. I even called the Ritz to see if I could move over there since the front desk said the Ritz owned Iberville too (explaining the shared amenities). But the Ritz claimed they no longer owned it. Not sure what is going on here in terms of management, but I would not stay here again unless there was a total makeover. Plenty of cleaner properties for the same price in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Aaron G
Reviews.Content: I paid 104.00 per night which was actually a special rate because I am active duty military. Normally the room rents for upwards of 200.00 dollars. Let me say this was a complete letdown. First of all you need to take two(2) elevators to get to your room and don't get me started on the room... The carpets were old, the bed was saggy and smelled musky. I would compare this room to a super 8. Breakfast was included and while the main lobby screamed ritz-carlton, the breakfast was generic, reminiscent of a any 2-3 star hotel. Staff was friendly tho.... I will never stay here again. The last time I took a trip to new orleans I stayed at the Maison Dupuy. Excellent hotel, military friendly, wonderful breakfast and they just finished renovations if i'm not mistaken. Anyways, back to my trip, the second night I stayed at the new hyatt just outside the french quarter, the one in front of the superdome. I paid 94.00 for that sweet room thru the "name your own price" on priceline.com.... Had I known before hand i would have cancelled my reservations at the Iberville. Well that's my 2 cents.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, friendly staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chuck40Traveler
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, I booked a room at the Iberville Suites. The hotel has a great location to Bourbon Street. The staff was friendly. While the building was a little old, the room was well apportioned, clean, and the staff was very helpful. The room rate came with breakfast. It was more than continental including waffles and such so it was nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Ellen V
Reviews.Content: Great location - easy to walk to everywhere, but none of the noise! Spacious rooms, very affordable and while the complimentary continental breakfast isn't amazing, it's always nice to have a cup of coffee and something to nibble before heading out. The hotel has a relationship with the Ritz Carlton and so guests from Iberville use the fitness center at the Ritz. Also - the Jazz on Thursday night (also at the Ritz) was a really nice way to begin our evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room layout”
Reviews.Author: hydroxybear
Reviews.Content: Just finished up a stay at Iberville Suites from Jan 12 - Jan 15. The hotel has a great location, convenient access to bourbon street. The rooms have a great layout with a sitting area and then separate bedroom with a door in between. I must say the TVs in this place are OLD and need to be replaced. I am talking about 25" tube tv's... Continental breakfast was substantial enough with juice, waffles, muffins, bagels, etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to be close to the action at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suites”
Reviews.Author: staypuffed
Reviews.Content: Iberville suites offers nice suites for a decent price in French Quarter. The rooms could use a little updating, but are comfortable. The free continental breakfast is great and includes hot waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for a family of 6, but no pool for youngsters”
Reviews.Author: henno101
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the hotel was good too. The only think I would change was that the Hotel will NOT allow young kids in the pool!!! The breakfast in the lobby was included and worked great for all.

Reviews.Title: “Location Beats All”
Reviews.Author: scollins2003
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in this exceptionally well located hotel. It's not the Ritz, though it shares some services. Decent size rooms but generally needs updating. Not crazy about the moldy caulk in the tub (feels too much like home!) and was surprised by the dust on table tops. But the bed was great and while close to the action in the Quarter, was quiet and accessible. Staff was friendly and helpful. Deity e dust, it was an overall great value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “dirty old carpet, broken shower”
Reviews.Author: deborah c
Reviews.Content: close to everything is great but, rooms were dirty, broken shower head. changed the rooms 3 times,missing smoke alarms, dirty carpets, and peeling paints, mold around the bathtubs... I would not stay there again. I would find another hotel near by.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Sden43
Reviews.Content: If all you care about is location and a place to drop your stuff and shower you will be ok. This hotel shares common areas with the Ritz Carlton and that's about it! The service is great, common areas are clean and bright but the rooms are horrible! The carpet is dirty and spotted with stains, the furniture is old, dingy and beat up, the bed is sunk in to the middle, the water is slimy and the toilet randomly worked. At one point we moved the couch to look for a slipped cell phone and there was a rat trap behind the couch! This place made my skin crawl; not only will I NEVER stay there again, I would never recommend it to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the value. We Loved this hotel, and we will visit again.”
Reviews.Author: pamjam01
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park and Stay package. This is a good deal considering it's about $20 a day to park your car. You can use all the Ritz Carlton amenities. The Iberville is just steps away from one of the best Seafood restaraunts Deanies. Continental breakfast is good also. we had a 1bedroom suite that was very spacious. Bath and Bodyworks toiletries was a nice touch. I LOVE THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Conairaa
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect--just a few steps away from the heart of the French Quarter, close to the trolleys, Harrah's Casino.... There was absolutely no street noise or any other noise even though we were there for the 2012 Sugar Bowl. We booked a suite and it adequately slept three adults. The room was a bit dark, especially the sitting room. Both the bedroom and the sitting area has tvs, but they were both old--no flat screen HDTVs here. The furniture and carpeting were worn and tired, and the bed sheets were thin and in need of replacement. There were lots of towels but they were on the small side. The water in the shower was tepid, at best. The wireless internet didn't work after a few hours, and after spending 40 minutes or so on the phone with an expert, the best they could do was tell us to use the cable. When we asked about a partial refund they refused us. Internet was free in the lobby area, although it was very slow. The continental breakfast was unremarkable--muffins, bagels, fresh waffles, orange and apple juice, tea, and coffee. There was also yogurt, although many of the containers were past their expiration date. The location was so perfect that I would probably gladly choose to stay at this hotel again and deal with the tired furniture, spotty internet, and small towels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaB8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. We were a little nervous after reading reviews of people's cars getting damaged by the valet and carbon monoxide poisoning- but no such things happened to us. The room was very nice and the hotel staff was very friendly. The location was pretty central to everything in the Quarter. Getting our truck out from the valet was very quick at checkout. The room service menu offered is pretty extensive. There's also a great pay per view movie selection. The view from the room was pretty lame though- just a tarp on a roof. The elevator setup was kind of strange too- you have to take 2 elevators to get out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Amazing Location.”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off of bourbon st. The hotel a room with a king size bed and a fold out couch. So not a good room for 4 dudes. But you can get 2 rooms and be fine. It is connected to the ritz. The rooms are comfortable and reletivly large. Close to the party but quiet enough to sleep at night. I would recomend this hotel. Parking is about 30 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey...but what isn't?”
Reviews.Author: BayouPj
Reviews.Content: Great location....two short blocks off bourbon st in the French Quarter. Our room had a view of parking lot-so ask first for a better view. Decent continental breakfast is included. Waffles the only hot dish. Huge suite..all the amenities you would expect for the $. Very safe area- our only complaint was the fact that we had to pay $13 per day Internet...such a drag.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: ABitSpoiled
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is good, except that the rooms need a lot of updating and the hallways and common areas need some upkeep. Great place to stay if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: U2june
Reviews.Content: I recently went to New Orleans on business and needed a hotel room with adequate meeting space. I reserved a king suite at the Iberville Suites which included a separate living room with plenty of space for my meeting. The hotel is attached to the Ritx Carlton so you can use its spa and enjoy its restaurants as well. My suite was very large, clean and quiet. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl50
Reviews.Content: With all of the places to stay in New Orleans, it was very hard to choose somewhere to celebrate a birthday and anniversary weekend with friends. The Iberville Suites Hotel was offering special rates for the time we were there, so we tried it out for the first time. The location is great. In the French quarter, close to everything, but not on a main party route. Therefore, you could walk 2 blocks and be in the action of Bourbon Street, but not have to put up with the noise, etc. For the price, we had a nice room with a view of the river and free breakfast. I am not sure I would pay rack room rates, but if they have a special, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: hoffmanlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites for three nights in November 2011. We really enjoyed our stay. The employees were very nice and accomodating. The one hitch was that it took almost 30 minutes for our luggage to be brought to the room. The other thing I did not like was having to take two elevators to get to your room. You enter this hotel through the parking garage. The location was great! Very close to the Quarter and to Canal street. Our room was nice and quiet! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: toadsoup
Reviews.Content: Three of us women stayed at the Iberville Suites mid-November and found our stay quite pleasant. Only one of us used the gym at the Ritz (I actually never even went to that side of the building). But she did say the gym was nice. Despite our proximity to Ritz Carlton, there were separate entrances/ elevators. One has to take an elevator to the "lobby" and then another set of elevators to the rooms. Guess there was another row of elevators on the other side of the lobby which took you to the lobby/gym of the Ritz. Doesn't matter. We weren't in the room for long periods anyway during our 4-day stay. The staff was nice, but the lobby attendants could have been more helpful.
