Needed some change from a $20 to tip the maids (during check-out) and had to wait a 1/2 hour for someone coming into the morning shift to make change. Hmmm. Also, don't know if all hotels in NOLA are like this, but no bathroom fan? Rather have that, than another light switch to illuminate the tub. If more than two people are traveling, do stay in the double suite, I believe. Not particularly roomy for 3 adults, but doable and you could close the door between the two rooms. Hotel was clean, quiet and very close to everything in the French quarter. The French Market is about a mile away, but the blocks are relatively short and you can walk there in about 20 minutes, if that. Canal street, with its streetcars, was only about 2 blocks away, very convenient for our trip to the Garden District. All in all, enjoyed the hotel and its proximity to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: dmgehring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites over Thanksgiving weekend with our 12 year old daughter. The location was in the French Quarter and close to everything, but far enough away that we heard no street noise. Being able to use the gym and spa at the Ritz was great. Also liked being able to quickly grab coffee or toast at the breakfast each morning. We reserved a double room but after seeing how small the beds were, we asked to move into a suite with a pull out bed. It was much better and my daughter enjoyed having her own space. Overall, I think this hotel is a good value. It is a little dated, but very clean and the staff are extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: edgemo
Reviews.Content: We got a discount rate and it was perfect for the short time we were in town. The location is attached to the Ritz Carlton and is on the edge of the French Quarter. It is across the street from one of our favorite restaruants. The room was clean and well appointed. It is a little dated but we did not spend much time in the room. The valet staff were indifferent if not rude but the front desk people were excellent. The continental breakfast was typical but fine for what it was. All in all it was a good value in a city that can be expensive. The front desk person upgraded us to a King sized bed, but we did have to ask to get the parking rate quoted on line.

Reviews.Title: “Great as Always”
Reviews.Author: poloboy
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Iberville Suites while on a business trip. Have stayed at Omni, Monteleone and Iberville while on past vacations and they all have their pluses. But I really like the extra comfortable space you get at Iberville after a day of walking a conference or sightseeing. Location is nice and you feel safe on the well travelled streets surrounding the area. Always clean and staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: Licha_on_the_go
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice now at Iberville Suites for the French Quarter Jazz Fest. It is in a great location in the quarter. There is not a lot of traffic noise and the place is relatively quiet. Easy short walk to where you want to go in the quarter or to catch the trolley. The included breakfast ranges from fruit, cereal, & yogurt to waffles. Staff are nice. You can even head over to the Ritz and sit in their lounge or outdoor patio enjoying drinks from the bar. Can't wait to come back to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for first time visit”
Reviews.Author: vyaduck
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to NOLA and wanted to stay in or close to the French Quarter. Iberville Suites was running an excellent deal during the summer. The location was good on the outer border of the quarter and nothing was more than a 10 minute walk away. The room was nicely appointed with a sitting area (couch, desk, TV, refrigerator and sink) and a bedroom with a queen bed and large flat screen TV. The hotel offered a continental breakfast that was heavy in carbohydrates but was quite good for grab and go before exploring. I found the staff to be quite helpful. The Iberville shared space with the Ritz-Carlton so we were able to use the Ritzâ€™s gym and pool. I found the Ritz part to be disappointing, too much chlorine in the pool and the gym was dirty. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First time in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: iseort
Reviews.Content: First time visiting NOLA and am always worried about how the hotel will actually be. Have to say that all the comments on this site were pretty accurate. The hotel is very well maintained. The room isn't updated with the latest and greatest but it was nice and clean which I think are very important. Loved that they had a mini fridge and a separate sitting area with a door to close so I can sleep in while my husband is an early riser. The continental breakfast was perfect for us lazy folks to go get something and go back to the room and relax before we headed out. Used the concierge at the Ritz and they were very helpful in helping us book tours. All the staff was pleasant and always greeted us as we walk by. Perfect location to Bourbon street. Glad we were close enough to walk back late at night but never heard any of the noise. Close to everything to either walk or take the trolly. Beautiful city with beautiful people. NOLA took my heart.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DebJ14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night of October 5, 2010 at the Iberville Suites. We were attending an event at the Ritz Carlton, but the Ritz Carlton could not accomodate. 1/3 of the rooms at the Ritz Carlton were closed due to changing out the carpets, drapes, bedding etc. The reservations agent at the Ritz Carlton suggested the Iberville Suites and she made the reservation for us. We were astounded at the $129.00 rate for the King Suite. We had room 508 overlooking the roof. It was nice having a separate bedroom and the 2 televisions. The bed was comfortable. There were a few small issues, such as mildew in the shower caulk and grout, the towel racks coming out of the wall, and the GFCI tripping whenever anyone took a shower . That prevented the hair dryer from working until you reset the GFCI and the breaker on the hair dryer itself. The big issue was the inability to lower the thermostat to a more comfortable temperature. The room was very warm but the temperature could not be lowered, nor could the fan speed be increased. The room was designated non-smoking so we were surprised to see a cigarette burn in the bedspread. At check in we noticed The Market just next to the front desk. We planned to pick up a few snacks when we came back from dinner, but The Market was closed and there was no one at the front desk. It was only 8:00pm. We did not eat the Continental breakfast because everything contained gluten and we are on GF diets. We walked over to the Ritz Carlton and had the American Breakfast. The service was slow, but the food was good. When we returned to our room around 8:15am I tried to call the front desk to ask about late check out. The phone rang 10 times with no answer. I tried several more times and never could get anyone at the front desk to answer the phone. We checked out at noon and left our bag with the bellman. He noted that we would return at 3pm and would need a taxi to the airport. When we came back at 3pm he quickly got our bag and led us to the taxi With just a little more attention to detail this hotel would definitely rank higher. For those on a budget it is a good option, but when you are used to staying at the Ritz Carlton it just doesn't measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scooby1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good value. The big advantages are it's location and the free continental breakfast. The bedrooms are comfortable and the reception staff are always friendly. I was very impressed with this hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY ENJOYABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: 295Traveler
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this place. Rooms are perfect for two people. Having the bedroom and living room separated is a plus. Friendly staff, comfortable bed, 2 tvs and 2 phones. One phone was not working very well but not a big deal. I like that the frig was empty. Not full of the overpriced hotel drinks. Great location, close to street cars, bars, food. Iberville is shared with the Ritz so we enjoyed drinks at their bar. The maze to get to Iberville from the Ritz side is a little confusing but it made for an adventure. Would DEFINITELY come back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “An old but very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: evilberry
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the end of August and had a wonderful time. We arrived earlier than the check-in time (9:30AM) and the concierge was able to check us in. They upgraded one of our rooms for free and gave us larger disabled rooms (they were the only unoccupied ones). The rooms were nice and large but you can see its a but worn out. The complimentary breakfast was nice and fulfilling. However, no meat were served. Iberville is owned and connected to the Ritz Carlton so you can use their facilities. The pool and gym is complimentary. I did not notice any insects or had any problems with the two rooms we had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bluesfanEastSussex
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay here. Suite accomodation which was great as my husband and i were travelling with our 18 year old son. The hotel is in a good location. We enjoyed having a drink in the Ritz Carlton lounge after dining out and visiting bourbon st ( son cant wait to go back with his mates when hes 21!!!). Good breakfast clean and comfortable beds. We all enjoyed our stay at the Iberville would defo recommend and hopefully if we return to New Orleans would re book.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Large Rooms, Lots of Broken Stuff.”
Reviews.Author: Johnp1126
Reviews.Content: Decnet Clean Suite, great location, nice staff. Room was a disaster. Wires coming out of the ceiling where the smoke detector is supposed to be. The diverter in the tub only diverted about half the water to the shower so by the time you were done you were standing in several inches of water, the cold water on the sink did not work at all. One of the lamps the socket was hanging by its wires. We reported the issues and when we got back to the room a few hours later there was a card from Maintenance telling us to call front desk and switch rooms. Only thing they fixed was the lamp. (probably just replaced it) A call from the front desk I think would have been more appropriate, we just toughed it out, did not feel like packing up again. If the room was not in shambles would be a 3.5 or 4 star hotel. it was clean, quiet, we had use of the Ritz Carlton gym and spa, free cold breakfast, nice lobby and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ilovevegasbaby
Reviews.Content: We visted New Orleans over Labor Day, during Tropical Storm Lee. The hotel was our little oasis of comfort after being wet, wet, wet all day. Our friends found a great price for this hotel several months ago. They had stayed there before so they knew what to expect. They knew the price we were paying was a good deal. This was a pretty spacious suite for New Orleans from what I understand. If you compare it to other larger suites in other cities you might be a bit disappointed by the size. We felt there was plenty of room. There were just two of us in the room, but we could have fit four in this room without a problem. The front area had a desk, a fold out couch, a tv, a wet bar and a very good little fridge (great to have cold water before you go to bed at night). The bathroom was on the small side, but I have seen MUCH smaller bathrooms when traveling so I was not bothered by this at all. The bedroom area had another desk, an armoire which held the tv and a nice king size bed with lots of pillows and two nightstands. There was still plenty of room to walk around the bed. The other great thing about this room was the bedroom was at the back of the room so you were far away from "hall noise". We only heard one group on one night, but they quickly moved on. The only complaint I really had was the suite was pretty dark. They had lots of lamps, but they gave off low light. This was our second trip to New Orleans and for a similar price we had a very, very tiny room last time. We were very happy with this one. The hotel staff was fine. They were not overly friendly, but they were far from rude. The hotel lobby is nice. This is where they have their breakfast area. We did not try their breakfast though as we went out to eat each morning, but it looked like many people enjoyed it. We also did not try the pool or hot tub. After being so wet all weekend we wanted to stay dry :). While it isn't that far off of Bourbon St., it is at the far end. We did have to walk a lot and take things with us that we might need during the day so we didn't waste time trecking back to the hotel. I prefer to stay at the other end of Bourbon St., but would not hesitate to stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms, friendly staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: 3momstraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms have a very large sitting area with desk, loveseat, chair. There is a wet bar with a good sized refrigerator and a decent sized bedroom. We didn't use the pull out couch so I don't know if it was comfortable. The decor is nice, the room was clean, and the staff were all friendly and helpful. The location is great; one block off of Canal and one block from Bourbon Street. We easily walked to Harrah's, the World War II museum, The French Quarter, etc. The breakfast in the morning was pretty good - waffles, bagels, toast, muffins, cereal, instant grits, apples and bananas, juice and coffee. There is an IHOP around the corner on Canal St. if you want more. We had difficulty regulating the temperature of the shower, but it wasn't a big deal. We'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in The French Quarter- all suites”
Reviews.Author: shoppingst
Reviews.Content: Great suites in the French District. Beautiful building adjacent to the Ritz Carlton. Rooms a little worn but spacious. A room for the bedroom and a living space with fold out couch. Great Breakfast. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: deanna H
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on the rooms at Iberville and when we arrived, we thought we knew why, there was construction going on on the street in front of the hotel and you could not see the front, plus it was difficult to find the entrance. However, when we got in, it was wonderful!! It was a beautiful hotel, it shares amenities with the Ritz Carlton which has a great gym and resistance pool. Everyone was very helpful, the continental breakfast was great, our room was beautiful, we had a master suite with a wetbar and a separate living area with a sleeper sofa and another tv. We had a wonderful trip and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a "suite."”
Reviews.Author: cordeliajsmith
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and his two boys and I, booked this hotel to stay at while we were attending a wedding in New Orleans. While the hotel itself is adequeate, the term "suites" in their title and room descriptions is very deceptive. I searched for a room suitable for 4 people to sleep in and this IS NOT IT. We booked this room based on the description of the extra room for the boys to sleep in. The extra "room", is a tiny alcove that fits a pull out couch that is slightly larger than a twin sized bed, but not as big as a double. Not suitable for 2 people to sleep on. Even two small people. Our alcove wasn't even big enough for the couch to be pulled out. Fully extended, the bed hit the cabinet the tv was on. We called the front desk and they assisted us with moving the couch. It was a little bit comic. We had arrived late our first night, so just made due with an extra pullout bed, but the next day were shown rooms exactly the same as our first, so we just stayed put. All of the rooms come with a pull out couch in a tiny room smaller than the bathroom. Nice bathroom though!

Reviews.Title: “A great affordable hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: shopper35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites two weeks ago and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a king suites that had lots of room for a hotel in the French Quarter. Our bed was comfortable but our kids did not enjoy the pull out sofa. They are going to remodel soon so I think the sofabed might have been a bit old. The furniture and decorating in the rooms are just average but we sure enjoyed the space and having two TVs. The lobby is nice and the continental breakfast is a good extra. We enjoyed using the fitness center and pool at the Ritz. Also, the location is wonderful! I loved being able to walk around the Quarter and having restaurants near. We will stay here the next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Decadence!”
Reviews.Author: froggie901
Reviews.Content: Was staying here for Southern Decadence! It was great place! Couldn't ask for better! Super comfy beds! A knockout brunch! A very small, and cozy pool and hottub area! Couldn't ask for better service from the concierge! Didn't send us to any of those touristy locales! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Doina C
Reviews.Content: We had a nice apartment, quite spacious, good amenities. Great breakfast, wi-fi, nice bathroom, decent views. Staff not very helpful or friendly. Not the best value: quite on the expensive side, but it seems that NO is like that anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 3.5”
Reviews.Author: Surely_U_Jest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Labor Day Weekend. Booked through Hotels.com. The rate was $119 per night. At that price, the property exceeds expectations. At $200 a night I might have been more critical. Room was clean and spacious with a comfortable king bed and separate sitting room with a pull-out sofa. Standard hotel bathroom. Room is starting to show its age. Breakfast was included and its your standard "suite" hotel fare...make your own waffles, bagels/muffins full of preservatives, coffee that could have been better. As another poster mentioned, the property does have a relationship with the Ritz Carlton which is adjacent (no need to exit to street.) We made good use of the Ritz lobby lounge/bar. You can charge to your Iberville room at the Ritz. The Iberville Suites actually shares its wireless internet with the Ritz as well. Here's a money saving tip. If you connect from your room, the cost is $12.95 per day. If you connect in the lobby, you get one day free and it will continue to work in your room. When it expires, just go back to lobby and re-login. Not sure why, but does it matter? Convenient access to Bourbon Street and French Quarter. Quiet area. No shuttle service from airport. Cab is flat rate of $33. The place was designed for a frugal, slightly discerning traveler. There were no children anywhere to be seen. :-)

Reviews.Title: “The facilities of the Ritz Carlton at a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Faygelah
Reviews.Content: We were here for the Southern Decadence/ Labor Day Weekend and got a good deal on hotels.com. The rooms are very comfortable and large: sitting area w/TV and fold-out sofa, wet bar w/ refrigerator, king-size bed and another TV, smallish but serviceable bathroom without a lot of counter space. Overall, it was a great value. The furnishings were old, cigarette burn hole in the sofa, another cigarette burn on the blanket. Our porter told us the whole place was getting a major renovation from Marriott. The hotel is in a great location. In the French Quarter, but far enough from the crowds. And at the Iberville suites you get to use the facilities of the Ritz-Carlton next door. Thereâ€™s a breakfast in the morning, but itâ€™s nothing to write home about when youâ€™re in New Orleans. Muffins and coffee and bagels and waffles.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: ccampanile
Reviews.Content: great location...2 blocks from Bourbon street. the french quarter is so easy to walk around...so as long as you are in the french quarter, you'll be fine. we used their pool, which is The Ritz Carlton's pool...very nice pool without that humidity you usually get from an indoor pool. we were here in august so the pool is a must and we were glad it was indoors because the temperature was just right, not hot like the outdoor pools.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay......”
Reviews.Author: Robert H B
Reviews.Content: Iberville Suites is a wonderful hotel at an accessible location to the French Quarter and Warehouse District. This was my second visit to the Iberville and maybe my 6th visit to NOLA. The staff was once again helpful and courteous. The included continental breakfast was very good, if crowded. Some mornings it was difficult to gain a seat. The connection to the Ritz Carlton and the use of the gym facility (free) was a big plus. We also enjoyed the Jazz Club at the Ritz. We arrived for our stay early in the morning and were immediately checked into our room. The room unfortunately was occupied by a smoker-not supposed to be. The staff had an ozone filter operating when we arrive to help alleviate the odor. The rate was very reasonable and I will make another visit and stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “2nd good stay here”
Reviews.Author: ReadytoTravel51
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel. They share a building with the Ritz Carlton and the hotel as easy access to the spa, lounges, etc. offered by the Ritz. It is always clean, friendly and has a great free breakfast every morning. The location is great. They were doing a little construction this visit so valet parking was a little cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value for a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: See2020
Reviews.Content: The Iberville Suites shares its building with The Ritz-Carlton New Orleans. You're able to use the service of either. The location is fantastic!... right in the French Quarter. Noise is not an issue. Parking... (if you think you need it) is right there .... including valet!... We paid $169/night plus taxes, etc.... And it was large suite with a separate bedroom... very rare for New Orleans, where I was quoted a higher price for a tiny room at a name brand upscale hotel.... Went for a 2 couple friends long weekend getaway... just PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Characterful hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Joybells1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights - our neighbours on Saturday night were noisy, but that applied in the whole of new Orleans! Communal areas were large and full of character. Just a couple of gripes - the wireless Internet was frustratingly slow and kept logging us out, and the bath plug wouldn't stay in! Other than that, it was brilliant - excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: AroundTheWorld738310
Reviews.Content: NIce location, nice staff, good breakfast, but the hotel is old, dirty,and unkempt..we had to change room in the first one we had bed bugs, we were itchy all the night long and in the morning my husband had bites all over his neck. The second room was almost the same..both bathrooms not clean and a lot of hairs in the sink and shower. During the night drunk people walking around with no control. We will not be back ever again. Ps. we had a king suite the max that you can have there and our 18mo son was with us!!

Reviews.Title: “Room theft, no resolution. Mariott has lost our entire corporation. Do not stay at Iberville.”
Reviews.Author: paulforkfly
Reviews.Content: We spent over $2,500 at Iberville last month for 3 rooms during a trade show. I just got off the phone with Maria Mills, GM of Iberville Suites and am utterly astonished by what I just went through. On my final day at Iberville I noticed that my Bose headsets I'd been using in the room were missing. I immediately went down to the front desk to speak with management. They had a "loss prevention" official on site who came to the room, saw the empty Bose case, and mentioned to me that room thefts did occur at Iberville. They created a claim number with Mariott. Once I returned home I got a call from Mariott a week later stating they were investigating the claim. The woman on the phone was incredibly rude and took the time to tell me that they did not assume any level of liability for room break ins. Just today, nearly three weeks after my trip, the GM of Iberville called and said Mariott denied the claim. He said he'd credit back one night to us, which is $129. Mr. Mills and the Mariott Corporation miss the point entirely. We spent over $2,500 at that hotel alone. We frequently stay at Mariott hotels for business. Over a $299 set of headphones, something that could have been resolved in a moment, they have lost us for life. Ok, so about the hotel on the whole. On day 1 I arrived at the room and the smoke detector was beeping regularly from a low battery. I called downstairs and they said they'd send someone within minutes. Over an hour later I called down again. The woman at the front desk said, "I don't know anything about it." They had apparently gone through a shift change, and nobody had noted my call. 30 minutes later, they repaired it. Also, wifi throughout the hotel was down during that first day. They sent a staff member to my room to troubleshoot for an hour with me. Concierge was the only plus. Very friendly people down there. So, to summarize. Iberville and Mariott don't value customers. Hours of phone calls, and zero resolution. Room thefts happen at Iberville with some regularity. In addition to my loss, the gentleman who visited my room had a notepad full of individuals who'd complained of theft. Yes, Mariott & Iberville...settling this 'claim' would have represented $299 of your hard earned cash. Instead you chose to end a 3 year old relationship with my company. I recommend that you look elsewhere if you're considering the Iberville.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in the French Quarter, so close to everything”
Reviews.Author: gadgetgeek
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely stay there again. We had a nice room during Tales of the Cocktail 2011 and were both pleased with our room and our service. The Bell Desk outside took care of us catching cabs, picking up other people and directing us to places were had on our schedule. The front desk folks were very nice and knew our names from the first day in the hotel, speaking to us as we walked in or out in a very cordial manner. We have nothing but praise for the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: TVChick16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our 13th anniversary celebration. We got a great deal on hotels dot com of $69 per night. We arrived on July 4th and had a rental car. We could not find the entrance at first and then realized the entrance was under construction. The only thing we saw was a valet stand for the Ritz Carlton. We parked our car in a garage around the corner that we had coupons for (was supposed to make parking $10 per night... but the machine was programmed not to accept the coupon code on holidays... we found free street parking for the night since meters aren't in effect on holidays and then got up early the next morning and moved our car to the Amtrak lot which was a 20 minute walk, but worth it since it was only $5 per night). The Ritz Carlton bellman showed us to the entrance to the Iberville Suites (which is right next to the Ritz Carlton entrance) and told us to take the elevator up one floor to the Iberville Suites lobby. Upon entering the lobby I was very impressed. From previous reviews I thought it was going to be small and dark, but it was just the opposite. There was a lot of marble in the open spacious lobby. The desk clerk checked us in and pointed us towards the elevator. We had a room on the 9th floor. I was once again pleasantly surprised by the spaciousness and the view! Upon entering the room you are in a living room with a desk, couch and TV. There was a wet bar and mini fridge on the left and a bathroom on the right and you pass through another doorway to the bedroom. (It reminded me of an Embassy Suites layout.) We had a northern facing view of the city. The location of this hotel is ideal. It was great to walk out the door and be on Bourbon Street in just a couple minutes! This proved to be valuable when we had leftover food or other purchases that we wanted to bring back to the hotel and then go out again. Since we were there for 4th of July we walked to the riverfront to watch the fireworks. We also walked to Cafe du Monde, to the Riverwalk shops, the Steamboat Natchez, and the St. Louis #1 cemetery. Once again, GREAT location! Breakfasts in the morning were adequate. The lobby area is spacious enough that we always had a place to sit. As with most hotels the breakfast was a carb-fest, but that's to be expected. You could make your own waffles with a special fleur-de-lis imprint! There were cereals, oatmeal, grits, muffins, bagels, pastries, fruit, yogurt, coffee, tea, milk, juice, etc. You have full free access to the Ritz Carlton facilities upon staying at the Iberville Suites. The gym is great... there is one room with weight machines and another room with cardio machines. There is also a studio room where you could stretch or do yoga. When you use the gym, you are provided with headphones to use if you want them. Towels and bottles of water are also provided. (There were even moist towels and cucumbers for your eyes!) The pool and hot tub are also located in the gym. We used the gym but didn't have a chance to take advantage of the pool or hot tub. If you have your own laptop, free wifi access is provided in the lobby (not in the room). The one night that my husband tried to get online the internet was totally down though. There is one computer in the lobby that you can use, but the internet service is pretty slow. The next time we are in New Orleans, we will try and book this hotel again. We had SO much fun in New Orleans and the location, staff and amenities of the Iberville Suites were a big part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: rachel4bama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We absolutely loved it and would certainly come back. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and always clean. We loved the breakfast each morning - especially the waffle maker! The hotel was quiet despite its location near Bourbon Street. We were able to walk to everything very easily. Be sure to go next door to the Ritz Carlton to try out the hot tub and resistance pool. They also have a nice workout area. Our only complaint was about the water pressure in the shower, but that is not a big deal. I recommend the Acme Oyster House, which is close to the hotel. You might have to wait but the food is great! If you are like me, you spend a lot of time reading hotel reviews before booking. You can book this hotel with confidence! We were certainly not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Again”
Reviews.Author: Newlins1
Reviews.Content: Trip to New Orleans to visit family. This week didn't have a scheduled festival so venues weren't crowded. You could walk Bourbon Street without bumping into people. Iberville desk is always helpful. Love the valet guys. One thing we noticed this time is their wireless connection was expensive. They do have ONE computer near the front desk which is free but the connection is very slow and most often occupied. There isn't any pool if you have to have one for the kids. Got an awesome price from hotels.com. Watch for specials. Looks like they are doing some room renovation which will be beneficial. The pull-out is not comfortable. But will definitely stay again any time.

Reviews.Title: “My new go to hotel......”
Reviews.Author: trvln_d_wrld
Reviews.Content: There are many hotel choices in the French Quarter and I have to say, this is top of the line. I have stayed in several New Orleans hotels but this hotel ranks #1. We arrived @ 10:30 (expecting to have to wait around until about 4:00 pm to check in). The front desk agent saw that we were exhausted and let us check-in upon arrival. She was so friendly and accommodating. Because I am OCD about bathrooms, I immediately did an inspection. I FOUND NOTHING. Everything was sparkling clean. I pulled back the covers expecting to find hair and spots on the sheets...NOTHING. Actually, the sheetss felt so soft and clean. It was great gettiing into such a comfortable bed and refreshingly cool room after touring in the heat all day. I was concerned that there were 20-somethings on one side of me and childen on the other.....I did not hear anything. All of the hotel staff were friendly. Every morning, I was greeted. The expanded continental breakfast was very filling. There are restaurants nearby. However, the bar and restaurant in the adjoining Ritz Carlton were exceptional. All of the common areas were kept immaculate. It's obvious customer comfort is definitely a priority. Everytihng (i.e. Bourbon and Canal Streets) is within a 10 minute walk. The French Market and Cafe du Monde are about a 15 minute walk. So, if you want paradise close enough to Bourbon Street but not the crowds.....this is definitely your place.

Reviews.Title: “OK but a bit far from the convention center”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: Was recently at a conference and this hotel was listed as one of the conference hotels. Overall, the hotel is OK although the area directly to the north of the hotel is very sketchy. Finding the entrance to the hotel can be a challenge because while it is associated with the Ritz-Carlton, there is no direct entrance from there. The hotel is within walking distance of the convention center, but it is quite a long walk and definitely not recommended in summer! The room was OK albeit a bit dated. Room was quiet although the internet, which was advertised as being free, is not free anymore. You are charge Ritz rates of $12.95 a day, which is a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice room - needs better air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: atomise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off the end of Bourbon Street, so from a location viewpoint it is perfect. We were in a suite which consisted of a small lounge room with TV, fridge and sink area. The bedroom was small but not cramped. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The only gripe I have about the hotel is that the air conditioning was very weak. New Orleans in July is very hot and humid and we could never get the air conditioning to be cold enough so that you really noticed the difference. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. but I expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: garyrc
Reviews.Content: Located in the corner of the French Quarter, the Iberville Suites is reasonably convenient to the majority of the Quarterâ€™s restaurants, but is not as convenient as the hotels closer to the river for conventioneers and for touring. It is a long hike to the Morial Convention Centerâ€”well over a mile, and about a half-mile to most of the typical tourist areas like the river and Jackson Square. On the other hand, even though it is just one short block from Bourbon St., the hotel is extremely quiet from the hubbub; not many hotels so close can offer that. I always feel safe walking in most of the Quarter and this location feels safe as well and it is one block from Canal Street. My queen suite was on the 10th floor, facing the faux inner courtyard (i.e., no view except the neighborsâ€™ windows, but with good light from the large window). The suite was smaller than I expected. A medium-sized bathroom (with good water pressure), closet, and small bar area (sink and refrigerator) divide the bedroom and the living area. There is a tube television with expanded basic satellite (with HBO) in both rooms. Public areas like the lobby and hallways are attractive and in fine shape. The room was clean with good housekeeping, but the carpet was faded and the furniture was quite nicked-up. It had a pull-out couch, but lacked any other soft chair, even though there would have been room for one. The living room area has no window and is very dark, and noise from the hall is surprisingly intrusive. The bedroom is very quiet, however. The central air conditioner had good comfort adjustability. The main bed was firm and comfortable enough, but not up to the standards now showing up at other mid-range hotels. And that represents the issue with the Iberville Suites: it is not a four-diamond hotel as AAAâ€™s rating would suggest, but just a typical three star/three diamond hotel with average amenities. It is not as special as one would expect considering its pedigree of being in the Ritz Carlton family. I noticed there is a microwave oven near the ice machine. This was a surprise to see, and is another issue with the hotel: there is no information in the room explaining services or even fees (such as the internet fee, spa fee, the lone guest computer in the lobby), or even how to maneuver around the hotels. (The Ritz opens onto Canal St., the Iberville onto Iberville St., and the Maison Orleans somewhere in this complex too, but they are all inter-connected inside.) Reasons to consider: if the price is better than other hotels, if the divided room with a couch is appealing, if the pedestrian continental breakfast food suits you, if swimming is not important. Reasons to look elsewhere: internet in the room is $12.95 a day, the continental breakfast is limited and low in protein; the room is small, the small pool is part of the Ritzâ€™s health club. The two-stage entrance (elevator to the lobby, down the hall, elevator to room) bothers some people, but is found elsewhere in city hotels and not that bad of a problem. I donâ€™t think this hotel is particularly suitable for children, it just has an adults-only feel about it. I realized later that I could have stayed down the street at a good hotel for $34 a night less and that place included internet. The savings would have bought a nice healthy breakfast of my choosing every day with money to spare. The Iberville Suites wasnâ€™t bad, it was just a disappointment from my expectations considering the price. The Iberville Suites might be a good bet for you but only if the price is right and your expectations are in line with what it offers. It is essential to consider all your options and pricings: you may well do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here! Still a cool place to be.”
Reviews.Author: chaunysan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during July 4 weekend and Thanksgiving weekend. Room was clean, loved the location and shortcut you can take through the Ritz. All of the staff were friendly. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Kayeab
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, my friends and I were a little nervous about our stay due to the hotel's entrance. You enter the Iberville Suites from what looks like the rear of the building. You also must take the elevator up to the second floor where the reservation desk is located. It seemed odd but once we got passed the outside it was great. The staff was kind and helpful and the room was nice and spacious. It looked exactly like the photos on the website. Besides the room and service, the location was to die for. If you go to New Orleans to party and most people do, you'll be in heaven. It's literally steps away from Bourbon and/or Canal street(s) and you'll find the action in no time. Everything is pretty much within walking distance. If you're worried about the noise from Bourbon St being so close - don't. It's a super quiet hotel...you'll forget there's a party going on down the street! Also if you're looking for tours or answers on how to get around the city, the concierge at the Ritz-Carlton, which is adjoined to Iberville Suites is more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Jdrubin
Reviews.Content: Often enough I read negative reviews and think that the reviewer is spoiled, lame, or lacks any sort of normal perspective. I hope people think I sound normal enough and take their business to a different hotel in Nola. It will just improve your trip. Problems: - Too expensive for level of quality: superficially, it looks nice inside (and that is ignoring the under-construction exterior). However, the room had no snack bar, an empty mini-fridge that was in college-party-house condition, a big stain on the room door, scuffed and damaged wood below the fridge, very little space (we ordered a "suite" but it was the size of a normal room) and an abysmal fold-out bed. - Service: the staff were terrible. The truth is that they didn't seem very bright-- sometimes you just need someone to have independent thought and a little common sense. It's not that we were some whiners or anything, but rather, an accumulation of little things made us feel helpless. - Location: the back-alley entrance smelled like heated trash. The street it is on was one of the dirtiest and smelliest anywhere in the area. Across the street was another hotel (maybe a Marriott?) that was nicer (larger rooms, nicer staff, higher ceilings), was on a corner with better light and less trash-smell, and more affordable. I'm not too bent out of shape-- had a great trip, left the Iberville Suites early despite prepaying and took other rooms elsewhere, and am having fun all around. Just writing this to help others avoid a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Bourbon Street but quiet!”
Reviews.Author: NJLibrarian_11
Reviews.Content: My room was immaculate and faced another tower of rooms. That meant that the view was nothing special but I had an excellent night's sleep every night a block from Bourbon Street and on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday! I would always be startled by the noise when I left the hotel. The breakfast buffet was generous and varied and another reviewer was right, the coffee was very very good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: OilerFans
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, part of the Ritz Carlton. The best location - right on Canal Street and Bourbon Street. Quiet, comfy, cozy and all the glitz of a Ritz property. Even found free cookies and Perrier water for the Ritz guests. The staff were awesome, and the free continental breakfast was pretty good too! Fantastic lunch on the patio at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for an all girls weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Darby123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with three friends over the weekend. Perfect for four close friends to stay together and the breakfast was an added bonus. Service was attentive and hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely choose this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: The_G_Family
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and one young child stayed at the Iberville Suites during the Memorial Day week, Sunday through Thursday. We actually "paid" for our hotel with airline miles so I cannot comment on how much hotel you get for your money, but we were more than pleased during our stay. The pros - luxurious lobby, polite staff, generous breakfast included with your stay, use of the facilities at the Ritz-Carlton, free access to Internet in the lobby, separate bedroom and living room w/sleeper sofa, and location, location, location. The hotel is only one/two blocks away from stops to the Canal St and St Charles Ave streetcar lines. And if you are in N.O. to visit Bourbon St the hotel is only one block away from the bars. The (kinda sorta) cons - the entrance and lobby of the hotel are very luxurious and really set up your expectations so the rooms feel like a big disappointment; I would have liked to see some protein at breakfast (even just a hard-boiled egg); the bedrooms were nice and quiet but if you slept in the front room of the suite, you could hear everything and everyone in the hallways (I an imagine this being a huge issue during Mardi Gras), and the staff was polite but not really friendly. The BIG con - free WiFi only in the lobby, not in the rooms. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Iberville and would definitely stay there again. We loved being able to start our day with a (free) big breakfast and ending it with a nice long soak in the hot tub at the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with stay”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler077
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights over the busy Memorial weekend in New Orleans. Room was ready when we arrive and was what we expected. Staff was friendly. Room was always made up when requested. Room was clean and air conditioning functioned well. Furnishings were a little dated, as was the bath, but very acceptable for the price we paid. Location on the west edge of the French Quarter and near Canal Street trolley. It is 2 blocks from St. Charles Street trolley. Next time will likely choose a hotel with a pool or one in the middle of the Quarter, although if the price is right, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Nice Breakfast. Okay rooms.”
Reviews.Author: joynceddy
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. The staff is friendly enough. The breakfast was great! Definitely worth it! The rooms are a bit outdated, stained carpet, old bedding, and look pretty worn so even though the lobby and foyer are beautiful and fact that you are attached to the Ritz Carlton feels luxurious, you step in your room and feel like you're in more of a cheap hotel. But considering most people go to New Orleans for the location and are not in their hotel room much, it would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Only quiet hotel located steps from bourbon st....”
Reviews.Author: TRVLGAL_10
Reviews.Content: New orleans is my fav city in the US!! My stay at the iberville suites was perfect. The location to everything in the city is just steps away. Unlike most french quarter hotels, this hotel is quiet at night. I stayed in a king suite and it was a nice sized room. The bed was super comfortable and the room was very clean. Please note that the rooms are a little dated- no flat screen tvs. The continental breakfast was a perfect way to start my day. The coffee is excellent, the best I've ever had at a hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: sweetiepie428
Reviews.Content: Had booked this hotel with some trepidation because the price was so low, but it turned out to be a beautiful place with a great staff. The location is excellent, and our 9th floor room had a view of the city and was exceedingly quiet. The rooms are small but charming and exceedingly clean. Bathrooms are modern and have complimentary toiletries. Bed was extremely comfortable. The small kitchen area complete with refrigerator was useful. The staff, both at the front desk and at the front door were friendly and efficient, and the valet parking was fast and easy. The continental breakfast is kept well stocked and includes a variety of muffins, bagels and do it yourself waffles. The hotel lobby is lovely, and you can also use the facilities at the Ritz next door. All in all, a great stay in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kerbear2u
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Easter weekend and had a great trip, the lcation is perfect, close enough to the action, but far enough away once Bourbon became cheesy. Close enough to Frenchman St.,Canal St. and Dacateur which are amazing, night life on Frenchman with local bands was GREAT. The hotel was clean, friendly, breakfast was fine daily, doormen were WONDERFUL. I would stay here again, my only complaint is at night I would have liked to open a window for fresh air and they were all painted shut. We were on the 10th floor, this could also be for security reasons. Never a line at Elevator, desk desk was helpful, vacation was amazing and we loved it so much we are looking at going again in July. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a good value in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ABitSpoiled
Reviews.Content: Very good choice in a great location of the Quarter. Very good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: bartina
Reviews.Content: Located near very good restaurants in the French Quarter. The suite was roomy, quiet and comfortable. The decor was traditional and slightly southern, appealing to me. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was less than remarkable but it was included so I can';t complain. I enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but there are better places to stay”
Reviews.Content: The rooms are advertised on their website as "suites." We booked two suites & were put in two regular rooms. The rooms were nice enough - just pointing out that they weren't "suites" as advertised on the website. The worst thing about this hotel was that I personally spoke to FOUR different people at the hotel & asked that we be given connecting rooms. All four people said that it shouldn't be a problem & that the request was on our reservation. I was specifically told by one reservation agent at the hotel that they had connecting rooms available i the hotel. When we arrived, the clerk told us that they don't have any connecting rooms. Then we were given rooms on 2 different floors! I explained that we were led to believe that we would be connected, or at least next to each other, but she said that they were booked due to french quarter festival & that was the best they could do. So we were 4 friends traveling together & we had to run up & down the back stairs to see each other. The internet was horrible. We were unable to connect wirelessly the entire time we were there. and once i plugged in, it worked only sporadically. I made them aware of the problem several times, but it was never fixed. Upon checkout, when asked how my stay was, I said the internet worked randomly & they were apologetic, but there was no offer to refund the $34.95 I paid for 4 days of use. It would've been a nice gesture. One more problem I encountered was that on Saturday night I got in later than my roommate & I didn't want to wake her, so I stopped at the front desk to leave a wake-up call for the next day. I asked for the call at 10:15am & the clerk said it was no problem. The next day: no wake-up call. Thank goodness I wasn't going to the airport. I woke up at 10:45 annoyed that I was off to a late start. The location is great. The hotel is quiet, but you're very close to everything. All in all, there are better places to stay. The Chateau Bourbon is right across the street & I had an overall better experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel- but attached to the Ritz which is a plus”
Reviews.Author: phillygirl9
Reviews.Content: This hotel itself is old- the rooms are very average. Our furniture was old and dated- and the bed was not comfortable at all. However, the plus of this hotel is that they have a continental breakfast with amazing coffee from 630-1030 every day and the location is KEY. you also get the benefits of the ritz carlton-- for free! the ritz has a gorgeous gym that you can use for FREE and their spa is incredible- expensive, but worth it. the ritz has a beautiful courtyard as well too. the room itself was loud- i couldn't hear other people in the hotel, but rather the street. it may have been because we were on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rockliveson
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night and although they didn't have a room available for us they upgraded us to the Ritz for the night. The next day our room was available - really good service/clean/good breakfast and brilliant location! Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, although not a true twin room.”
Reviews.Author: Becsupierz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for two nights. The hotel is gorgeous and is in an excellent location, right in the French Quarter but removed from Bourbon Street. The staff are very good and the complimentary breakfast is also great. My only fault is that it was advertised as a twin room but there wasn't two actual beds, but one enormous king bed and a pull out sofa bed. Not a problem as we are happy to share but was not what was advertised. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: JohnOShea
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Iberville. Location wsa 2 blocks from Bourbon and 2 blocks from Canal....easy to walk to wherever we wanted. Room was nice, with a king size bed and a small room in the front with a couch. Got a great price due to location and free breakfast each AM. Not a huge buffet, but there was enough there to feed us that we were not looking to go out for breakfast. Only complaints: 1. We told the front desk about broken glass in the elevator and it remained there all day until we pointed it out again. 2. The insisted we were staying for 4 nights and would not change their error. They said that we had to notify skoosh.com and have skoosh.com take care of it Petty complaints for an overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: Karen111350
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites during Mardi Gras. The hotel was quiet, yet we were only one block from Bourbon Street and one block from the parade route. The rooms were large and clean. Continental breakfast was included, and the rooms had a mini refrigerator and a coffee pot. The only drawback was that our room did not have a view of the street. It adjoins the Ritz-Carlton, and we could use all the amenities of the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Folsom
Reviews.Content: We paid $150 a night and were a little woried about what we would get for that price in the French Quarter. What we got was very comfortable although a little on the small side, but it is the FQ. Location is perfect, 1 block from Bourbon. 2 Blocks from Canal. It was nice being able to head back to your room to recharge, refuel or relax. we used the facilities of the Ritz, which is a beautiful hotel and the courtyard was a very nice place to relax. It is a little confusing getting to the lobby and we never found the stairs to avoid the 2 floor elevator, but will stay here the next time we are in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at a great location”
Reviews.Author: mlswfu1
Reviews.Content: This really was a great place to stay for me, my wife and my children (ages 10 and 11) the week after Christmas. The rooms were nice, with separate bedroom for us and foldout couch and separate TV for kids. Had fridge and coffeemaker as well. Bathroom was quite adequate. Kids enjoyed pool (a bit small, but served its purpose) and hot tub over at the Ritz, which all Iberville guests get to use for free, including a very good weight and exercise rooms. Complimentary breakfast every morning was good, with hot waffles, cereal, fruit and yogurt. Walked through Ritz to get right onto Canal where trolley stop was right out front and St. Charles Street trolley stop just around the corner. Taking back exit put you just a block from Bourbon Street, but most fun is just a little ways up on Royal St. - we could have spent every day just hanging out watching street performings - very entertaining and great variety. Incuding upcharge on New Years Weekend, average about $150 per night. Staff could have been a little more friendly, but not bad - breakfast folks right on the ball, as well as housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is the biggest asset.”
Reviews.Author: IGolf4food
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fairly small and cramped and dark (the suite), and the bathroom is tiny. The continental breakfast was adequate. The hotel is very average, and showing some age, but the level of staff service far exceeds expectations. Since this hotel shares a building with the Ritz, we had access to the gym, spa amenities. The facilities were above average, but the Ritz staff were not attentive to the details of cleanliness (rest rooms (frequently no hand towels, tissues and trash overflowing), convenience (no towels, headphones or water replenished as they should have been), and the Ritz staff were not as friendly as the Iberville (unusual for the Ritz chain). Try to find a rate special, we paid less than $200 per night for the suite, and you will feel that you have received a value. Parking and internet charges do apply and they are outrageous. Access into and out of the hotel is very complicated and bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but expensive”
Reviews.Author: mtaylor12345
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine; the second suite room is nice. But the hotel seems tired and dated. Nothing terribly wrong and nothing terribly fancy. On the northwest corner of the of the French Quarter. There is a $15/day parking lot north 1.5 blocks with in/out privelages. For $250 I wasn't blown away and have spent less to get more in other locations. Free continental breakfast. Strangely, the stairwells didn't seem to prevent someone from the parking garage from getting onto floors 6-10 without a key card.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly, great location, what more could you want.”
Reviews.Author: jbsme
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans on a regular basis and have stayed at Iberville Suites many times. In fact, it is my hotel of choice in New Orleans. The best part about the hotel is its location. It is located right at the start of Bourbon one block up. Very easy to walk to great restaurants and to the action on Bourbon Street, but far enough away you don't hear all the noise when youâ€™re trying to work or sleep. The rooms are suites, so there is a King bed in one room with a sitting area that has a desk and sofa. Rooms are clean but not overly large. Continental breakfast is very adequate. Another nice feature is that itâ€™s attached to the Ritz so you can use their facilities if you are meeting clients or just want a drink. Overall a very nice place at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Hammer328
Reviews.Content: Since the Hotel is a block away from Bourbon Street, its location offers French Quarter convenience without the noise. The lobby is spacious and impressive; the rooms are clean. A very good breakfast is served in the morning until 10:30 a.m., which is late for a self-serve buffet, a true convenience for the not so early risers. Although some of the front desk personnel were on the grumpy side, the bellman were friendly, welcoming and cheerful. Indeed, I had an issue with my luggage handle, and the bellman sent engineering to my room and the handle was fixed within minutes. The lobby only has one computer station available and it was almost always in use, so bring your laptop if you really need to access the net. There is a mini market in the lobby. This is a very nice hotel and priced right if you want to stay in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “The stuffiest room ever!”
Reviews.Author: MariahOh
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and must say apart from the rooms being huge- suites with a living area etc, there was nothing appealing about this hotel. I could not sleep at night though the bed was comfy, because I'd wake up in a coughing fit. There was absolutely no air circulation and it was dusty. I never looked forward going back to my room after long days of meetings. The breakfast was mediocre and the elevators were so confusing. My meetings were at the Ritz next door and it took a bit for my colleagues and I not to get lost while finding our way back. The staff was friendly enough. But the mustiness and stuffiness and dustiness will prevent me from using this place again. Would not recommend. Find a hotel with a window that opens.

Reviews.Title: “The backside of the Ritz absent of a view”
Reviews.Author: Builder3
Reviews.Content: Iberville Suites is attached to the Ritz, therefore the public areas are fine. However, Iberville guests stay on the backside of the building facing a giant walled parking garage which blocks the view and any decent sunlight for many of its floors. "Suites" are small, dark, windowless living areas in which only the height of the ceiling (somewhat) alleviates a sense of claustrophobia. There is no in-room microwave, amenities are low budget. These are not rooms you'll want to spend any extended time in... thank God this city is a tourist destination. Daily parking fees are mandatory. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend. Pay the extra money for a room at the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: jnrob28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Iberville the week after Christmas, though I have stayed here before. The best part about the hotel is its location. It is located right at the start of Bourbon one block up. Very easy to walk to great restaurants and to the action on Bourbon Street, but far enough away when you want to sleep you don't hear all the noise. The rooms are suites, so there is a King bed in one room with a sitting area that has a full pull out sofa. Rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel staff was very nice. I had parking charged incorrectly to my room, and the front desk took care of it in just a few minutes. Continental breakfast is very adequate. Word of advice. I would not use the valet parking as there is a public parking day directly across the street for $8-10 a day cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Antique Elegance”
Reviews.Author: somuch2learn
Reviews.Content: For a visit to the French Quarter, the Iberville Suites are ideally located. The front desk staff was quite attentive to our questions and needs. While disappointing that there was not free Internet access, this was clearly disclosed on their website. The immediate impression one has is of stepping back in time to another era - a true getaway. The only complaint we have is that the toiletries were not replenished each day, as we have come to expect from other hotels of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ORDtraverler
Reviews.Content: We have been to NoLA several times but never stayed at the Iberville Suites. We found a great deal on AAvacations website. The hotel exceeded our expectations. It was very clean, quiet and staffed by friendly and polite individuals. The free breakfast available in the Lobby each morning was more than enough to satisfy us. The hotel is located a block away from the party scene on Bourbon Street, which is a definate plus. My partner used the Ritz Carlton fitness center and said it was very nice. I would strongly advise anyone to consider this place for a visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cdntravllr
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from an enjoyable four night stay at this hotel. The location is excellent, right in the French Quarter if that's where you'd like to stay and walking distance to Bourbon Street. The lobby is beautiful and facillities are fantastic -- a stay includes use of the Ritz Carlton gym and pool. The rooms might be a bit tired but they are clean and very spacious. Mine included a separate living room, though the view was nothing to write home about. The morning breakfasts that are also included are a nice plus. This is not a luxury hotel, but if you're looking for a solid, economical choice in the heart of the FQ you should be satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place in good location”
Reviews.Author: Glenmere7
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here on a November trip that was a combination of business and a couple of vacation days. I booked through hotels.com for $190 per night including taxes and fees. Summary: Pros: Good location Reasonably quiet Competent staff Rooms arenâ€™t cookie-cutter and are equipped with refrigerator. Good breakfast Clean and well-kept premises Cons: Access to the rooms via two different elevators is a little inconvenient. Extra charge for internet connection in the room Sitting room gets little natural light. Notes on location: I like being a block off of Canal Street in the French Quarter, without being in the middle of the Quarter. Rue Iberville is comparatively quiet (though in New Orleans thatâ€™s a relative term). For me this location is far preferable to the big tourist and convention hotels on Canal, a street that I find busy, noisy, and overpriced. The Suites are tucked away behind the Ritz Carlton, which faces Canal. I believe the two hotels are associated in some way, including the sharing of a fitness facility, but I did not explore the connection. The Iberville Suites are conveniently located to a number of attractions. Bourbon Street is a block and a half distant. Though the hotel lies close to the southwest edge of the French Quarter, most of the Quarter can easily be reached on foot from there. Among the farthest French Quarter destinations (15 to 20 minutes on foot) would be the French Market on Decatur Street and the gay bar scene on St. Ann Street. However, this location will also situate you within walking distance of the Warehouse District and the National World War II Museum south of Canal Street, in the area of town known locally as the American Sector. (Itâ€™s about a 20 or 25 minute walk to the museum at 945 Magazine Street, which is worth a visit). This was my first trip to New Orleans since before Hurricane Katrina in 2005, and I was pleased to see the inner city humming with activity and few outward indications of economic distress. Most of my favorite restaurants, bars and businesses are still there and thriving. Notes on the hotel and room: The Suites are in a multi-story building arranged in a manner similar to East Coast urban or European hotels. The reception is on the second floor of the building. A doorman will admit you to a small vestibule and elevator landing on the street level, after which you take the elevator to the second floor, traverse the large lobby, and then take another elevator up to the accommodations. The big lobby is (over)decorated in French Provincial or Empire style furnishings and bric-a-brac, but the high-ceilinged space is large enough to accommodate the excess without it being annoying. There are a few computer stations in this area where you can check e-mail and print out a boarding pass. Breakfast is served in one end of the reception area (good variety of cereals, fruits, yogurt and breads but no hot dishes). The room is well-lit in the mornings with large floor to ceiling windows and plenty of tables and seats for a pleasant morning meal, which is included in the price. The hotel has a rambling layout, with long intersecting hallways. I found the elevators adequate and reasonably swift. The floor plan of my suite resembled the arrangement of New Orleans â€œshotgunâ€� housesâ€”one room wide and multiple rooms deep. The first room off the corridor is a fairly large sitting room with a sofa, easy chairs, a writing desk, a television, and a wet bar with sink and a small refrigerator (yay!). Beyond the sitting room is a hallway with a closet and a bathroom opposite each other. The bedroom is the farthest back, where there is a large window and another television set. This floor plan means that during the day the sitting room receives very little sunlight. Youâ€™ll need to use the lamps in that room even during the day. It was a cozy place to relax or work on my laptop when I returned in the evening. You should be aware that there is a charge for internet connection in the rooms, close to $10 a day. This may explain why people were sitting downstairs in the reception area with laptops, where apparently free WiFi is available. The single room bath is not huge but not small enough to be considered undersized. The fixtures, including a tub-bath, were in good condition, and there was plenty of hot water and thick towels of good quality. I had a king size bed, which pretty much filled the bedroom. The mattress was average. Iâ€™ve had better, but I slept perfectly well on it. The linens were fine, and the dÃ©cor in the suite was French Quarter flavored without being garish. I was pleased with the cleanliness of the suite and of the hotel in general. The view from my 8th floor digs was a mixture of urban ugly (an expanse of flat roof in the foreground) and Old World charm (a view in the distance of the quaint houses on Burgundy Street). I heard very little street noise or interference from other guests, with the exception of a few neighbors down the hall who one night returned from their revelry at 3:00 a.m. and let us all know they were back. If you donâ€™t want to have any close encounters with New Orleansâ€™ party atmosphere, the French Quarter is not the best place to stay. I did not have a car while there and did not try to use the fitness center at the Ritz Carlton, so I cannot comment on those services. Notes on service and staff: Check-in and check-out were hassle-free with no waiting. The staff was competent and courteous during what little interaction I had with them. I had no complaints about the maid service. Notes on the area, including food: Everyone will discover their own favorite eating places and watering holes in New Orleans. Here are a few finds of my own within walking distance of the hotel, in case youâ€™d like to try them too. I enjoyed a good, reasonably priced local seafood meal at Oceana Grill, 739 Conti Street, between Dauphine and Bourbon. It was blissfully uncrowded when I went there for an early evening meal, and the service and food were very good. I also had a good time at K Joeâ€™s Cajun & Creole Cuisine, 720 Rue Saint Louis, between Royal and Bourbon. They have live local music. The food is good, but a bit pricey. Also, you might enjoy the French Market CafÃ©, across from the French Market at 1000 Decatur Street. This is an unpretentious place with a very friendly bar, and they serve up a great bunch of raw oysters. This is where I learned how correctly to pronounce the name of the local brew Abita (a-BEET-a), of which I drank more than one. The French Market CafÃ© is very close to the Central Grocery, also on Decatur Street, which is the prime purveyor of the famous New Orleans sandwich called the muffaletta. I walked there from Rue Iberville one evening hoping to buy one but discovered that the shop keeps standard hours and closes in the late afternoon. So if you want an original muffaletta, go to Central Grocery during the day. There are muffalettas served elsewhere, but most of them donâ€™t measure up. Itâ€™s only a short walk from the Suites to the Hotel Monteleone at the corner of Rue Iberville and Royal Street. This hotel is famous for its Carousel Bar, a rotating bar on the ground floor. I had the bartender make me a hurricane, which was smaller than the ones for which Pat Oâ€™Brienâ€™s is famous, but for my money it was just as good. I recommend not staying at the Carousel past about six rotations of the bar, in order to make it easier to find your way home. Though itâ€™s a long morning walk from Rue Iberville, the bakery â€œCroissant Dâ€™Or Patisserieâ€� at 617 Ursulines Avenue, on the opposite side of the Quarter, is very quaint and enjoyable, with a lot of local clientele. CafÃ© Beignet is closer by, serving a mixture of baked goods, including fatty beignets rolled in powdered sugar (the very sight of which may expand your waistline), as well as some hot lunch dishes and soups. Itâ€™s at 334 Royal Street, next to the police station, and has a lovely and secluded outdoor patio thatâ€™s considerably less frenetic than the better known CafÃ© du Monde. CafÃ© Beignet has daytime hours only. I do NOT recommend the Palace CafÃ© on Canal Street. It was crowded and noisy, and the service was unfriendly. The food at the Palace was average. Bourbon Street is worth a stroll at night, just to have had the experience of chaotic license. I initially did not feel at all unsafe there, especially because of the police presence, but the later in the night or early morning it is, the dicier the passersby become. After being propositioned by prostitutes and hassled a few times by aggressive young locals after 1:00 a.m. (the kind of people who continue to follow you and even tug on your arm after youâ€™ve declined their invitation to give them a cigarette), I avoided Bourbon and chose the parallel street Royal for getting back and forth across the Quarter late at night. Royal Street, one block off of Bourbon, is lined with sedate antique shops (and a police station), and occasionally one runs across an impromptu local band of musicians on a corner, playing for tips. It was some of the best jazz I heard during my visit. On this visit I also took a bus tour of the Lower Ninth Ward and saw the lingering devastation from Hurricane Katrina. The tour included a visit to the new sustainable housing sites, which was very informative. Had it not been for Katrina, I would never have gone to that neighborhood, and I learned a lot. Notes on culture: My favorite thing to be called in New Orleans is â€œbaby,â€� which local middle-aged women are inclined to use as a form of address for men or women, even when speaking to strangers. No disrespect is intended. If youâ€™re interested in a good read with plenty of local color, pick up John Kennedy Tooleâ€™s novel A Confederacy of Dunces and read it on the plane. For me the pros outweigh the cons. I enjoyed the stay at Iberville Suites and will consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penny N
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans in December to see the Christmas decorations, enjoy the food and listen to live music. We stayed in a different hotel on our last two visits but decided to try something new this time. We were very pleased with the Iberville Suites. It is a pretty hotel with very nice suites at an extremely reasonable rate. The hotel is physically connected to the Ritz Carlton. You take elevators to get around both properties. The Iberville is accessed off the street of the same name while the Ritz is more easily accessed off Canal St. The hotel is perfectly located on the west side of the French Quarter. We had a short walk to the St. Charles trolly line. A short walk to a mall with national departments stores. All the restaurants, lounges and sites of the Quarter are nearby and easy to access. If you are going further afield, you can get taxis right outside the Ritz main lobby. The service at the Iberbille Suites lobby was pleasant with no lines to wait in. It is a short walk through the Iberville's public areas to the Ritz Spa, M Bistro restaurant and their Davenport lounge. If we return to New Orlenas, this will be our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: emdoolan
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel!, comfortable bed & bedding, great shower, quiet room, excellent complimentary breakfast. BUT the customer service was poor. the first night, the heat wasn't working in our room& it was very cold. on one picked up the phone at the front desk after repeted calls. when my boyfriend went down to the front desk, there was no one there. he rang the bell, no one came. he called the front desk from the front desk & someone in the back room answered. they recomended he go down to the front desk. he said he was standing at the front desk. they came out from the back room, quite annoyed. they said they would send up a service person. they didn't. after a while, he went back down to the front desk, no one was there. he got a hold of someone again by calling. they said they would send someone to fix the heater. they didn't. on the 3rd try, he ran into a security guard as he was making his way to the front desk, who said he would send someone up to look at the heater. this time, they came. he was able to fix it, but the heat failed again shortly affter he left. after the back & forth to the desk 2 more times, the maintenance guy came back & determined the heater couldn't be fixed. by this time it was about 2 in the morning. we were moved to another room, but the front desk staff didn't bother to send up a bellhop to help us. also, after dark, we very rarely saw staff at the front door, or at the front desk. we felt safe in out room, but staff was not available when we needed assistance. i tried to contact the manager repetedly & left him messages, but he never called me back. we 6 nights there & never once did i hear back from him, no appology for staff being unavailable, for moving us to another room, nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star”
Reviews.Author: walnut123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites for two nights prior to our cruise. We did the same thing three years ago when we also stayed at the Iberville. This time our room was cleaner and brighter. We choice the suites because of the extra room. It is not four stars. It shares the building with the Ritz C. but they could really be miles apart. The only positive thing i can say is that the doorman always greeted us upon leaving and welcomed us back. The reception folks are a joke. Conversation is kept brief. You must ask or you won't be told. The afternoon of my first day I asked how I could get to the gym. I was told by reception that the gym was restricted to woman only. After thinking a second, I said...no problem. A blank stare until she told me it was.......a joke! Maybe it would be funny if I had a drink in my hand. Breakfast was sparse. My giving this property a second chance was mistake on my part that will not be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “Damaged vehicle”
Reviews.Author: traveler1110_10
Reviews.Content: The valet parking, which was included as part of the package for this "wedding weekend", returned our vehicle damaged - consistent with scraping against a concrete post in a parking garage. A report and pictures were taken immediatel yupon the vehicle beingbrought to us upon checkout. Mariott Claims instructed us to get an estimate for the damage, which we did and forwarded to them. They then refused to fix the damage. It's appalling that we have no recourse for $1000 damage that they did to our vehicle - NOT A REPUTABLE COMPANY!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: pattym1956
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, quiet and a fantastic value! We were able to walk to wonderful restaurants and the French Quarter and were within a block of Walgreens and CVS pharmacy. We only needed a cab to go to one restaurant and rode the streetcar to the wonderful WWII museum in the Warehouse district. This was our 2nd visit to New Orleans in 2 years and enjoyed this visit even more than our first, mostly due to our fortunate hotel selection. The rooms were very nice, a sitting room with a desk and TV, bath, and bedroom with spacious dresser drawer space and another TV. I really liked the complimentary breakfast available until 10:30 each morning in the spacious lobby. Since we were vacationing this meant we could sleep in and still enjoy a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything you want to see & do in the French Qtr.”
Reviews.Author: offshoreDelandFL
