Reviews.Content: No need to rent a car, or need a taxi. The trolley cars run on Canal & St. Charles. The hotel is steps from the Trolley car stops, which run till 3:30AM if you want to wander away from the wilder side of Bourbon St. (which is one block from this hotel, but you don't hear the noise of the bars or rowdy's in your room). The buses run all the time & are fine to ride in these neighborhoods. The hotel serves a Cont. Breakfast each morn till 10:30. The Iberville Suites is actually on (Iberville), but is actually the same building as the Ritz Carlton, which is facing Canal St.. In addition, as a guest of the hotel, you have full access to the facilities @ the Ritz, which is fab. in itself, but you don't pay Ritz room rates..... When and if we return to N/Orleans in our future travels, we will stay here again! P.S. The staff is great, there's a mini fridge & wet bar in each rm.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely go back to Iberville Suites!!!”
Reviews.Author: tlccorkmaster
Reviews.Content: Great location, part of the Ritz Carlton, affordable, breakfast included, decent room with fridge. Literally a block from Bourbon St.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: atraveler246
Reviews.Content: My family lives in Louisiana and we travel there every year. We booked a king suite at this hotel and could not have been more satisfied. The room was very large, comfortable, well decorated, and the staff very attentive. The location, one block off Bourbon Street, made it the perfect hotel choice. The park and stay package offered on their website was a great deal. We will stay at Iberville Suites again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location one block from Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: vacationlady1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Iberville Suites at 8:30 in the morning. They had a room ready for us and allowed us to check in. The furniture looks a little worn in the sitting room and needs to be replaced. This room is very dark and the light switch did not work but you could turn the light on manually. We did not really use this room as we were out all day and by the time we got back we were exhausted from all the walking. The location of the hotel is great. You are about 1 block away from Bourbon Street. After you figure out how to enter and leave the hotel it is not a big deal. You can go through the Ritz entrance (both front and back or out Iberville entrance. You have to ride two separate elevators to get to your room (they are slow) The bedroom is very small and has large furniture in it. The old style large TV had limited channels. The air conditioning did not seem to cool the room down even if it was on 60 but the hallways were very cold. The breakfast area gets really busy with not enough tables and chairs. If you do not get down their early there are not enough newspapers. People end up setting on couches and stuffed chairs to try to eat their breakfast. You can only get wireless in the lobby so people spend alot of time in this area checking their emails. I donâ€™t understand why wireless in the room is not standard without having to charge for this service. There is only one computer in the lobby to print out your boarding pass and check emails. It gets very busy. The workout area is part of the Ritz hotel and is really large. Did not see many people use it while we were there. The pool and hot tub area is rather small. Lots of kids stay in this hotel and they seem to take the pool area over.

Reviews.Title: “Have found our GO-TO hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Meghuneyntyson
Reviews.Content: I'd been wanting to stay at Iberville for a while but everytime I'd go to book, some other hotel would have a cheaper rate and I'd opt out of staying at IS. This time, I didn't let a THING deter me and I am SO glad. We had the time of our lives and part of it had to do with the awesome staff at this hotel. The door guys and the valets - LOVED THEM. They were SO personable. I can't say enough about them. Many times after walking out of the door or coming in, we would say to ourselves how much we loved them. The room was fantastic. Seperate living area with a mini fridge and sink..decent sized bathroom and bedroom was a good size. We never ordered room service so I can't speak for that. The prices were super high (think 27 dollars for eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes and toast) but Ritz Carlton handles room service. The hotel itself is beautiful with nice architectural touches and old peices of art and furniture all around. The only issue I had was with the hot water in the tub. It only about trickled out. Location was AWESOME. Maybe 1 or 2 blocks to Bourbon and about 4 or 5 blocks from the casino (which was huge since we were there to celebrate a 21st birthday). In the lobby there is a single computer set up with a printer to use if need be. My friend used it to turn in a homework assignment while we were there. But really, overall, I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay and the next time we go to New Orleans, we are definately staying at Iberville Suites. LOVED IT and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Linkup
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is an older hotel, but for me that is part of the charm. My corporate travel agent found this as a less expensive alternative to the Ritz, which is next door. It included a very nice breakfast in the morning, and the location--one block from Bourbon St. and the French Quarter--is hard to beat. My one complaint--and for me this is big--is that the hotel charges for internet access. Come on! Even McDonalds has free wireless! Why any hotel would want to start a relationship with a customer by making him/her angry, is beyond my comprehension; internet is like electricity and charging extra is extortion. That said, every staff member was nice, the bellmen rocked, and really I had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Granny4NewIberia_LA
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday night and realized my envelope of cash was missing from my purse. Not once but twice the parking supervisor walked me across the street to valet parking for me to check my car. It turns out I had put it in the glove compartment. This kindness and concern for guest resonated throughout our weekend stay in every phase of the hotel. The bellman was tops, the front desk staff answered all questions and informed us of all our amenities, use of the Ritz Carlton, etc. On Sunday when we wanted to go down to the Quarter for breakfast and shopping, it was no problem. Our bags were locked up until we returned. Our car was fine in valet until we returned. I would highly recommend this hotel. Parking is a little steep, but it is New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful French Quarter Location, Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: pauliesmom
Reviews.Content: This trip was a spur of the moment thing while returning home from a family visit. Neither of us had ever been to New Orleans,. Iberville Suites is located one block off Canal Street and 2 blocks from Bourbon St. You can walk anywhere in the French Quarter and you can walk to Harrah's Casino. Our room was a small suite. Since it is an older renovated building, the rooms are not overly large. We had a decent size queen bedroom and bath, separated by a door from the living room. which inclkuded a wet bar and refrigerator. TV''s in both rooms. We paid $99 per night, Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel shares a building with the Ritz Carlton and is in fact owned by the Ritz. Room service would come from the Ritz, though we didn't use it,. ,. Breakfast in the lobby is complimentary and includes fresh fruit, wafflemaker, toaster, as well as juices, bagels, muffins, cereal and coffee. More than adequate. There is no restaurant (the Ritz does have one), but with the location of the place, you really don't need a hotel restaurant. We walked to Brennan's, Redfish Grill and others for our meals. You can also walk to Harrah's Casino. Highly recommended, One warning, If you are travelling with a pet, you might not find this the place for you. Pet fee is $150!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel: quiet yet near everything”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelerJB
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, with a living room/kitchenette area, a full bath, and a separated bedroom. It was an easy walk all over the French Quarter and a quick stroll to the streetcar stop for the Garden District. It was also quiet. There was a breakfast at the hotel that was passable as well.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay in the quarter for a long week-end”
Reviews.Author: ecowmn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an exended stay in the quarter. Our friends booked the Chateau Bourbon which was not available at our time of booking. Iberville was only a few doors down from Chateau Bourbon. Room was roomy--had a refrigerator and sofa bed option. Sofa bed mattress was a bit thin--could feel the springs The bed was a very comfortable pillowtop type. The complimentary breakfast spread was more than your basic continental style. It offered make your own waffles, fresh fruits and yogurts as well. The hotel is conjoined with the Ritz Carlton so the nightly option of hearing jazz at the Ritz is also available.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Hotel owned by Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: ResortSpaLady
Reviews.Content: There was a conference in town so the hotels were booked in NOLA--It was hard to find four nights in one hotel but we lucked up and found Iberville Suites. Have stayed at the Ritz and never even knew about this hotel. It is owned by the Ritz so you get to use all the facilities of the Ritz Carlton and the two hotels are connected. This includes the Ritz spa and all the restaurants--the room service was upscale so assuming that the same kitchen facilities are shared. The hotel is in the center of the french quarter so you can walk to all the restaurants, French Market, shops, shows, etc. We reserved a king sized suite and have added some pictures. The bed was comfy and nicely decorated--the carpet was clean and had a nice, raised scroll design. The living area was comfortable but nothing fancy--sofa, tv and computer desk. The bath was small and but had marble and granite so made it feel nicer. It took a while for the hot water to heat up in the sink and the shower. The towels were probably the worst part of the hotel--thin and close to shabbinees--disappointing. There was a wet bar in the room with a refrigerator and coffee maker so that was nice. The bath amenities were upscale but small in size. There was internet but there was a fee--if you watch for hotel specials you can get valet parking, internet and upgrades for free. The hallways were a bit noisy (guests, staff, door slamming) if sitting in the living room but the bedroom was quiet. The continental breakfast was very large and quiet fancy. It was served in the large lobby area that has a feel of luxury so we were very pleased with the breakfast. Room service is exceptional as well. It was really nice to walk out the door and be close to all the action. Breakfast at Brennan's was a couple of blocks away and dinner at Galatoire's was within a block. If you want to ride the street cars you can board those easily from this area. Iberville Suites may well be one of the best kept secrets in New Orleans. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: tinathetraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to New Orleans for her birthday and wanted a romantic weekend. I booked a King suite at Iberville Suites. We were going to have a late arrival and I called the hotel twice to let them know NOT to give our room away. When we got there, our room was not available! They said they only had one room left - a Queen suite. I booked our stay through an awards program so everything had already been paid for. Then I receive the full charge on my credit card. I called and they credited by account but this hotel caused so much headache for me. The free breakfast was a good perk.

Reviews.Title: “We had, as most rooms, a view of a walled...”
Reviews.Author: CDLFL15
Reviews.Content: We had, as most rooms, a view of a walled area but that was the worst of the stay. Great location, great staff and very clean. The room was large and nice for the three days we spent in NOLA. A breakfast is provided but we ate out. It appeared to have lots of choices and be fresh. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttravelers101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites for 3 nights (over a weekend). We were a little apprehensive due to several of the negative reviews we had read on TripAdvisor. We were pleasantly surprised: First of all, the staff was overly friendly and helpful, especially Ebony whom had a bottle of wine sent to our room for our anniversary with a kind note!! We are discerning travelers and found the hotel exceptionally clean etc. Extra pillows were added to our comfortable bed and the breakfast was fine! Even the maintenance personnel and maid staff greeted us every time. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but $150 pet fee is not pet-friendly”
Reviews.Author: 2ndtyme
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent corporate rate. If I had to pay more, I probably wouldn't have considered it to be as a great a value. Also, this hotel presents itself as pet-friendly, but you have a pay a non-refundable $150 per stay cleaning fee. You have to pay even if your pet doesn't leave a mess or damage. This fee is outrageous considering that our room (especially the bathtub) wasn't all that clean to begin with. I wasn't a pigstye, but I would expect better from a hotel that attaches itself to the Ritz-Carlton brand. What was great, was having a real suite with a closed-off living room, and a TV in both the living and bed rooms. It would be better though if they were updated flat-screens and not traditional tube TV's. There's a free continental breakfast of cereal, waffles, and breads, but I needed something a little more substantial for the morning-after a night on Bourbon Street. Which leads to the location...can't be beat if you want to be in the French Quarter. You're one block away, so it's easy to get to, but the hotel is still quiet enough for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfect, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: electro66
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home today after staying 6 days at the Iberville Suites in New Orleans, here is the good stuff,,, great location, very friendly staff from Valet to check-in to the breakfast crew, Free computer with printer in lobby, $12.00 per 24 hour for wireless in your room, best coffee in the city, in fact im trying to locate some for at home. outdoor pool would be great instead of indoor pool shared with the Ritzs, over all, very good location, clean rooms and friendly accomidating staff, BTW the standard pillows are foam, they do have feather pillows by request Bev

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Tali
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was a little shabby and could do with some updating & could have been cleaner. The mattress dipped- very annoying- I hate sleeping on old mattresses. The valet parking was $35/night which brought our total for this hotel to $180/night. The hotel is connected to the Ritz which is a big draw for some people but we were in town to see the sights- not spend a lot of time in the hotel so we didn't use any of those amenities. We wanted a suite because we were traveling with our three year old and our newborn. The location was good- just up the road from the famous Acme Oyster House and we could easily walk to everything. The crib provided by the hotel was nice and was waiting in the room for us when we checked in. We requested a late check out and we were able to extend the room to 1 p.m. (normal check out time is noon).

Reviews.Title: “Not All I Expected It To Be”
Reviews.Author: DoctorPB
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with my family (Aunt, Uncle, and Grandmother). We had 3 rooms all right next to each other. My room was not clean. There were pizza crumbs all over the livingroom floor. The bar area was nice to have, but the bathroom was real small and didn't leave much space for getting dressed. My airconditioner didn't work. They sent several people up to look at it before they moved me to a new room (away from my family). Once in my new room, my remote control for the TV didn't work. All I really needed was someone to change the batteries, but this became an all out ordeal. The man came up to fix it.... He brought another remote. Unfortunately, it didn't work either. I went through 4 or 5 remotes before they found one that worked. There were 2 key cards made for my room....mine didn't work. I went down to the desk twice to have them fix it. All in all, I will never stay at this hotel again. Maybe it was a series of really unfortunate events or maybe just bad luck, but it shouldn't be this much trouble to go on vacation (ever)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites especially if you want be very closeto bourbon but not hear it”
Reviews.Author: marnid
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel... It lets you use all the ritz exercise/steam room and pool area. Great front desk people that even let us check out at 3pm because we had a 6pm flight and wanted to let my daughter take a nap. Breakfast was very easy to get to and great. Waffles, cereal, yogurt, juice, good wolfgang puck coffee, and fruit. we had a 3 year old with us so we originally had the 2 bed suite but there was no door inbetween the beds. So we switched to the 1 bed suite and they quickly brought in a very comfy cot for her.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location---Ritz Carlton Privileges”
Reviews.Author: lchjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at a real bargain rate (just over $100/night plus parking), and were very pleased. Our two room suite was fine, if not the most up to date or fanciest. It had two TV's and comfortable sofa, desk, etc .Staff were friendly, and the lobby area has some elegance. The location is great---right on the fringe of the French Quarter a block from Bourbon Street, but still very quiet. And it's easy to access (valet parking only) if you're driving a car, a real plus given the difficulty of getting around the French Quarter. There is a continental breakfast---once again, nothing fancy but decent, and it's FREE! One of the major perks of staying here is that it's managed by Ritz-Carlton, and you have free privileges (concierge, fitness room, etc.) at the Ritz which is actually connected to the Iberville. Believe me, being able to use the Ritz concierge when trying to get a reservation at one of the city's top restaurants can really come in handy. And the Ritz fitness room is one of the best you'll see in a hotel. Overall, we really enjoyed staying here and being close to everything. In some respects, you feel like you're staying at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “I killed a Palmetto Bug in the bath, and it stayed there for 2 Days”
Reviews.Author: pitttrader1988
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again. The bar faucet was broken, wouldn't shut off. The rooms are dated. Chips in the tub and sink. Carpet old, and a little smelly killed a Palmetto Bug in the bathroom, didn't pick it up to see how well the maids cleaned. It remained there my entire stay! Of course, the maids did help themselves to a left over muffaletta sandwich in our fridge. (Go to Ignatius on Magazine, great place). This hotel is "attached" to the Ritz, but that is about the only Ritzy thing about it. Don't be fooled. The staff at the front desk, and the bellhops were decent. I don't know if there is a business center, but there is a public computer in the lobby. The hotel is in the quarter, so it's a little noisy. TV's are outdated. Room very small. I was on the 9th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but pricey”
Reviews.Author: jramonde
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for a wedding at the Ritz (adjoining hotel) and stayed at the Iberville Suites because it was very convenient both for the wedding and for the town. Easy walks to the main parts of the French Quarter and the river made the location ideal. The room itself was average. A great king sized bed made for a very comfortable sleep, but the room lacked a full length mirror and there was no fan in the bathroom. Guest "amenities" were minimum (only shampoo, conditioner, and soap). The breakfast was adequate and included. (Yogurt, bananas or apples, cereal, coffee, juice, waffles, no hot foods.) Staff was generally friendly and helpful (particularly the kitchen staff and doormen.)

Reviews.Title: “Not living up to the expectations based on their website”
Reviews.Author: neilgbautista
Reviews.Content: The lady in the reception was arrogant, actually quite hostile. The room was unpleasant and too dark, not well ventilated, and only daylight in one section of the room showing us the roof of the adjacent building. There was free internet at the lobby. We booked for extra bed and it was not prepared. The breakfast was disappointing, it was composed of a camping-type, self-service, TO-GO set-up, which means plastic cutleries and plastic cups... Total experience rates 3 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MelissaD.
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an amazing trip to New Orleans! Early check in made possible by Ebony at the front desk, we were very grateful to her after a very early morning flight. We had a King Suite on the 9th floor. The carpets in the hallways looked brand new, corridors were brightly lit. The room had plenty of clean towels and Bath and Body Works toiletries. The mini fridge was perfect to have, we filled it with drinks from the Walgreens (corner of Iberville and Royal) We always slept well and the housekeeping staff were very quiet, they did not disturb you in the morning, just put the sign on the door. They even came by in the early evening to ask if we needed anything. There is a computer and printer in the lobby that guests can use free of charge, very helpful for checking email and early airport check in. The hotel is gorgeous!!! Especially the shared courtyard with the Ritz. All the staff that we encountered were very friendly. We were out late every night and walked back to the hotel without any concerns. The hotel is in a perfect location to catch the streetcar to City Park on Canal and the St. Charles streetcar to the Garden District. When you leave the hotel make a RIGHT onto Iberville walk to Bourbon, turn RIGHT onto Bourbon (away from the partying area) to Canal. The streetcar stops are in front of you on Canal and across Canal in front of a huge Pharmacy sign (I think it said CVS) for St. Charles, you can't miss them! We did make it down to the complimentary breakfast once :) The coffee was excellent, there was also orange juice, water and tea. A choice of two types of moist muffins, bagels and bread for toasting with packaged cream cheese and jam. There was also yogurt, individually boxed cereals, bananas and a make your own waffles. Enough for anyone to start their day. We did not fill up too much because we needed to leave room for all the amazing food that we consumed during lunch and dinner in New Orleans!! We did a lot of walking, and saw a lot of other hotels, however, we know we would choose this hotel again for its great location, friendly front desk and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: marthae
Reviews.Content: Iberville Suites turned out to be quite a nice surprise. We reserved a room there because of the great rates. The hotel is conveniently located to the French Quarter and to the streetcar line. The staff was very nice. The lobby is beautiful and the room, although the sleeping area was small, was very nice. Not plush like The Ritz or a similar hotel, but nice nonetheless. Breakfast was light but sufficient with great coffee. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: gayleen1915
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to New Orleans. My stay at the Iberville was totally delightful!! My room was sparkling clean and modern---not worn at all!!! The continental breakfast was great with a nice variety of waffles, bagels, muffins, coffee, juice and yogurt. The staff was friendly and helpful in every way. Everyone had a friendly "hello" from check in to check out. I will definitely stay there again when I travel back to new Orleans!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We're in the hotel currently. I like...”
Reviews.Author: nogurunomethod
Reviews.Content: We're in the hotel currently. I like being a block from Bourbon St. Close enough but much quieter here. The rooms appear to be in the midst of upgrades but are still a bit tired. Our shower felange is loose, revealing rust stains on the tile. Our couch has holes in it. The carpet is discolored as if it has a disease. Only one remote for 2 TV's. On the other hand, the temperature control is perfect, especially for this west-coaster unaccustomed to humidity. Overall, at $271 a night, even with breakfast included, it is not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “nineteenth century web connection”
Reviews.Author: strivetobeintrepid
Reviews.Content: For what you really need from a hotel this was really a nice place to stay. Price reasonable, beds and room great, quiet (though in New Orleans one's neighbors can make unbelievable amounts of 2 am noise, but not this time). But I could not believe how poor the internet service was. These days one uses the internet to figure out who is playing where in clubs etc. It is not just for doing business folks. It is like not having a telephone in the last generation. So I dunno if if it was just my room (919) but the hotel internet took 15 min to upload a Jetblue reservation for example. Unacceptable if you value the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Billyray312
Reviews.Content: I tried to book a room at The Ritz Carlton, where I stayed the last time in New Orleans but they were sold out. I booked at The Iberville Suites in order to be close to business associates staying at The Ritz. The hotels are connected and they share some amenities. The hotel is in a great location about a block and a half from Bourbon Street. Close enough to be convenient and far enough away to be quiet. Like many of the hotels in New Orleans, the hotel is old and probably historic. The corridors have been nicely redone. The rooms are due for an update as the carpets and linens were tired. That said, my room and bathroom was impeccably clean. Be advised that the bathrooms are small. I was traveling alone on business and the bathroom was adequate for one but if I was traveling with my wife, it would have been tight. Breakfast is included at The Iberville Suites. It is similar to what you get at a Hampton Inn. Bagels, muffins, cereal, yogurt, fruit, waffles, coffee and juice. I ate at the hotel both days with no complaints. If you want a made to order brekafast, just walk next door to the Ritz or any of the number of other hotels or restaurants in the area. The rate I paid was exactly half the rate my associates paid at the Ritz Carlton. All in all my stay went well. It is not comparable to the Ritz Carlton but it is a good value and I would not hesitate to return to the Iberville Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: jzagbehrens
Reviews.Content: My husband andI just returned from staying at the Iberville Suites in New Orleans. After reading several great reviews we decided on this hotel- big mistake. The breakfast...serve yourself, eat off paper plates and plastic silverware...I've stayed at three hotels that had the decency to offer you you real plates and proper silverware. The coffee- disgusting, not enough tables every morning. Nothing healthy..stale muffins and bagels. The service..non existent. We inquired about area restaurants and we're told by the woman at the reception desk that we should speak to the concierge service- however there was no one EVER available. The room- Dirty, stained rugs, dingy linens and nasty old towels. The small fridge in the room wasn't stocked with so much as a bottle of water. I asked why my fridge didn't have water and was told BECAUSE we don't do that. I have stayed at three star hotels that put the Iberville Suites to shame. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. I normally always stay at a Starwood hotel and i'm going to return to that habit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: rockgirl272
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in Southeast Louisiana. When I had the opportunity to travel back home with my fellow coworkers I did suggest the Iberville Suites. The great thing about this hotel is that you get the amenities of the Ritz Carlton. They had live entertainment every night, great bar and wonderful food. The president of the company I work for loves cigars. Of course, they have a cigar bar, which was wonderfully decorated. The court yard was beautiful. The staff was so helpful with all of our requests. I would stay again. The location is great, one block from Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie051
Reviews.Content: Met up with friends for a long weekend in New Orleans. The rate was incredible for the size and comfort of the rooms. Was easy to catch a cab, grab the streetcar, walk the French Quarter or just slip into the Ritz for a cocktail. Unfortunately I got very sick from a bad oyster and had to spend a day plus in bed. Couldn't have been more comfortable! Staff was not overly friendly, but very helpful. Loved that it catered to families as well. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: melaleg
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that I paid $80 a night (actually less with Expedia points) so I was thrilled. The suites are spacious (two TVs) , and guests have access to the fitness center at the Ritz which is connected. Continental breakfast served daily and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price during the week”
Reviews.Author: ASJM
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New Orleans. We reserved with the hotel directly and got a smallish suite for $89 during the week (weekends were more $). The location was great - convenient but away from the frat-party scene on Bourbon St., room was quiet and clean, the bed and pillows were excellent (probably the best hotel I've been to for these!), and the make-your-own waffles at breakfast were a hit. Breakfast runs till 10:30, which was great for us. Kids liked playing in the courtyard at the Ritz Carlton, and at the pool. The internet in the lobby appeared to be dial up, and the living room in the suite was on the small side with 2 kids, but overall would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Iberville”
Reviews.Author: dawoz
Reviews.Content: make my way down to New Orleans for the Sugar Bowl almost every year around New Years Eve. I've stayed at the Iberville suites perhaps 10 times out of the last 14 years. A sister property to the Ritz Carlton, you can use all the amenities at the Ritz for a fraction of the price. One year they were overbooked at the Iberville, and my parents got moved to the Ritz for the same price. Their location is ideal. 2 blocks away from Bourbon Street... Centrally located to most anything you would want to do or see in NOLA. Before Katrina, it was advertised as an "All suite hotel". All the rooms opened to a living room with a pullout sofa, a little wet bar/ microwave counter area and then had a separate bedroom. It was very economical because you could have two groups of people with separate bedrooms for the price of one room... Yes, someone got stuck with the pullout... but it usually works out to 200 bucks a night to get a separate room at a similar hotel... so pullout sofas are more in my budget. Unfortunately, most of my trips to New Orleans do not get me out of bed before 10AM. About my 7th year of staying there, I woke up early enough to realize they have a FULL and FREE breakfast buffet. Scrambled eggs, sausage, ham.... Fruit... You name it. I was amazed! None of the rooms I've stayed in have any kind of view to mention... usually of another wall or some parking garage.... The hotel was closed for an extended period of time after Katrina... Far more than other hotels in the area. I understand they took heavy wind damage. Now that they have reopened, things are pretty much the same... with a few notable exceptions: They are no longer a "all suite hotel". Post Katrina they added some standard rooms. When booking, be very careful of what kind of room you are booking. It appears the breakfast has been scaled back to a very nice continental, with no hot food. Prices here are all over the place. I'm usually there for New Years Eve and the Sugar Bowl and have found prices as low as 99.00 and as high as 330.00 per night.... Shop around, Travelocity, Expedia and the http://ibervillesuites... web page are all good places to look. When friends ask where to stay when visiting NOLA, the Iberville Suites is where I tell them to check first!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great city”
Reviews.Author: Atsea11
Reviews.Content: I went with my mom in October just to see New Orleans. The room was nice but not luxury which was fine since we hardly spent any time there anyway. The hotel is connected to the Ritz Carleton and they share a kitchen and restaurant. The room service food at the Iberville is the same that serves the Ritz. The employees here were all great especially the men at the door. They were always ready to call you a cab, get you an umbrella and open the doors for you. Loved them. The location was awesome. Although it was a 10 minute walk to the river the walk there was so wonderful. We walked everywhere from this hotel and took the trolley to the Garden District. Bourbon street is very close and tons of great restauants are all with in a couple blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarnsburyBlake
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely perfect, right in the French Quarter. Our room was a great and had a separate living room with another TV. Certain fixtures in the hotel are looking a bit tired (eg. couch, TV, light switches) and should probably be updated in the next few years. Staff were pretty good. Breakfast wasn't great; a standard continental selection. The fitness centre is located in the Ritz-Carlton next door and is absolutely amazing; the best gym I've ever had on holiday. There's no free in-room internet and there's only one terminal in the lobby, which is often in use.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ginabcostanza
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Iberville Suites this past week for 4 nights. Based on the great reviews, I was really excited. I was extremely disappointed in the room when we arrived: 1. 90% of all the lights weren't working 2.blood on the bathroom walls 3. hairdryer mount was hanging out of the wall 4.dresser drawers were broke 5. No hot water whatsoever 6. And the room was really beat up in general. Service: The service was tolerable but the front desk help was not at all pleasant. The girl that checked us in was on a personal call the entire time she was checking us in and couldn't be bothered to answer my questions about internet access. Also a couple of times our keys didn't work so we had to ask for help, which again had the same experience with help that made you feel like you were putting them out. Location: This is the only positive comment I have. The location was perfect. We were within steps of Bourbon Street and all the action. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone after seeing the other beautiful hotels and inns in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “What ever happened to customer service?”
Reviews.Author: doubleEohio
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we encountered two female desk clerks who seemed to hate their job. No eye contact, smile or welcome from either clerk. We would have appreciated information regarding other amenities available to us - but we had to ask. Each question seemed to be a burden. One female desk clerk who worked in the evening smiled and was cheery (made sure we let her know how much she was appreciated). Our room was dingy and dirty and smelled terrible. The toilet still had hair and urine on it. We complained and were given a bit of a run around but eventually moved to another floor. The room was better. The bellhops were friendly. We have stayed at two different hotels in New Orleans which provided excellent service and cleanliness. In a city with so many choices, we can strongly recommend you keep looking if you are considering Iberville Suites - can't believe it was rated a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: leosf
Reviews.Content: Yea, the front entrance feels more like the back entrance at the Ritz... but there's a reason for that. It is. Iberville Suites is actually in (or connected to) the Ritz Carlton building. Very clean. Very quiet even though it's blocks from Canal St and Bourbon St. We got a slammin' deal on this place from priceline. I'd say a third of the usual price, so be sure to try there first.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: scott10jo
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay during MardiGras. We were two blocks off of Borbon, eight floors up, never heard a sound from the street party. The people in the room next to us seemed to be enjoying themselves, we could hear them when we were in the hall, but in our room, we heard nothing. This was a wonderful plus. Breakfast provided each morning. We grabbed just a muffin, orange juice and coffee, but they were each top quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mardi Gras Location in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: CharmChari
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Iberville Suites! There were three couples travelling together and we al stayed there and loved it! Very clean, very roomy, and perfect location. Its part of the Ritz Carlton so you can use the lounges and facilities of the RC while saving your money to eat at the many fabulous restaurants around town!!! The Mardi Gras parade route goes right in front of the hotel. Security was excellent with all the thousands of people on the streets, they checked to make sure anyone entering the hotel was staying there. One block away was Bourbon Street - just far enough away so you couldn't hear any noise, and close enough that you were a 3 minute walk to all the action. Back at the hotel.......big comfy king size bed, wet bar, mini fridge, plenty of space. Very clean! Great continental breakfast (complimentary!!!) in the lobby each morning. Staff was helpful and courteous and pleasant at all times. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will absolutely stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Done Right!!”
Reviews.Author: StaciP3
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The room was great, one bedroom king suite. The staff was extremely helpful with food and parade suggestions. Cont. Breakfast every morning was a big plus, and big money saver. They had a PC available for use in the lobby as well. Mid-30's couple who don't party much. Was only 50 yards from Bourbon and Canal, so we could walk, get our party on, and get back to the hotel with no issues whatsoever. I couldn't recommend this place any more, it was absolutely perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money plus connected to the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: NJOYNC2CA
Reviews.Content: The Iberville Suites is a nice hotel. Free continental breakfast. Nice rooms. Bathrooms are in need of repair. Ours (Room 730) had cracked tile, basin, and the bathtub was stained. The location is great. Try Deanie's across Iberville. The Ritz has free jazz on the weekend. You can use all the Ritz's amenities (i.e. Workout equipment). Overall not a bad place. Never smelled gas. I guess they fixed it. You have to pay $12.95 for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Carbon Monoxide”
Reviews.Author: AKAT26
Reviews.Content: is an odorless gas. These 3 people complained about smelling it, neither one of them mentioned the symptons of poisoning from carbon monoxide. I can't find any news articles about this and think there would be so. Please write helpful reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Carbon Monoxide Poisoning at Iberville Suites”
Reviews.Author: dsamma1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Iberville Suites with my wife and daughter for 4 days/3 nights. The place looks very nice, is well kept, and staff was all very friendly; exactly what I expect from a "Luxury Hotel". During 4 days we were there, there was a strong gas smell in the elevator lobby of our floor. It was brought to the attention of the hotel each day, and each day they said that they had fixed it, though it obviously had not. On day 4, a guest finally called the New Orleans Fire Department and the upper floors had to be evacuated. The carbon monoxide levels were so high that several people were ambulanced to the hospital, including my 18 month old daughter for blood testing. This problem was avoidable and there are many things that I am upset about: 1. The management had been notified of the problem (by guests) and did not fix it 2. When asked about the problem, they either lied or were ignorant (which is unexcusable and negligent) 3. When EMS was testing everyone's carbon monoxide levels and adminstering oxygen, not a single person from the hotel came over to ask if we were OK or inform us of the cause of the gas leak. If you stay at this hotel, you may not be exposed to a gas leak as we did. However, you may never know if there is a safety concern because they will not tell you. They will not fix a problem that endangers you (or your family). And if you are hurt and/or sent to the hospital, they will not care. There are a lot of nice hotels in New Orleans, please stay at one of them.

Reviews.Title: “It Is A 4 Star, But Breathing In Carbon Monoxide for 7 Days Merits Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: flsouri
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel as described in the ad for our 6 day stay for a wedding and accidents do happen,,,but when guests COMPLAIN that the hall smells like gas to the front desk and managers (if you can find one) on a DAILY basis and the same responses are given that it's "the first I've heard of it" or "I'll send the engineer up to look", or "it's been taken care of" and we are all suffering from headaches and nausea!!! When manager Mr. Mills can't tell us anything or apologize or acknowledge there is a very DEADLY PROBLEM and a GUEST has to call the fire department to close off the source of the carbon monoxide! The fire dept came and found co2 in 100-500 parts per million,, ranks deadly! The entire 10th floor evacuated and moved. Duck tape and a too small piece of wood doesnt work to protect your guests. I am furious. They made sure we paid our bill in full, but no apology, just head of security complained to us that He was never notified!!

Reviews.Title: “Good buy for the money”
Reviews.Author: msdillo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Iberville Suites for 4 nights, including Christmas. The location is very convenient, right at the edge of the French Quarter, two blocks down from Bourbon Street. The location was very quiet and was attached to the Ritz Carlton, which was accessible by a little bit of a convoluted route. You can use the workout room at the Ritz for free and the Spa for the listed prices. The suites themselves are not huge but you do have a bedroom which is completely separate from the small sitting area. The bathroom is also rather small. I think that some of the rooms have been more recently refurbished as my daughter' s suite was somewhat better appointed than ours. Also, many of the suites face the interior of the hotel so that you only see windows of other parts of the hotel, so no view. This does make it very quiet since you have no street noise. If you want an outside view, you should ask for it specifically. There were a few issues with our room - one burned out light and chest of drawer handles that came off in our hand. There was mold in the bathtub of our suite, but not in our daughters. We were able to get these fixed the next day, except for the mold. The lobby is very luxurious and the continental breakfast is what you would expect - bagels, rolls, cereal, etc. Good coffee, though. Our rate was quoted at an average of $129/day. But we used valet parking, which you will need if you have a car, which cost an additional $32/day plus tax and tips. The wi-fi didn't work in our room but the DSL did and came at a cost of $13.99/day. When you add all this up, you get very close to $200/day, which we still felt was reasonable given that we had a suite and the location. So we would stay there again if we were in New Orleans. With just a little bit of extra effort on the maintenance of the rooms, this could really be an exceptional hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: nbs409
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 17-month-old son, and I stayed at the Iberville Suites with my sister and brother-in-law after Christmas. We traveled (as we always do) with our son's little lamb "lovey" that we have affectionately named "Lammy". He has had Lammy since birth and rarely goes a night without it. We all had a lovely meal at Galatoire's and sometime in between leaving Galatoire's and returning to our room at the Iberville Suites, Lammy got lost. My husband and I frantically searched the hotel room and while he went to retrace our steps, I called the front desk to see if anyone had turned it in. My husband and I were both unsuccessful in our attempts to locate Lammy and The Ritz Carlton (which is adjacent to the Iberville Suites) sent up two stuffed animals because they heard that our son had lost his. We were very appreciative of their kindness! The following morning, I asked the front desk if anyone had turned in our son's lamb and I also asked the bellmen downstairs if they had seen it. Our attempts were again unsuccessful and we drove back to Mississippi later that morning. That night, we received a call from the hotel saying they had found Lammy and they were keeping it at the front desk. It is now being mailed to our house and we look forward to our son's reunion with his lamb! We can all sleep peacefully! The staff at the Iberville Suites were very friendly and I appreciate the care and concern that they placed in the location of our son's lamb. I have already tried to make my reservations for next year (but it doesn't go to Dec. 2010 yet). I will definitely stay there again when I am in New Orleans! Many, many thanks to the Iberville Suites!

Reviews.Title: “overall good experience and great value”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl98
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience at this hotel was good. The shared amenities with the Ritz were great - we took advantage of the patio, visiting the bar there, concierge, the fitness center, pool and whirlpool. The continental breakfast was really good. The lobby area was meticulously clean. Location was good although we spent a ton of time walking and probably would have preferred something closer to the river. Staff was pleasant enough but the service at the Ritz was noticeably friendlier. The rooms were adequate and, considering the price, a good value. When we first walked into the room the overall impression was very impressive. The layout of the room was nice with the 2 room suite. Our room had big beautiful windows up on the 9th floor with a fantastic view. The only downsides of the room are: bed seemed older and not very comfortable, thin walls (could hear the neighbors talk), hot water was adequate but barely when turned up all the way, older model TV's, sofa a little hard to sit on, no full length mirror. All of these things we lived with and still would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripmyworld
Reviews.Content: Iberville Suites New Orleans is a pretty hotel. I really liked its design and the service as well was one of a kind, not to mention the location which is excellent. We (my husband amd I) booked a double room over there in Last minute travel web site for less than 85$ a night, and I believe it is a very good price for a luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rodent traps?”
Reviews.Author: rossd72
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I was in town for the Saints/Cowboys game so I knew I wouldn't be in my room that much, but that being said, the 4 hours I was there weren't that great. I checked in around 4pm and was given the keys to a room on the 6th floor. Not sure if some of the rooms went through a remodel but this one didn't. The room wasn't a suite, it was 2 queen beds, the carpets were soiled, and the tv stand was kind of pulled away from the wall which seemed strange. So when I went to push it back I noticed a rather large rodent trap....it was kind of a white tube I guess designed to trap a rather large rodent(rat, mice, etc..). Ok, so that was a little strange to me especially with how great the reviews were on this hotel. So I call the operator just trying to get some reassurance that I won't wake up with Mickey Mouse in the room with me. I explain why I'm calling and she transfers me back to the front desk where I just checked in only to be told there is nothing they can do. I didn't want them to do anything other than tell me the traps are only there for safety or its part of a standard hotel code or something. So I pursue it b/c I figured I'm headed to the game and won't be back for a while. I didn't get back to the room until about 2am and had to get up at 6am. I didn't notice before but the beds were also slightly pulled back, so it prompted me to look underneath and there were the same rodent traps under each bed as well.......so the 4 hours of sleep I got were with the light on! Now in the past year, I've been to NOLA for work and stayed in the Ritz, Marriott and most recently at the W. All these hotels are hands down nicer than the Iberville Suites. And its a shame b/c the lobby is really clean and nice, the location is great....close to Bourbon but kind of a "hidden gem".....until you actually check in to a room, and then it looks like a Motel 6. So I wouldn't recommend this b/c you don't put big rodent traps out like that for no reason.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've found after 15 years of visiting New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Libbyb
Reviews.Content: So happy we have found the Iberville Suites. From the moment we arrived to the end of our stay we had nothing but great things to say. Ease of check-in, nice continental breakfast, clean, well-appointed rooms. Fast elevators! Great location. We have stayed at many of the smaller hotels in the Quarter for the Old World charm and the Iberville Suites beats them all. This will be my number one pick from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Parfait”
Reviews.Author: DidierB1
Reviews.Content: Very well located next to Bourbon Street, the suites are very comfortable and adapted to travellers, kitchen, iron set, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: Gtownhome
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Halloween weekend, ordered room service, instead of a sandwich, the hotel served a large portion of food poisoning. Tried to tell management but the manager Marlo Mills was unavailable. Wrote a letter to the hotel and it took them a month to respond. Basically management doesnâ€™t care that a guest was sick from the hotel food. Definitely wonâ€™t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Destinlocal0712
Reviews.Content: Friends and my husband and I stayed here anticipating our cruise. What a great hotel for the price. I have stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for business, and this hotel is attached. The rooms were spacious, nicely appointed, and the service was great. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Iberville Suites”
Reviews.Author: Tedsgurrll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites from October 29 through November 1, 2009. After we found the front lobby of the Iberville Suites, which is a bit confusing because it is connected to the Ritz Carlton, we began the process of checking in. This was not as simple as it should have been due to the fact that there was no record of our reservation! I am not sure who was in error, the hotel or Travelocity, but it turned out well-they had rooms available. Thanks to Ebony for keeping us calm when we thought we would be sleeping in the lobby!! The next minor glitch occured when we went up to uor room only to find that the bed, which we thought would be a KING sized bed was really more the size of a queen. We returned with our things to the front desk to get another room. The next room we were assigned was no different. We picked up the phone to cal Ebony who came up to our new room to explain that every room was equiped exactly the same. We explained the name KING Suite led us to believe that we would have a KING sizes bed...long story short, we were happy enough with the room. Each room/suite comes with an living room style area that had a pull out sofa, a tv that has cable and a gaming system, a desk with a chair, a floor lamp, an end table with another lamp, another comfy chair, and a wet bar. There is also a nice mini fridge and coffee pot that comes with coffee and additives. There are plenty of electrical out lets and a phone in that area. Drinking glasses anc coffee cups as well as an ice bucket for a trip to the ice machine were also handy. The bathroom was clean and modern. The vanity/sink area was nicely lit and there was a shelf above the basin that gave us extra space to spread out our things. Belive me, two sinks come in handy for two women traveling together, especially when they are trying to get ready for a costume ball! There is a blow dryer in the bathroom, which does help to cut down on your packing. The toilet was easy to flush-no worries with plumbing. The shower was large and clean as well. No signs of mold! The shower head must be a low flow type to conserve on water, and the water never really got hot, but the temperature was fine. There were plenty of towels, toilet paper, kleenex, and nice assortment of Bath and Body soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. There were also cotton balls and cotton swabs. The towels were just the right thickness-and in very good condition. The bedroom area has the bed with night tables and lamps on either side, a large TV in an armoir that contains three nice sized drawers, another large desk/table and a large closet with plenty of hangers, a luggage rack, spare blanket and pillow for the pull out sofa, and a safe for your valuables. The hotel offers room service and wireless access is available for a fee. Guests may use the spa at the Ritz Carlton, but we forgot our swim suits and didn't get to take advantage of that perk- I am not sure, but there may be a small daily fee. The Iberville Suites also shares an amzingly beautiful court yard with the Ritz that we enjoyed each night. There is a complimentary breakfast in the lobby each morning. You can enjoy coffee, tea, orange juice, hot or cold cereals, muffins, bagels, toast and make your own waffles. There are also apples and low fat yougurt. Because we are fans of Cafe DuMonde, we only ate breakfast in the lobby once! The hotel is only a short walk from Bourbon Street, Mena's Palace- a great local place for food, and Canal Street. This was an ideal location for us for the Haloween weekend. We were close enough to everything to walk, and far enough removed from the crowd and noise of the night life. We felt safe at all times every where we went, and we covered a lot of ground that weekend. The hotel was always clean-our room was kept spotless by the housekeeping staff, and everyone we met who worked for the hotel was always friendly and helpful. The Iberville Suites doeas allow pets. We saw several dogs on leashes in the lobby at different times during our stay, but would not have known they were there otherwise. Over all, we were very pleased with our stay at Iberville Suites and enjoyed New Orleans once again!!

Reviews.Title: “As Always Iberville Suites remains on top”
Reviews.Author: Frnchangel4u
Reviews.Content: This trip is our 5th stay at Iberville Suites and we go back for a reason, you cant beat the excellant customer service. There is not a single person on thier staff that would not bend over backwards for you. The rates are great and the location is perfect. Go out the door and walk a short block to Bourbon st. or Canal St. right behind you. We had problems with our flight and got there a day late and were worried about losing our room due to the high volume of visitors for the saints game, voodoo festival and the fact it was Halloween weekend. Cody Vega, Asst. Operations Mgr. assured us we wouldnt lose our room and went even further by giving us a larger room with a roll away bed. That was greatly appreciated because wanted a suite so our friends were not sleeping next to us and they did not want to sleep on the sofa bed together. It all worked out perfectly thanks to Cody. She and all the rest of the staff repeatedly asked if there was anything they could do for us. They make you feel like royalty. Remember the Ritz Carlton is there sister hotel and attached so you can use thier ammenities anytime. Try this Hotel, you wont be disappointed, they have much to offer including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: bwwst
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights on a business trip. Excellent hotel. Staff extremely helpful, rooms clean and large, location is just next to the French Quarter. Acme Oyster House is half a block away, a Walgreens is half a block farther. Fifteen minute walk to Cafe du Monde. I would definitely stay here again. This hotel is adjacent to the Ritz, and shares facilities. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: DodieMaine
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. Having the suite was really nice with 3 women in one room. Having two sinks was especially nice. It was a very clean quiet hotel. They were very helpful with all of our needs. Just wish they had free wifi. I think $12.00 a day is a little ridiculous. It was within walking distance to anything we wanted to do. We went in August and it was warm, but everything is air conditioned and the nights were great.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: SeattletoTahiti
Reviews.Content: We walked by essentially every hotel in the city and the location really couldn't be beat. Block from Bourbon, block from Canal. Sharing the same building with the Ritz really classed things up. The downside - 2 elevators to get to your room. The rooms were huge...separate seating area with pull-out couch and tv. I am one to never stay in the same room twice when going on vacation, but I would likely stay here again (unless I wanted an outdoor pool).

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: mart3197
Reviews.Content: the concierge and staff was excellent, as well as the hotel being adjacent to the Ritz Carolton hotel. Each guest gets the full use of the Ritz Carolton's amenities if the price of the Ritz is too expensive for them to stay. While you're you have to check out the restaurant..."EXCELLENT" with a live band with low lit lights, very romantic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites”
Reviews.Author: Debberly
Reviews.Content: Iberville Suites more than met our expectations. It's in a great location with reasonable rates. The Suite aspect makes it great for traveling with friends. There is a living room with a pull out queen bed and a bedroom with a queen or king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Choice in the Crescent City"”
Reviews.Author: caliroan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Iberville Suites and were very pleased with our stay. The location on the edge of the French Quarter is ideal for people who want to be "near" nightlife but not right in the thick of things. The casino is a ten minute walk, the French Market about 15 minutes. You're a block off Canal Street and the St. Charles street car that travels into the Garden District. There's a Walgreens two blocks down the street, and Acme Oyster House is just a 3-minute stroll away. The hotel's lobby atmosphere is old New Orleans/traditional, lots of marble and portraits in gilt frames. Room 728 was clean, comfortable, and very quiet. The shower drain was on the slow side. A nice sized fridge was a bonus. Complimentary breakfast at the hotel was very good. Fresh waffles, bagels, muffins and bread for toast. Bananas and apples, grits and oatmeal, excellent coffee and orange juice. We did not use the amenities at the Ritz, although we did stop in the Ritz bar for excellent cocktails. Iberville Suites staff was very friendly and genuine. The bellhops gave us excellent directions. The hotel is very service oriented. This one lived up to its excellent TripAdvisor reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Airbuscaptden
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9/24-27. This hotel is older and part of the Ritz-Carleton, but dollar for dollar one would be hard pressed to find better given its location and staff. Only one and a half blocks from Bourbon St and easy walking distance to most of the main area attractions and streetcar lines. The staff are very friendly, always have a smile, and very helpful. The rooms are nice, nothing fancy. About the only things that one could wish was better was a larger bathroom, newer T.V.s and free internet. Good for all: singles, couples, families, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: karol_monteiro
Reviews.Content: This can be a pretty good hotel. Good location, good staff, good parking. I stayed there as a big family reunion, plus some close friends. No one had complaints about it. Good location for the French Quarter, and safe to walk around at night too. We stayed in each room with 4 people, however the 'guest couch bed' was a little uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room”
Reviews.Author: MWTrvler
Reviews.Content: The room was good sized and clean. Though this hotel is a sister hotel of the rtiz carlton, so it seem that the front desk only were there to check you in and if you needed anything else you were sent to the staff at the rtiz. Had access to the ritz fitness center which was excellent. Only one issue during the stay room key stopped working and it took security & maintenance 1hr till they decided they could not fix timely so they moved us to another room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: chocokat96
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for one night on a recent trip, it was only an hour out of our way to see New Orleans as opposed to some hotel along our route, so we figured why not? We arrived at the hotel valet area and were promptly greeted by an employee who took care of helping us get our luggage out, and get our car registered. You do have to use their valet and there is a cost to it, but we got a package stay and park deal, so it was included. After getting our luggage, we made our way to the beautiful lobby area. The woman at the front desk was very friendly, and when they had us down for a queen suite instead of a king (I would recommend printing your itinerary, as that helped us prove we'd asked for a king), she quickly changed our room. She also took out a map and began writing recommended sites to visit and restaurants to eat at. The first room we went to was strangely locked from the inside, but a member of housekeeping was on the floor at the same time and she called up her supervisor, who got us switched to the room across the hall. The room was very nice, with a couch bed/sitting area, then a refrigerator and sink area, bathroom, and finally the bedroom. We didn't have a view from our room, but that was ok by us. The hotel is in the PERFECT location, we walked to dinner and then walked around the French Quarter and along the river, before returning by way of Bourboun Street. As other reviewers have said, one of the perks of this hotel is that its owned by the Ritz. From 5-9PM on Thursdays and 9PM-1AM on Friday and Saturday, the Ritz has live jazz in their lobby, which is easily accessible by an elevator from the lobby of the Iberville Suites. We only made it to the last half hour of music by the time we got back, but it was a good time, and I would recommend it! The bed was very comfortable, and the breakfast was pretty standard, fruit, cereal, coffee, instant oatmeal/grits, with the exception of the waffle maker, which was a nice addition. All in all we had a great stay, especially considering the lower cost than other "fancy" hotels in New Orleans. I am looking forward to going back for more than just one night! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Amemait
Reviews.Content: Iberville Suites is close to Bourbon Street, making it a great place to stay if you're planning to experience the New Orleans night life. Within walking distance, it's a great place to stay and walk to the nearby restaurants, bars, and night life. The rooms are laid out well, with a sleeper sofa in the front room with a door separating it from the bedroom. The bathroom was comfortable. If you don't want housekeeping waking you up in the morning, be sure to hang the "Privacy Please" notice on the door. Otherwise, they'll come back again and again. After a night on the town, I'd like to have slept without interruption, but I forgot the notice. :-) Parking isn't the best, and valet is a bit too costly for my taste. But if you like to gamble, park at the Harrah's garage, play a while in the casino, and get validated (up to 3 days at a time as of this review). It's a bit of a walk, but it's the most cost-effective way to park. Just unload/load your bags at the hotel and walk to/from the garage. Would I stay there again? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: laurafi
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to New Orleans and I'm so happy we discovered the Iberville Suites. We will definitely stay here for our next visit. We booked the Iberville Suites for a combination business and leisure trip. I had to go to a conference during the day, but at night we could both explore the French Quarter. Good location in the French Quarter - one block off Bourbon so quiet but close to the action (if Bourbon St is your thing). You are on the end closer to Canal so you will need to walk five minutes to get to the central part but that is part of the fun of the French Quarter, wandering down the many streets. We could easily explore the French Quarter, enjoy the restaurants (two of our favorites are near the hotel: Bayona and GW Fins), and take the streetcar to the Garden District. The service was wonderful. From the valet who we saw when we can and left the hotel (this was the only strange thing with the hotel is the entrance seems to be off an ally where valet is for both Iberville Suites and the Ritz Carlton) to the reception we were always greeted with genuine warmness. The concierge was able to get reservations at a restaurant that was booked for weeks in advance. It was great have a bedroom and a sitting room to spread out - we didn't feel cramped. The rooms were very clean and quiet - I don't think I even heard a door down the hall close. Breakfast is complimentary and includes the usual (cereal, fruit, bagels, muffins) but you can also make waffles fresh if you want and they had fresh squeezed orange juice. And you have full access to the Ritz Carlton which is connected through a "secret" elevator (just a little hard to find) but you can use anything there including their pool, night time jazz shows, etc. So for the service (really stellar), good sized clean and quite rooms, and location, the Iberville Suites really is a great value. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness much improved!”
Reviews.Author: DiscriminatingDiva08
Reviews.Content: When we stayed here about 4 years ago, I wrote how disappointed I was with the housekeeping. The carpets were stained and the toilet rim was dirty. This was not the case this visit. The Ritz staff, next door, must have had some influence to "clean up their act". There was, however, no change in the attitude of the front desk clerks. They barely crack a smile and act like they can't wait to get you up to your room. Very cold and uncustomer-service like. Where are you Ritz trainers?? Room was spacious, bed was comfortable. For the price, the location can't be beat. And, use of the Ritz gym and spa was a great plus. Not sure when I'll return to New Orleans. The poor town just ain't what it used to be. Much seedier than the last time I visited. Even Emeril's New Orleans was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: chi_kevt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Iberville Suites for 4 days/3 nights during the 4th of July Weekend. For the price of the suite, you are better off staying at the Ritz Carlton. The Iberville has old 25 inch TV sets, the Ritz Carlton has flat screens. You share the same facilities as the Ritz Carlton, so why not stay there. It is also a headache to get to your room as you need to take on average 2-3 elevators (depending on what entrance you use). If you get the Iberville Suites for less than $100, book it. If not, you should spend a few more dollars to stay at the Ritz Carlton. I will NEVER stay at the Iberville as the Ritz Carlton is WAY better.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a hidden gem!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirlie
Reviews.Content: Tucked behind the Ritz-Carlton is the gem Iberville Suites...So nice to have a couple of rooms to spread out in! My husband could work on business at the large desk in the room that also included a small sofa and television, and there was still the bedroom with its separate 25' tv and door to close between a small kitchen area and bathroom for me to be away from the business! The valet and front desk people were so nice and helpful, and being in such a fancy hotel just makes you feel happy! I walked out my door and could get to all areas of the french quarter and waterfront easily. I highly recommend this place! There is a charge for parking, but we were able to get a "Park 'n Stay" package that included this service and we were able to ask for the car numerous times and they had it waiting there for us quickly and professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale for a cheaper price”
Reviews.Author: gabbigirl
Reviews.Content: The suites are connected the the Ritz Carlton. You enter from iberville in the back fo the Ritz which faces Canal Street, Iberville looks sort of like an alleyway, but once you get into the main lobby the decor is gorgeous, very classy. Our room was not just a hotel room you'd expect for an average of $100/night. it was a huge suite complete with a seperate room with couch and second tv. the bed was comfortable, bedding clean, towels soft. The furniture was nice as well. We both felt like we were staying in a luxurious hotel. They also serve a free continental breakfast which was minimal but did its job. It is within walking distance of everything in the quarter. The only thing I warn about is getting around this hotel. you need to take multiple elevators to get to the Ritz and from street level, but once you figure it out it is great! I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: NolaGirl29
Reviews.Content: Everyone went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, elegant and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: nawlins95
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night during 2nd weekend of Jazz Fest. This hotel was beautiful, clean, and elegant, with huge suites, fridges in the room, all the amenities you would want. I have stayed in New Orleans probably 50+ times and this was one of the best. New Orleans has almost 2 classes of hotels - the "boutiquey" older (with antiques in the rooms) hotels and the chains. I used to hate going to the chains because I felt like since New Orleans was an old, unique city, I didn't want to waste money and time with a chain I could stay at anywhere. But the problem with some of the smaller boutique places is that they don't keep them as clean and things can be more run down. Now that I am older, I am over that whole scene. Iberville Suites felt like staying in a Ritz Carlton (to which it is attached).

Reviews.Title: “Low expectations, high return”
Reviews.Author: mikemeg
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife, and our 11-year-old daughter stayed Sat night through Wed, and paid $140, $70, and $70 on the respective nights. It had a comfortable bed (the kid slept in the fold-out). Rooms looked a little old, but by that I just mean you could tell it wasn't a brand-new hotel. Still quite nice. A perfectly good breakfast buffet in the attractive lobby each morning (standard breads, cereals, make-it-yourself waffles). The location was fantastic: a block and a half north of Bourbon St, a block off Canal. Close enough for an easy and safe walk to bars, shops, restaurants, and streetcars, far enough for silence. The low price and the lack of publicity made me think it was a risk, but we found it to be an exceptional value. Not many amenities (at least not many that we used), but a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and I am picky.”
Reviews.Author: KOG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Iberville from April 23-26, and I couldn't agree more with the positive reviews of it. Location - excellent. A block away from both Bourbon and Canal streets. Although close enough to the action, you are removed from the noise. It is attached to the Ritz and you get to use amenities at the hotel. For instance, gym use was $12 per room (not person), which I found reasonable. You also had charging privileges at the restaurant at the Ritz, which we took advantage of (and concierge services) Room - The room was clean, appointed well, and we didn't have anything to complain about. We booked a king suite and they gave us a queen suite upon check-in, but it was quickly rectified when we brought it their attention. Staff - The staff was very friendly and it was very evident that they follow customer service guidelines of the Ritz. Food - They had a free continental breakfast of bagels, cereal, juice, waffles, oatmeal, etc. Some protein would've been nice, but I won't complain since what we got was free. Overall, it was a great hotel, great location, and enjoying the Ritz service at a great discount was welcome. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific elegant hotel: poor man's "Ritz Carelton"”
Reviews.Author: davidhjChicago
Reviews.Content: Actually this hotel shares a building with the Ritz Carelton-- very good value at least in off season- But can't stay there again: they charged 10% of my room rate for wireless internet. Only a few hotels do this anymore and though I can 'afford' the charge, it is absurd to be nickeled and dimed when very other hotel-- even Red Roof Inn gives internet away. So Iberville management: wake up and be more competitive-- offer free internet and I'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT ON THE MONEY LOCATION-AMENITIES-OVERALL VALUE”
Reviews.Author: NANDO100
Reviews.Content: Great Place, great service, excellent value! good location nice continental bkfast, if traveling with biz colleague due to travel budget limit in this hard economic times, as small business owners my self and biz partner attended conference, nice thing about room is that you have separate sleeping quarters, staff is very nice,with great recommendations for dining "off the beathen path" to places away from french quarter where locals go try out mandinas on canal street, sea food platter is great for dinner

Reviews.Title: “Great price, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: nursenjm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days on business, 2 for fun w/spouse. Our sofa had tear in cover, flipped it over and it was fine [they should have done that] Staff very helpful and friendly, loved the suite room for the price! Used the concierge at the Ritz several times, never blinked an eye when we weren't actualy Ritz guests, treated us just as well. Could not find anywhere how much internet access cost [12.99] asked at desk for something in print so I could show my work for reimbusement, could not find anything. fitness center is at the Ritz and costs extra FYI continental breakfast is just OK, but it's free and isn't cereal/toast and coffee what you need the morning after??? loved the location, close to the action, but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: eggerliz
Reviews.Content: We arrived on New Year's Day for our 10 year anniversary. The Sugar Bowl was on January 2. Everything in the city was crazy!!! The hotel was perfect, no waiting, no confusion!!! My favorite part about this hotel is that it was connected to the Ritz Carlton. you received all of the ammenities of the Ritz, but without the extra price. I loved the suite set up. The continental breakfast was great! The elevators going to the streets are shared with the Ritz. I shared the elevator one morning with a couple staying in the Ritz, and as I exited they said, "Hey...we don't get continental breakfast." The location was great! I can't say enough good things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Hailey Jane
Reviews.Content: A great value and beautiful hotel (well located). Connected to the Ritz with access to their amenities for a daily fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_NYC2
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Good Location - within walking distance to everything in the French Quarters * Good Breakfast - Coffee was excellent * Room was large and clean * Friendly Staff Cons: * None

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff Attitude”
Reviews.Author: JULIE08LIVERPOOL
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, the suites were roomy & well equipped. However what really set it apart from others was the consistent, genuine, freindly and helpful attitude of all the staff we encountered, from the receptionists on the desk to the bell boys collecting our bags. Everyone was happy and well prepared to go the extra mile for the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, great location”
Reviews.Author: CATravelerFremont_CA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from New Orleans, and spent 5 nights at the Iberville. I had business meetings at the Ritz, but the $200+ price tag was too high for my company, so I spent $120 to stay right next door. You can't ask for a better location in NOLA. Right on the edge of the French Quarter, around the block from Canal Street (where the Mardi Gras parades run), and a few blocks from Bourbon Street, Jackson Square, Cafe DuMonde, restaurants, art gallaries and antique stores. And far enough away from Bourbon so that you can go to a quiet room when you've had enough craziness. The room was huge, with a wet bar and fridge. Comfortable bed, friendly staff, great breakfast every morning. Two minor suggestions for improvement: no full length mirror in the room, and the cord on the hair dryer was so short I kept hitting my elbow on the wall (I told you they were minor!). There was no business center, but you can get on-line for $7.50 at the Ritz. I will definitely consider staying there again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time...will return”
Reviews.Author: Tbone212
