Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibeville Suites at the start of Mardi Gras February 12-16, 2009. The hotel staff was very helpful, answering all of our questions. Great continential breakfast every morning. The location was within walking distance to everything in the French Quarters. There are great restaurants (ACME Oysters House, Deanies) and shops in the area. This hotel is two blocks from Bourbon Street and one block from Canal Street. Because this hotel is inside of the Ritz Carlton you have all access to the amenties of the Ritz. We had a great time, looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: BrianOhio
Reviews.Content: Great location and has the best kept secret-Pet Friendly! No need to keep a car,walking distance from various restuarants. Watch out they charge daily for internet service and for the fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: jkh81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the Ritz b/c I booked too late to get a room with the block at the Ritz itself. The room itself is pretty nice- lots of space, comfortable bed, clean, and attractive in a very generic way. The room set up (two TVs, a sofa bed and a king size) would actually be great for families or girlfriend weekends (especially since you have easy access to their spa). The location is also nice- right at the edge of the Quarter, so it's an easy walk to restaurants, but still quiet. BUT I've had far better service (and breakfast) at a Hampton Inn. It took forever to get anything from the concierge/motor pool/front desk...WHEN you could actually get them to answer the phone. They treat you like you're somehow a second class citizen 'cause you're not staying at the actual Ritz or Maison Orleans. Never mind that you're still paying a lot...you're not paying enough for them to consider you to be important. Also, you have to pay far too much for "extras" that should be standard in a business hotel, like wireless internet. If you also go to the gym and park, you've added $100/day onto your room. New Orleans has a lot of great hotels. Unless you really need the suite-type set-up, I'd look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “They Overbooked!”
Reviews.Author: sighwest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a suite at Iberville through Expedia weeks ago. We arrived on my birthday at about 2:30 pm, tired from our 7 hour drive from Memphis and were told that our king suite wasn't ready yet. The lady at the front desk then told me to give her my cell number and she would call us when it became ready. At the time, it didn't seem like a big deal...we did arrive 15 minutes before check-in, so we would walk around a bit. THREE HOURS LATER, we returned to the front desk, because she didn't ever call! ONLY THEN is when she told us that they overbooked, and that they were putting us across the street at Chateau Bourbon. As another man beside me was given the same spill, another front desk lady told him that they would be comping his first night's stay. I had to speak up and ask if I was receiving the same treatment to which the woman stated "of course". She said that they would have Expedia credit our account for one night's stay. OH, and she also said that we needed to COME BACK over to the Iberville tomorrow, for check-in at 3:00. She filled out a form and and told us to give it to the bellman, and he would escort us to the Chateau. That happened and we finally got into our room at 6 pm. We didn't make my bday dinner reservation at GW Fins....I called and they couldn't accommodate us at a later time because they were booked up. Once we got to the Chateau Bourbon, the woman at the front desk (Karen) was wonderful! We told her we wanted to stay there for the rest of our trip, and she said she would take care of everything. She even lowered their room rate to match Iberville's. Next day, I decided I'd better call Iberville to let them know we were not returning for the 2nd night, and the same woman I dealt with the day before answered and said that our 2nd night was already paid for. I said "well can't you credit our account?" She said she would have to talk to her supervisor. After being put on hold, she said that her supervisor told her to credit our account. These front desk ladies were unapologetic and completely apathetic...I'm still fuming about the whole experience. Someone at the Chateau said they did this to 31 people that day. What a birthday it was thanks to Iberville Suites!

Reviews.Title: “OK but had one problem”
Reviews.Author: dwarrenty
Reviews.Content: Nice location, nice rooms. You will pay $32 for parking your car, and you will have to park your car there. Per instructions I called down ahead of time for my car (it was after all 4:30 am). A woman answered and said the car would be ready. Within five minutes I checked out and went outside, saw the station empty but figured she was just getting the car (the garage is not in the same building). After 15 minutes I started looking for someone and they found the woman in an office right next to me, she had forgottem all about me! By the time she did get my car I was 30 minutes late for the airport and barely made my flight. For $32 I would expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME DEAL!”
Reviews.Author: purplefuzzie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Iberville Suites in December 08 while visiting New Orleans for a Saints/Falcons game. I was very impressed with our stay. The rate for us to stay here didn't seem right when we checked in! The hotel is immaculate and the staff was AWESOME! I was wondering to myself when I was going to be surprise with the real reason this hotel was such a good price...by the end of the trip I had just come to realize it was just truly a great deal and I was so happy to have come across it!!! The rooms were very large and accommodating. Location was great as it is only one block away from Bourbon, so you are so close to all the action but not too close that you can't get a relaxing nights sleep if you need it. The only two complaints that we had was that you had to go down to the lobby floor to smoke as there are no smoking rooms available in the hotel and also, although we requested one, we didn't have a microwave to heat up leftover food. The food in New Orleans is absolutely awesome, and the portions are HUGE! You will almost always have leftovers and will most definitely want to eat them...but you gotta be able to heat it up!! We were able to take them down to the lobby/front desk and have them heat it up for us. Like I said the staff was great and very courteous! Our next visit to New Orleans we will surely find ourselves staying at the Iberville Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “great for a girl's weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaL81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a girl's weekend!! One block off of Bourbon Street, the hotel is attached ot the itz, so you get the location and amenities at 1/3 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Moonrider
Reviews.Content: We booked this thru Hotels.com and got this hotel at a great price. The price went down 3 times and I was reimbursed for the lower price after calling. This hotel is in a perfect location-within walking distance to everything. It is a quiet hotel-we didnt hear any loud noise from the street. The continental breakfast was average-it did the job for a light breakfast. They even had a waffle maker to make your own waffles. It was perfect to have a light breakfast then head out for a large lunch. The room was very clean and spacious. The bellman was exceptional-friendly and very helpful. This hotel is attached to the Ritz and you can use their facilities. The gym is absolutely gorgeous!! They have everything and anything you need in a gym. They have several treadmills, ellipticals and every piece of gym equipment you need. Very high quality!! We were very impressed. We will definately stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: jillhb
Reviews.Content: wonderful location. lovely lobby. very helpful and friendly staff. excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast from hell”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSW1
Reviews.Content: Iberville Suites is a disgrace to the Ritz Carlton chain of which they are part. (They have direct access to the Ritz-Carlton hotel onto which they back). Breakfast in this hotel is an insult to guests and an experience we have NEVER encountered in any hotel we have stayed in, from 2* to 5*+: In a part of the reception area guests find a few bare wood tables, not very clean. They have to eat out of the cheapest brown throw-away thin plastic plates and plastic cutlery and drink out of carton cups, once they have helped themselves to an unappetizing breakfast. And this is a 4* and expensive hotel, especially for what it is! The ambience is glacial. No one lingers. The atmosphere feels uncomfortable. Reception staff is OK-ish but at no stage did anyone offer help with our luggage to the 9th floor along long corridors. We were glad to move out after one night and stay at the charming, pleasant and beautiful Hotel Maison de Ville nearby, which feels warm and where staff welcome and attention is lovely (and the internet access more than 50% cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: badfx
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Iberville this year, we had planned to stay at Maison Dupuy but transfered out of there as it was vile, but thats a diffrent review. I love the calm serenity at the Iberville and find the front desk staff very professional and friendly. We did have a problem with a leak in our room but we were swiftly and effortlessly moved to another room. Both the rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. Breakfast is a simple help yourself affair which suites me just fine, and there's plenty on offer. As the Iberville is part of the Ritz Carlton hotel you can use the facilities there. I must give a special mention to Claudette Breve a senior concierge at Ritz Carlton. If there was such a thing as concierge university then she would be the principal. Claudette really helped make our stay in New Orleans special, I love it when people are this good at their job. The down side to Iberville is there is no view or private balcony but that means its quiet and if we wanted to sit outside we used the court yard at the Ritz which has a table service for the bar. The only other negative is the waste that is created at breakfast time. The self-service breakfast is served with disposable cups, plates and cutlery. All this plastic and polystyrene goes into the same dustbin and is non-recycled. It is not just Iberville that is wasteful it seems New Orleans is quite a waseful city, nearly every shop has it's air-con up full blast then leaves the door open, how dumb is that? If you're looking for a hotel in the quarter I would definitely recommend the Iberville Suites. Big, clean and comfortable rooms. Brilliant staff and the room service and cocktail bar were pretty special too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTraveler75
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel and was extremely pleased with the room and quality of the employees. This was on of the better hotel experiences that I have had in years. The front desk people and doormen well supurb. I will definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Okietraveller001
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at Iberville Suites. The staff was helpful, pleasant and gracious. I had a problem with my hairdryer and an engineer was there in less than 5 minutes to fix it. My room was large and clean.The bed was comfortable. I never utilized the sofabed in the living area, but did my paperwork at the desk in there. The breakfast was satisfying; there was plenty to choose from: waffles, yogurt, fruit, cereal, toast, english muffins, bagels, coffee, juice, milk and tea. Overall, I was extrememly pleased with my stay and would go there again. It is just one block from Bourbon St, close to the streetcar and Canal St and there are many good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Only if there is not much else....”
Reviews.Author: Yabolo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location in the French Quarter and has reasonable prices but the first room we got was moldy and had a very loud air conditioner.The woman at the front desk made it very difficult to change the room and the staff were generally neither helpful nor friendly. The furnishings were quite tired. With all of the good choices in the French Quarter, I don't recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “great location -- BIG BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CollegeDad
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans to drop our son off at college with a 4 night stay at the Iberville suites. The first night we checked in without a problem. We were all talking in the entry part of the suite while unfolding the sofa bed for my son, and I noticed there were 4 of us in the room. Looking at us on the sink/refridgerator area of the room was a 3 inch Roach (AKA water bug, Palmetto Bug). I didnt say a word to the family and calmly removed my boat shoe and quickly dispatched the intruder to join his dinosaur friends. I did not at that time complain since we had to get up early for the college drop off the next day. The next night, after a hectic day at the school, we returned to the room. My wife calmly said, "what is that on the rug". It was another reenforcement from army of BUG. A brief battle ensued where I emeged victorius. I placed the foul corpse in the plastic ice bucket bag and placed the bag into the sink for display. The next morning I called the front desk asked for the manager and was sent to the voice mail of Trudy. I left a message with my cell phone number stating that my wife was upset and asked for a call back. All that day i didnt receive a call from the hotel but had received several other calls so the phone was working. The next morning I complained at the front desk and was told that there were several front desks and that my call must have been mistakenly directed to the Ritz Carlton front desk. Oh yeah I can see how someone would confuse the hotels! The clerk apologized took my cell number and said I would receive a call shortly. I did not receive a call. Here is my short review of the Iberville Suites New Orleans: Location -- Great Valet Parking - Great ( not cheap) Rooms - Furnishings are old and musty Service - Great Promises but no follow through Free Breakfast - Good Bugs - Large and Bold

Reviews.Title: “Better than it used to be”
Reviews.Author: SteveTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Iberville Suites over the years. It's a decent price and the location is fine. However, as happens with most hotels, it started deteriorating after a while. I stayed at the Suites in 2005 and swore I would never go back. The rooms were awful - dirty carpet, sagging bed, old furniture, etc. But, I was told that the hotel had been renovated since Katrina and I went back to try it. I had a lovely, clean suite and it actually smelled good. The linens were fairly new and the whole place had been spiffed up. I know it's not the Ritz even though they are "sister properties" but the management let the Iberville deteriorate to a ridiculous level before they finally did something. If they would try to keep their hotels reasonably maintained, they would have more loyal customers. I think it's a bad idea to let them deteriorate badly before they are willing to put money back into them. People get a bad impression and they never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty hotel and slow service”
Reviews.Author: cainiarb
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel to find the sink area dirty with several red wine stains from where glasses had been sat down. We ignored that and the stains on the curtains and bedspread. Only one lamp was plugged in so we had to get on the floor and plug them in ourselves. All of these were annoyances but the real kicker was when we were ready for bed. The bed had a FLAT sheet directly on the mattress. There was no mattress pad. Our "ick" factor went up several notches! We called for room service five times over an hour's span of time asking for a mattress pad so our bodies weren't separated from the much used mattress by only a thin sheet. We asked if it was standard practice not to use a mattress pad and no one could tell us. Each call to the front desk we were assured someone would be there in 5 minutes. It never happened. We asked if we could just go to housekeeping, get a pad and make up the bed ourselves. We were told we could NOT! After an hour someone came in to make up the bed using a down comforter as a mattress pad. He made the bed up wrong putting the blanket next to our bodies and the sheet on top of that. We remade the bed, called another hotel and transferred out the next morning. We slept in a VERY worn out bed that sank in the middle. The place was gross. The staff was incompetent. The price was ridiculous - I could have gotten better treatment at a $39.99 a night hotel. Never again!! DeeDee

Reviews.Title: “Family of 11 loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: tawheeler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took all the children and grandchildren to New Orleans for our annual vacation and stayed at the Iberville. We rented 4 king suites, and they were big enough to accomodate 11 of us. The lobby and furnishings are beautiful, and we were greeted warmly by the front desk staff each time we passed by. The rooms were very nice even though the furniture was a little dated (but very tasteful and comfortable). When we first checked in, there was just a few minor things such as one remote control out of 8 needed a battery, and the cold water in one sink out of 8 didn't work. The staff took care of all problems within just a few minutes of notification. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We didn't need housekeeping to come into our rooms, so we just found them each morning and they changed out the linens, trash, and toiletries as requested promptly. There is also an in-room safe. One drawback was lack of a pool except for a lap pool in the Ritz (extra charge if you want to use it because it is part of their spa). However, if a pool is what you need, guests at the Iberville can use the pool at the Marriott. It is a few blocks away and you just have to show them your room key. The continental breakfast was very well stocked with hot and cold cereals, pastries, bagels, english muffins, fresh made waffles, juices, yogurt, milk, hot chocolate, and coffee. This place was a great bargain, and it is only one block from Bourbon Street. If we ever go back to New Orleans, we wil not hesitate to stay here again. Thank you for a great time Iberville Suites!

Reviews.Title: “People make the difference, but beware the additional charges!”
Reviews.Author: A_Fair_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: It's what you'd expect of an older downtown hotel of the mid-upscale variety. Smaller than optimal room size for a "suite", it sports a few older facility issues like narrow hallways and interior windows with no view, but still kept very nice inside. The kindness of the people with whom you come in contact, and the opulence of the interior of the hotel make up for the motel's aging structure. The Iberville Suites is part of a triumvirate of lodgings in the same buildings: Ritz-Carlton, Maison Orleans, and Iberville Suites... all apparently run by the same management. I believe the Iberville is the "value" version of this property. My biggest gripe is how they nickel-and-dime you for some things you'd find complimentary in most upscale hotels. Though there's a basic Continental breakfast, the website fails to mention the expensive internet access -- $12 per day, wired or wireless. The workout facility (next door) is an additional $12 per day. There's a spa for those who can to afford it at an additional cost. That's where the pool is, so you have to pay just to splash. Parking is an additional $30+ per day. It adds up quickly, so figure those add-ons when you consider the great rate you think you're getting! Bourbon Street is very walkable from Iberville Suites (one and a half blocks), and the building is far enough away from all the noise that would exist on a rowdy night on Bourbon Street. All in all, it's about what you'd expect of an older downtown motel with a very nice face lift and kind employees. Just wish they'd be more inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty”
Reviews.Author: missesviv
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at the Iberville Suites, New Orleans. The staff was incredibly nice. You felt very welcomed. The major problem that will stop me from returning is the housekeeping. There has been several news reports on housekeepers just using napkins to clean out glasses or maybe using that blue cleaner to clean glasses, well that is nothing compared to this place. The counters and the table tops were not once wiped clean since the beginning of my stay. I stood there for 6 days. My boys, 4 and 2, ate some waffles and spilled maple syrup on the table and upon check out that table stayed a sticky mess. Yes, I could have cleaned it, but I guess I wanted to see how pathetic the cleaning crew was and sure enough, they were. I called housekeeping to inform them about not wiping off counters and they apologized profusely and said that was not there motto, but aparently it is because the maple syrup is still there. I also notice that the housekeeping staff carry a vacuum cleaner on their wagon of stuff, but it is just for show, because crumbs were everywhere for the six days we were there. Also, do not expect them to change your sheets even if you spilled on them. I had to request our sheets to be cleaned. I had obvious empty coffee cups and plates of finished food and fruit that in any other facility would toss it in the trash NOT HERE! I had to make sure I put it in the already overstuffed tiny trashcan. I had to have the room tidy for the housecleaning crew. I might have well stayed home. It was not relaxing to come back from a fun -filled day to a disgustingly dirty room. The pictures on the websites are beautiful and it does smell like gardenias, but now I think they are trying to hide the smell of the rooms that aren't clean. I can't say how extremely dissappointed I am with the cleaning staff. I will definately not recommend this place to anyone. Maybe their motto is "After a night walking through Bourbon Street our guest will not notice the dirty rooms." So beware, and plan on calling housekeeping everyday to remind them that your room has to be cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the quarter”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I'm in the middle of my stay here right now and this place is great. I have a queen suite and although it's not as big as suites I have stayed in before it's still every bit as nice. Comfy bed, two TVs, furniture is fine. Small wetbar and fridge. Check in took about 90 seconds. Checked in early with no issues, and this was on a holiday weekend. Got a great corner room with a view of the city. Bathroom, which I'm fussy about is nice, good amenities, rain shower in the tub. Lots of nice details here and also as mentioned in other reviews nice and quiet when you need to rest. Room was clean as a whistle and everything worked fine. Access to Ritz facilties is a nice plus. 12 bucks a day for the gym which is state of the art and very unusual in hotel gyms. Some downsides though...No restaurants, bars or snack shop type deals directly connected to the hotel. The continental breakfast is a very nice touch although it's pretty basic Costco muffins and pastries. Staff have all been very accomodating and pleasant but I didn't see a concierge or any bellhops. All in all, this is agreat place to stay and I wouldn't hesitate to make another reservation here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Suite Hotel just off Canal with access to Ritz ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Jo Maine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Iberville for the second weekend of Jazz Festival. The city was booked up and this was our second choice based on Trip Advisor and availability. It was an above average suite hotel that was very clean, but I thought the suite was small about the same size a regular room, but with partitions. On the high side it had a big continental breakfast, access to the Ritz-Carlton Spa, Bourbon Street and public transportation to the Festival.

Reviews.Title: “??? Mixed Review=Depends on what you expect”
Reviews.Author: KnoxTN777
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Beautiful lobby -Ideal location -A few members of the staff were very charming and helpful -Our room was stocked with Bath and Body Works toiletries (not Kiehl's, but better than something generic!) -Quiet overall, especially for the Quarter Cons: -Majority of hotel staff indifferent at best -Miniscule rooms that could benefit from better housekeeping (missing light bulbs, old scratchy sheets) -Our couch with fold-out bed was at least 10-15 years old and hideously uncomfortable, no extra pillows or blankets come with the room -WILL NOT PROVIDE STANDARD SIZED PILLOWS (all pillows, including extra ones we had to request, were these bizarre, 1/3 sized rock hard little devils) -The "hot breakfast" is only continental with waffle iron For the price........you can do better. Not terrible, just many strange, frustrating, easy-to-remedy issues I find confusing from a hotel that shares the Ritz-Carlton building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: loungedog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to celebrate my husband's birthday during the week--between Jazz Fest weekends. We were received warmly by the doorman when we arrived, and had a quick, friendly check-in. Lobby was very well appointed. Our room was spacious and very clean. I liked that there was a separate sitting room with a comfortable couch, desk, TV, refrigerator and wet bar. Always nice to have a place to store your water and snacks when traveling. Bed was comfortable, and we had lots of fluffy pillows. Bathroom was nice--marble tile, marble vanity. But pretty basic tub and shower. Not big, but not ridiculously tiny either. Has programmable quiet AC/Heat unit (not cheap window units you would expect from a hotel in this price point). Got a room service snack in less than 15 minutes. Location was great! Just a block from Acme Oyster House, and a couple of short blocks to Bourbon. Staff was very helpful with various informational requests. We did not hear any noise from our room. We were able to sleep well (when we finally made it back to the room). There are no balconies, and there is no view to speak of. Our room overlooked the roof of another hotel. But the view wasn't our objective. We wanted a "nice" hotel that was in the Quarter, but was quiet when we wanted to sleep. It was very nice that the hotel is connected (literally) to the Ritz. Iberville guests use the same business center as the Ritz. Room service is from the Ritz. But room prices are MUCH lower. Very satisfied with my stay, and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: JandESF
Reviews.Content: Rooms very large and clean, bathroom was smallish but nicely decorated with plenty of towels and toiletries, good shower. Housekeeping service was prompt and thorough. VERY quiet hallways and rooms, but no view. Programmable climate control in the room worked well. Wireless internet access is from the Ritz Carlton next door and costs $13 per 24 hours, expensive but the service was fast and you bill it to your Iberville Suites room. The front desk staff was very friendly, at the same time professional and efficient. Excellent location at the downtown edge of the Quarter, we walked to everything including Riverwalk, casino, aquarium, Arena & Superdome, warehouse dist. restaurants, convention center. This was an excellent value and I'm already planning a return trip with family.

Reviews.Title: “Iberville is Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: Hadassah28
Reviews.Content: You can tell a lot about a property by its public washrooms, and the Iberville Suites washrooms have much to say. They are opulent, and gorgeous. We were a little nervous about booking a hotel so near Bourbon Street in the French Quarter; the Iberville Suites are just down the street from the raucous area. But our fears were unjustified. Our room was pleasant, and quiet. When we arrived, the front desk staff (a young man named Gersan) was as charming and as friendly as could be. We were checked in quickly and efficiently. (At one point, due to airline issues, we called the Iberville to tell them we might not make our reservation, but they said not to worry, and that they'd hold the room. If we missed one evening, there would be no charge. But we made it just fine.) Our room was a lovely surpirse. After winding our way down a maze of hallways on the 9th floor, we found our room, or rather rooms. Our room had both a bedroom, a sitting room, a tiny kitchen area, and a nice-sized bathroom. Clean? It was spotless, except for the very tired and stained carpet. But we weren't sleeping on the floor, so it didn't matter. The bed was huge, with a great mattress, and lots of plump pillows. A large-screen TV (operating perfectly) sat in an armoire. The small sink and refrigerator were very handy. There was a coffee maker, too, but it was far better to go downstairs during the FREE breakfast and get coffee from an urn, and real cream. Our view from our bedroom window was kind of sad, but we loved it. Typcial New Orleans. The breakfast was varied, and ample. Fruit, juice, cereal, yoghurt, fresh hot waffles, and plenty of breads and pastries were available for a reasonable amount of time every morning. Internet is easily available by logging on to the neighboring Ritz Carlton hotel's service. $12.95/day will be added to your bill, but it is a great and easy-to-use wireless connection. Iberville Suites guests are welcome to use the Ritz Carlton amenitites, but that's not really our thing, so we can't report on spas, gym, or pool. But they are there. Back to the public restrooms, they are so well-appointed and so beautifully laid out, one could live there. Every stall has its own solid door, and the counters and mirrors shine in black marble and gold gilt. The Iberville Suites are at the top of our list for a place to stay in New Orleans. Canal Street is just a block up, and the Jackson Brewery (where you can buy 3-day trolley passes) and the Gray Line Tours "Lighthouse," on Toulouse Street is only about a 15-minute walk away. A cab ride from one side of the French Quarter to the other is about $5 plus a $2 surcharge. But walking is the way to go. Especially walking Royal Street with its wonderful antique and art shops. If you want an okay meal quickly, and you don't mind braving Bourbon Street, La Bayou restaurant is right on the corner. The food is tasty; service is fast. But at nighttime, it is very noisy. We booked our stay through Expedia, A king bed, non-smoking room on the 9th floor was $650 including taxes and booking service fees. Tip #1: Don't take a shuttle from the New Orleans airport to the French Quarter; the wait can be ridiculous (especially when a large convention is in town), and the savings are minimal. Take a cab instead; $28 will cover 2 people. Tip #2: Do take a Katrina tour offered by Gray Line Buses. It is amazing. Our driver was not only a great driver, but he was an amazing speaker. Thank you, Sylvestor.

Reviews.Title: “my new home when in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: LR72202
Reviews.Content: i visited new orleans for 4 days covering the easter weekend. i split my stay between 2 hotels. i closed out my trip by staying sunday and monday nights at iberville. others have already mentioned the tricky elevator situation so i wont go too far into that. there were a couple times i got outside and remembered i'd left something in the room. each time i just left it because i didnt feel like making the "trip" back to the room. honestly i was VERY pleased with the room. usually my only requirements are location (close to where i want to go and do), cleanliness (please please please dont be a roach motel), price (atleast give me a fair price) and security (dont burglairze my room and dont rob me in the parking lot). iberville met my expectations in each of these areas. location: the hotel is located at iberville and dauphine st. literally the very next street over is bourbon. this is significant because i spend a good deal of time there. :-) close to the action but amazing quiet. cleanliness: not the most high end furniture but it was clean and comfortable. one thing i did notice is that the bathroom wasnt cleaned well. (hair in the shower from when i shaved the day before) price: for the location and quality i think $80 is a great rate. security: there are safes in the room to place valuables. the room doors has that "flip over thingy" (you know where a chain would be) anyway nobody can get in the room when you're there. even with a key. when i slept, i closed and locked the door to the bedroom(from the living room). even outside, being so close to bourbon there's people around. less chance of being 'caught' alone and becoming a victim of something. parking: theres a self parking lot at burgundy and iberville. so from the hotel one block one way is bourbon. one block the other way is this parking lot. (didnt use it dont know the price). theres also another parking lot across the street from the hotel. standing on the balcony in the hotel lobby. toss a rock and you'd literally hit the side of the parking lot building. its valet. breakfast is complimentary. dont hold me to the exact times but for some reason 6-10am is sticking with me. plenty of orange juice. cold cereal with 3 kinds of milk. make your own waffles. begals. muffins. its a nice spread. gets crowded tho and there's not alot of seating. only negatives i can think of is the elevator situation. guess they did the best they could seeing how its more than one hotel combined (joined with the ritz carlton). second negative (to me) would be the low water pressure. all in all i figure, with any hotel, if you look hard enough something can always be found to complain about. in my opinion iberville is a good value. if i can help it this is where i'll stay each time i go to new orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton may own it but that's where it ends”
Reviews.Author: Edmitchell66
Reviews.Content: Stayed there prior to Katrina and it was great. True Ritz Carlton service - fresh cookies at the desk at noon, real towels to dry your hands on in the lobby bathrooms, clean well appointed rooms in great condition, hot breakfast each morning. Not this time. it was apparent that the management has cut back on all the little things that meant so much. The rooms were clean but felt tired, light bulds out, safe needed a new battery, checked in and was given a room that wasn't cleaned yet, breakfast was a modified continental, staff was courteous but it seemed forced with most. For the price I've had better treatment and service in some of the small hotels in the french quarter. Ritz Carlton Hotel? Maybe Ramada at best. Hopefully it will change but for the price per night you can do way better.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gomezkiller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a 2 day trip to New Orleans and booked a room at the Iberville Suites based on the reviews here. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was just the right size in my opinion. The bathroom was just a tad on the small size compared to other hotels we have stayed at but it wasn't enough to raise an eyebrow to. Like some others, the one thing that did seem awkward was taking an elevator to the lobby and then having to switch to another to go to your room - a minor inconvenience, if any. The hotel staff was super friendly and very accomodating, and the breakfast was plentiful- more than enough to fill even the biggest belly before a day on the town. If you intend to spend a great deal of time in the French Quarter, this is the hotel for you. just a block over from Bourbon Street and not any of the noise or racket from the all-night parties. When to visit the big easy again, the Iberville will be on my short list of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more pleased....”
Reviews.Author: itchin2travel
Reviews.Content: After relying on Trip Advisor (once again) we booked a 4-day stay at Iberville Suites and could not have been more pleased, The location is perfect - 1 block from Bourbon Street and all the action - but the QUIETEST hotel we have ever stayed in! All of the employees we came in contact with were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast is fine - but of course one day you'll want to go to Cafe Dumond for those amazing beignets. The rooms are very, very clean and it truly is a suite - separate sitting area, 2 TVs, etc. We would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: chandeb
Reviews.Content: I had high expectation but the hotel turns out to be just OK. The staff were very nice. The room is showing its age and not 100% clean. Valet parking is $32 a day and internet is $12.95 a day. The latter particularly bothers me as most hotels we stayed in while driving cross country offer complementary high speed internet. Iberville Suites is located at the edge of the French Quarters so it's a little bit of a walk to, say, Cafe du Mode but Bourbon Street is just a block away and the Charles Street streetcar stop is also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room and great location”
Reviews.Author: alwayz_on_vacation
Reviews.Content: We spent march 27-30 at the Iberville Suites. This was our 5th time to New Orleans and I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. Last visit we stayed at the Royal Sonesta, which I would also recommend. The location is within easy walking to bourbon st., the riverfront, harrahs casino, trolley cars stops, the market and many great restaurants, bars, and entertainment. The rooms were very large, clean and nicely decorated. It was nice having an ironing board, refrigerator and coffee maker, as well, as breakfast in the lobby every morning which consisted of waffles, muffins, donuts, cereal, breakfast bars, juice, coffee, etc. I would highly recommend the segway city tour, cajun pride swamp tour, riverboat cruise and a garden district/cemetary tour . . .all are very fun. We have eaten many places and this trip really enjoyed Star Steak and Lobster next to the House of blues. We got a coupon on restaurant.com for $50 off if you spend over $100 which was great. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: clkc86
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans celebrating our anniversary. The Iberville was great for us. We didn't find the staff overly helpful, but we didn't have need of their assistance. The location can't be beat. Great walking to every where in the Quarter. Our room was nicely appointed and was clean and neat. There was ample light for us. We enjoyed having a fridge in the room. The bathroom is nice, not huge but very usable. We have previously stayed at the adjoining Ritz Carlton and thought it compared pretty well, especially considering the price difference. We did not enjoy the breakfast much. We expected a better quality lay out than we were presented with, but if you know this going in it will be OK. It was basically like a motel breakfast, but in much nicer environs. When we return to New Orleans we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: JM144
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we booked this hotel for my husband, me and our 20 year old son. The room layout was perfect. The bedroom could be closed off and the living/sleeping area for our son was separated from us by a small hall area with a large closet and bathroom. We had a little kitchenette area in the main room with a sink, counter, coffee maker and small fridge. There was a TV in each room. The continental breakfast served in the lobby downstairs was totally adequate especially since we ate so much the rest of the day! Overall the hotel was very elegant for the price, and the location on the edge of the French Quarter was perfect. It was quiet but totally close to everything. Acme Oyster House is on the next block. I wouldn't say that the staff was overly friendly at the front desk, but they weren't rude either. The concierge was great and booked several things for us. We stayed for 5 days including New Year's Eve. We encourage everyone to visit New Orleans. It's a wonderful city and they can use our help.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FritzieontheGo
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 kids and one grandmother) had two rooms at the Iberville for 4 (too short) nights starting March 24. From the moment we arrived, we enjoyed such great service, warmth, friendliness and assistance that I'd make this hotel my first choice upon returing to NOLA. The bell staff is excellent there--very friendly and helpful and QUICK! Desk staff was pleasant--always greeting us as we went by. And housekeeping was efficient and thorough. The hotel's location is perfect--just off Boubon. Close to the action but far enough to be quiet. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was great--coffee was always a godsend after a night out, and theirs was hot and tasty. We enjoyed a jazz band in the Ritz's restaurant one night--excellent music and right next door. And there are plenty of great restaurants nearby--try Mr. B's, Acme or Felix's for some tasty seafood. Finally, at the rate we had ($89/night), the room was a steal. For the cleanliness, beautiful lobby, level of service, location and breakfast, I would have expected to pay much more. Parking was an additional $32 a night, but offered quick in-and-out service and great bell personnel, so it was worth it! I really cannot imagine a better stay than the one we just had at Iberville. Kudos to everyone there!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, and the price is definitely right!”
Reviews.Author: vegophile
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Iberville midday, and was greeted by a very friendly valet who immediately signaled a bellman to come over an help us with our luggage. Went upstairs to the lobby, checked-in, and headed to our room. A few minutes later, the bellman arrived with our luggage. The place has a very helpful staff, always willing to help with whatever - including great restaurant recommendations! Location of the place is also great! The building and lobby itself were also very elegant. Room was nice and spacious. Our view was of an abandoned warehouse that resembled a crack-house - but that didn't bother us too much. The furnishings weren't in the best condition, but for $89 a night, I definitely wasn't complaining. The two things that I did have a big problem with though were the horribly uncomfortable pull-out couch and the fact that we could hear everything going on in the hallway outside of our room. Overall, this place is a great value for the money - if they added a pool, did a few furniture touch-ups, replaced the doors and the pull-out couch mattresses, it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sparky66oh
Reviews.Content: Never heard of this place before, but based my reservation on the Tripadvisor reviews. They did not disappoint. Big room, great location, helpful staff, nice breakie. Easy access to freeway - one block from trolley stop on Canal street. Have a cocktail next door at the Ritz - outdoors on their gorgeous terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Beware”
Reviews.Author: walrat1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, but bathroom a little small. The free breakfast had many choices. The problem I discovered occurred after I left. While checking my bank account online, I discovered a $250.00 charge from Iberville Suites that I did not make. I called the hotel and was told that the charge was a smoking fee. The lady I spoke with told me that I had requested a smoking king(smoking or non-smoking was a choice on their web site reservations)and they were a non-smoking hotel!! I was never informed when I checked in that there would be a charge for requesting a smoking king nor was it stated anywhere, and when I checked out of the hotel, I was not informed of the charge!! I had planned to stay at this hotel in the future, but not after being ripped off like that!! I plan on contacting my bank and letting them know that I did not authorize the $250.00 charge!!! I gave the hotel a chance to credit my account. The lady said she would have to talk to the manager and assured me she would call me back, and I never heard a word from them!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bamagirl78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Mardi Gras. It was in an excellent location, just one block from Bourbon and one block from Canal. The hotel staff were very friendly and even honored my request to change to a different room with a bigger bed without any problems. The room was very nice, clean, and spacious. I would recommend parking in the garage across the street, it's only $18 a night as opposed to the $32 a night for valet parking. My only complaint is that we didn't have any hot water the second day we were there. I guess alot of people were showering at once. Overall, it was a great place and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Price”
Reviews.Author: acannada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location. The valet parking is a great plus! The rooms are large and perfect for a family with children. It is nice to have 2 televisions and 2 rooms. It was very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The refrigerator was an added bonus. When we checked in, there was no record of the reservation that I had made with Travelocity. I was glad that I had a copy of the paid reservation. The staff at the front desk and the bell staff were all very friendly and nice. The room had a huge red stain on the carpet in front of the refrigerator. The tub had a lot of chips on it. The sink area had not been cleaned well....there was dried toothpaste on the marble around the sink. If the management would spruce up the rooms with new paint, carpet, and bathroom fixtures, the Iberville Suites would be rated much higher in my book. On the morning that we were to check out, we received a print out of our room charges under the door. They had charged my card for our stay. I went to the front desk and showed them that I had prepaid, and she assured me that I was not being charged again. (And the charge was much higher than I had paid through Travelocity!) I am holding on to my receipt from Travelocity, in case a charge shows up on my credit card. I don't have a good feeling about it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cece39581
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. It is kind of hard to find but once you do find it you will be happy. The hotel staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was fresh and abudant. They have more than bagels and cereal. We stayed there for only one night. The room service is a bit expensive but it was well worth it! The room was clean and very large. They have bath and body works toiletries. The room had 2 tvs so that was great. Also the sofa in the suite turned into a sleeper. If you are going to stay for a few nights take advantage of the valet parking. IT is expensive but it beats having to park way around the corner. This hotel is in a great location. The business district. Slept sound. NOt alot of noise in fact did not hear any noise! It is a great hotel for the price. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Zizza
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from the Iberville Suites. Here's what we liked about it: - Good proximity to Bourbon Street and well situated in the French Quarter. We could stay out late and feel safe walking home. Many of the hotels rated well on this website are located in the business district, but that would've been too far away from the shops and clubs for our taste. This location is ideal. - Quiet. We had a room facing the interior on the eighth floor. The bedroom portion of the suite was dead quiet. The sitting room had a little noise from passersby in the hallway, but that was perfectly fine. - Very spacious for the amount of money that we spent. It was clean, and the furniture was comfortable. The bed was comfy as well. We didn't try out the sleeper sofa mattress. Overall, it was a great value, and would be a great option for a family of four. - The staff was pleasant and helpful. The maid service was good too. - It was also nice to have access to the Ritz next door. They had a 24 hour business center that we could use. It was expensive though -- it was $7 for 15 minutes of computer use, plus extra charges for printing. We had no major complaints. We couldn't seem to get the safe to work, but they probably would've helped us if we asked. They also have a sign in the lobby indicating that they have an ATM down a short corridor, but no ATM was there. No big deal. Overall, a great stay in wonderful New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “nice, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: gion
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, with several problems: - I have been given a room at 4th floor: it was a very noisy one, due to some machines (probably the general air conditioning). Ear plugs needed to sleep; - A 7 minutes international call costed me 75 $. The rate was not notified in the hotel book; - there's no bar in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Martinibird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to New Orleans and this was one of the only hotels available. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. It had a very grand lobby and we were greated by very friendly staff. It is in the same building as the Ritz Carlton and I think it's the same management. Our room was nice. It felt very homey! If you are sharing a room with a friend or children the sofa can be made into a bed.The refidgerator actually kept our beverages so cold they had ice in them. The bathroom was nice. The hotel was located a block off Bourbon Street. You couldn't hear any street noise but, you could hear people in the halls if you were in the front section of the room. Across the street there is a bar called the Alibi. It's lots of fun, many local people go there when they get off work on Bourbon Street!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: srizzuto
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Good location (right around the corner from Galatoire's!) and beautiful marble everywhere. Can't beat the price either!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: techart
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hotel that's close to the action yet far enough away for a little peace, this is the place. Located a block away from Bourbon St, you can walk out and hit the quarter quickly yet the party noise won't be bad when you are ready to turn in. The room was nice and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The suite on the 10th floor consisted of a sitting area in the front, a bathroom in the middle and the bedroom in the rear. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel offers a continental breakfast that actually has decent variety and is one of the better ones I've had. Note that the arrival and departure enterance is very cramped since it is a renovated buiding in the historic Quarter so don't expect to just zoom in and out in your vehicle. The $32 daily rate for valet parking is also a bit on the expensive side. There is a public parking garage across from the hotel so you may want to consider that parking option. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting who wants a nice, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: bice710
Reviews.Content: I booked the Iberville Suites based on other's recommendations, and I was not disappointed. The price was extremely reasonable for the location, and when I got to the hotel I was thrilled with the quality for what I had paid. The hotel is attached to the Ritz-Carlton and definitely has a Ritz-Carlton feeling when you go in! The staff was friendly. If you are interested in fitness while there, you get to use the Ritz fitness center free of charge, which is a real treat. If you walk out the main entrance you're about a block from Bourbon Street so the location is perfect...I was by myself and a little hesitant to walk in that alley, but it was well lit and I felt very safe. Parking at the hotel is $32 a day for valet service, but just across the street you can drop off your car in the parking garage for $18 overnight, which is what I did. The room was nice, old school "french antiquey" - just what I expected. The only issue I had was that they gave me a handicapped room with a shower holder that was broken, so I had to do a one-handed shower. I have to say, that really did make me feel like I was in Europe! But otherwise everything was great, the room was very spacious and the bed was extremely cozy. I recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Iberville Suites!”
Reviews.Author: CATraveltwin
Reviews.Content: My sister initially booked our room at the Iberville Suites and after reading some of the reviews, I was a little worried. No need for that! We had two rooms and the staff was nice enough to accomodate us with side by side rooms. Once we got to our floor, we noticed the corner room was available and called the front desk and asked for that one. No problem!! The staff here couldn't be nicer or more friendly. The rooms were lovely, well-kept and cleaned promptly and completely every day. I would stay here again on my next visit to New Orleans without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Servants Quarters for the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: 56peggy56
Reviews.Content: The hotel room service was extrememly slow and the staff was rude when I called. It took 2 hours to deliver a bottle of champagne! Mood Spoiler! the beds was hard. Never plan to return there again. Do not be fooled by the fact it is a part of the Ritz..More like the servants quarters!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay At Iberville”
Reviews.Author: ardmoreflyer
Reviews.Content: The Iberville Suites in the French Quarter is a nice hotel, well kept, with a very gracious and accommodating staff. That's likely because it's part of the Ritz Carlton Hotel. Still, the Iberville staff made every effort to satisfy our needs. We checked in early and were able to get a room near our friends who also traveled with us to NOLA, as had been requested when we booked our trip in June. The rooms are well kept, though some look a bit newer than others. Our friends' room had dated carpeting, or at least, it looked dated and a few things were worn or falling apart. In our room, everything looked to be in good shape except the t.v. stand in the bedroom which was slightly broken. PLEASE NOTE: If you're looking for a room with any kind of a view, DO NOT stay here. It seems that all of the rooms at the Iberville face an interior courtyard which really isn't a courtyard but just a roof, or like our friends, you may face an abandoned building next door. MOST IMPORTANTLY: Do not stay here if you are looking to have some fun and enjoy your trip by having some drinks, etc. in your room. We checked into the hotel on a Thursday around 1 p.m. and went out for the afternoon in the French Quarter. We returned a few hours later and showered and then the four of us were having a couple of drinks in our room, listening to some music that was not very loud and all of a sudden at 7:30 p.m. (yes, I said 7:30 p.m.), we got a knock on our door. I opened the door and two gentlemen from the Ritz were standing there with ear pieces in. They said that they got a complaint that we were being loud and asked us to keep it quiet. Needless to say we were livid that we couldn't even have some drinks and chit chat at 7:30 p.m. on a Thursday. The hotel is in the French Quarter of New Orleans. Perhaps some of the hotel's residents should stay in a nursing home instead. How ridiculous. We're all adults (30-35) and don't carry on like college kids on Bourbon St. so this issue definitely left a bad taste in our mouths. We will not be staying there for any return trips to NOLA, which is too bad because the hotel price was right when we booked it ($130 roughly) six months in advance and it's proximity to Bourbon St. and the rest of the French Quarter is excellent. Unlike many other hotels near Bourbon, you cannot hear anything once you are in your room/bed. However, be warned that any kind of socializing in your rooms must be done at a library's level. While not a total disappointment, this situation was enough to keep us from returning to the Iberville Suites

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clete
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Iberville Suites to attend a conference. I reserved the room four months in advance. I should have known there were going to be problems when a month later I tried to change the reservations by one day and was told they did not have my reservation, despite me having a confirmation number. By speaking to a different person a day later, I was able to get the reservation straightened out. The week before my arrival, I confirmed the reservation and that I would be a late check-in. When I showed up at the hotel, I was informed that they cancelled my reservation since they had that I was to arrive a day earlier and was listed as a no-show. Luckily I had extensive notes on who I talked to and when, and after being faced with the information they â€œfoundâ€� me a room. When I got to my room I found that the floor had obviously not been vacuumed and that none of the lights in the bedroom worked. After fumbling around in the dark, I found that the lights had been unplugged. Maybe it was so I would not notice the dirty carpet or the broken furniture. The bed was the worst I have experienced in a hotel in this price range. The pillows were no better. The first night I used a water glass for a soda and left it on the counter. The glass and the debris on the floor remained untouched until the fourth day of my stay! The complementary breakfast was minimal, with plenty of carbohydrates and no fruit. The common areas of the hotel were well maintained and clean. The staff was reasonably helpful. The best thing that this hotel has going for it is its location. It is a very short walk to Bourbon Street. Next time I will go back to the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: rgwdfw
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews about this hotel and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is beautiful (adjacent to and operated by the Ritz Carlton) and the rooms are spacious. Best of all was the price - an incredible value for the French Quarter. And the location can't be beat - just one block from Bourbon Street but absolutely quiet. We had a room on the 10th floor facing downtown. The room did have a drawer handle missing on one nightstand and a lightbulb out over the bar area, but other than that, everything was in good shape. Some reviews have complained about maid service, but our experience was very good. They cleaned the room quickly and replaced all towels and amenities each morning. The free breakfast was also very good. Expecting only rolls and coffee - we got lots of fresh baked goods, waffles, fruit, yogurt, juice, cereal and milk. There was a Saints game in town our last night there and we saw that other hotels were crowded and noisy, but the Iberville was very calm (crowded yes, but quiet - well, the Saints DID lose that night!). Overall, a terrific experience and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: sunny9625
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in N.O. This was my first trip back to N. O. since the hurricane and I didn't know what to expect. When we arrived I asked the young lady at the desk if I could see one of their suites. We fell in love with this place! Beautfiul N.O. style furniture throughout the Hotel. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. Staff here is wonderful also. I WILL stay here on our next visit to N.O. To all the staff at Iberville Suites, thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mjayBoston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to New Orleans and a Carnival cruise to Mexico. Before the cruise, we stayed 2 nights at Iberville Suites in the French Quarter; which is within walking distances of alot of quaint shops, parks, a lake, historical sites, and restaurants. The hotel is in a historic building connected to the Ritz Carlton. Our hotel was elegant and classy with a large lobby that held continental breakfasts every morning. Our room was truly a suite with colorful art on the walls and dark rich furniture. We had a couch with plenty of reading lights then further on was a sink area and refrigator. The bathroom had marble tile and was roomy. The bathroom was equipped with soaps, shampoo/conditioner, and lotion. The room closet held a full size ironing broad, iron, extra pillow, extra blanket, and a safe deposit box. Next was an area for our spacious king size bed that was comfy and had lots of pillows that faced a tv cabinet. We only paid $92 a night and overall, it was a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: cdgas
Reviews.Content: Room was nicely done and clean. Staff was very helpful and supportive. Good central location in the French Quarter. Room rate was good, but most hotels in New Orleans have discounted rates at this time of the year because fo the hot and humid weather. I would stay here again if the room rate remains reasonable

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I have stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: jascasisen
Reviews.Content: It is a great Hotel for the price. Great location. The rooms are perfect if you have kid or not. We have 3. They could stay in the other room and watch tv ect. While we had quite in our room. Hotel staff met all our need. Would stay agagin in a heatbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Affordable Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelingClayton
Reviews.Content: The Iberville Suites is a great hotel and very affordable. Our overall experience was very good, but we had a couple of minor challenges. When we first entered the room, there was some garbage on the floor and one of the lamps had been dismantled by Maintenance. However, it was corrected right away after we called the front desk. The safe in the closet was also not secured to anything so it was pointless to store anything valuable. We later realized the air conditioner was not working properly, and we were moved immediately. Everything was fine in the new room (including the safe). We did not encounter any other challenges after the first day, and we felt the staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a great location just one block from Canal Street and Bourbon Street. Most attractions are within walking distance or a short ride on the reliable streetcars. The rooms are an ideal size for a small family or a couple looking for a romantic (or wild) getaway. The rooms are decorated with European-style lamps and calming colors. We appreciated the in-room refrigerator because it was nice to have cold drinks after a long day in the heat. The room was cleaned in a timely manner everyday. The continental breakfast was sufficient including Danishes, cereal, coffee, juices, bagels, English muffins, fresh fruit, and make-your-own waffles. Guests must take two elevators to get to the rooms. One elevator takes you to the lobby on the second floor, and a second elevator accesses the rooms. The large lobby is elegantly decorated with antique furniture and unique paintings. We were very satisfied with Iberville Suites despite the minor challenges after check in. Guests will find upscale amenities at this hotel at a reasonable price. Some amenities (resistance pool, spa, room service) are shared with the adjacent Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JAllison
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Iberville in July of '07 and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel is on the edge of the French Quarter, within easy walking distance of Jackson Square and Bourbon Street. Our room was large and was truly a suite -- it included a sitting area with a pullout couch and a separate bedroom. The hotel is in the same building as the Ritz, so you get some of the Ritz service without the price. When we went to arrange a city tour we were directed to the concierge, who is in the Ritz. But the best part of our stay was the price. We paid $86 a night for our room. If you drive in, as we did, you will get hammered for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay, pay the extra and stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: fatimsharif
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were never cleaned. We booked a suite and the pull out sofa could not be pulled out because a tv was blocking it. There were crumbs and candy wrappers on the sheets. We were transferred to a regular room with a promise to move to anoter suite the next day. The next day we were told, there were no suites available. Room service served us chicken that was still bleeding. The maids did not clean the rooms thoroughly, the carpets were so dirty you did not dare sit on them or walk on them barefoot. I had to go to the Ritz Carlton lobby to get an internet connection on my wirless laptop. They do not have their own spa you have to pay an extra $12.00 dollars to visit the Ritz Carltons...I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gkkii
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most of the positive reviews with just a couple of exceptions. My room hardly qualified as a suite. The rooms in the hotel vary. Mine was a standard room with a frosted glass divider between the two beds. No sitting area. Though the room was serviced daily, it was never vacuumed. It had not been vacuumed upon my arrival and the same "debris" remained on the floor until the second full day of my stay when I requested it be addressed. HOWEVER, the staff was very attentive and friendly. The location is excellent (straddling the French Quarter and the CBD). The building is well maintained. Overall the experience was above average and I will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the Best Kept Secret in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: VampyAmber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at the Iberville Suites. Beautiful hotel, very friendly staff and they loved our Chihuahua. I've paid a lot more for a lot less in the French Quarter. The room was very comfortable and very convenient to everything. Housekeeping could have been a little better, but I'm not real picky about that kind of thing, so it was okay. The parking is a bit pricey at $32.00 a day, but it is valet with in and out privileges. Great complimentary continental breakfast and Bath & Body Works amenities. If you run out of anything, there is a Walgreens two blocks away. I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: heidigau
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for our trip based on comments left by previous guests and one of the comments was that this hotel was owned by The Ritz and therefore the service was comparable. I have stayed at The Ritz before and Iberville Suites, while good, is certainly not of the same quality. This location is still a work in progress and lacks things like an ATM Machine and functional vending machines. It is actually directly attached to The Ritz and you can use their concierge and other services, which was helpful. However, if you want to use the gym or the business center, again, you have to go to The Ritz and there are fees. It is $12 per day to use the gym and a $7.50 minimum to use the computer in the business center. Bad enough that The Ritz charges their paying customers for these services but if you stay at Iberville Suites, you will have to pay them as well. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was nice but rather dark and simple details were overlooked such as torn sheets on the bed and certain things in the room not cleaned to the quality we would have liked. The room was also quite dark and considering the hotel was less than half full, an upgrade to a room with a better view would have been a nice touch. The bed was also way too soft. The location of the hotel was good. It's just a block away from Bourbon Street and the action of the French Quarter but far enough away that it was quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: LLCrew
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many of the French Quarter hotels. While this might not be the most historic or well known - believe me - it is one of the best!! So easy to get to get in and out of - a big plus in the Quarter. Also, it's quiet, clean and convenient to everything. Don't expect a whole lot of amenities; however, you can walk to the adjoining Ritz and use the facilities (spa, bar, restaurant). For the price, this is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Up to Date Review of this property!!!”
Reviews.Author: natrl_hi
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned as I didn't see many up to date reviews of this property POST Katrina. I felt like this was a GREAT place to stay given the price I paid. The staff was VERY friendly and were quick to help me in any way they could and I had SEVERAL special requests!! They didn't even blink an eye just jumped on it. The hotel is in relatively good condition however I did notice the furniture in the room was very worn and the ROOMS ARE SMALL, although the fact that every room has a seperate sitting area would lead you to believe that it is a SUITE in every sense of the word. Our room smelled like smoke although the entire hotel was non-smoking. If you decide to drive you may use the facilities parking to the tune of $38 A DAY!!! But if you have ever been to New Orleans you know that a car is not only not necessary but is more trouble then it is worth. The breakfast buffet consisted of self serve waffles, muffins, pasteries, cereal, toast, bagels, and fresh fruit. The maid service did leave a little to be desired. I paid about $90 a night for the room and for that price was pleased with the accomodations.....however if I had paid much more I would have been a little disappointed. Ultimately, if you plan on spending a significant amount of time in your room...you may want to look for something a little more lavish....and I would have DEFINATELY been disappointed if I had booked this hotel for a honeymoon or special occaison. BUT....If you are looked for a good clean hotel...with nice amenities (located in the RITZ)....nice lobby....good perks (located in the RITZ)...and DON'T plan on spending the entire time in your room...this is a GREAT DEAL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good times roll@ Ibervile suites”
Reviews.Author: soflguy
Reviews.Content: just back from nola and jazz fest which was excellent to start with. Ive been to Nola over a dozen times and had never stayed at Iberville suites.. i like to find and experience new places to stay each time i come back. so many places have different things to offer..The Iberville suites was great, the rooms were good sized, the bed was big and comfortable, house keeping was very attentive, and anytime i needed any info or service , evryone was there. no questions asked.The location is great in the quarter, a block from Canal but you dont know it and two blocks from Bourbon street, thats a plus!!The Ritz being connected had a nice bar and lounge area which i visited twice, food was solid drinks were nice prices for a ritz were fair!!Management was extremely accomadating and i would hightly recommend iberville suites to anyone looking for a clean , well runned . well mannered establishmeny and kudos to front desk manager, NIcholas... and hotel managewr dwayne!!!! you guys r great. will be back sooner than later!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Anniversary Experience”
Reviews.Author: lock22
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. We were so close to many of the attractions such as the French Quarter, the Market, Riverwalk, and only one block from Bourbon St and Canal St! The hotel is attached to the Ritz Carlton and the ammenities are offered to all of Iberville's guests. The price was over $100 dollars less per night than at the Ritz and just as nice. The staff was amazing! Everyone was polite and helpful. We felt like we were being catered to the entire stay. My husband & I booked this hotel for our anniversary . My husband contacted the hotel and inquired about what type of specials that the hotel could do for us for our first anniversary. He arranged to have chocolate covered strawberries and Moet champagne waiting to surprise me when we arrived in our room. We arrived to the hotel about 4 hours before check in and the staff allowed us to enter early. Since we arrived before expected, the staff promptly delivered my surprise before we finished unloading our luggage! We were very happy with our choice. We visit New Orleans often and will be staying here each time we go back. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be close to the attractions, looking for a bargain, and needing a peaceful place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “NOLA is coming back...”
Reviews.Author: SudsLuv
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business convention and the hotel had just re-opened (following Katrina) the day before. The staff was courteous and helpful, everyone from the bellmen to housecleaning. The day I departed it was very early and the complementary breakfast area was just being set up. The gentleman at the front desk kindly went back and got me a freshly brewed cup of coffee for my trip to the airport. While you could tell the furniture in the rooms had been recently touched up as part of the renovation, it wasn't enough to diminish my experience. It's not the Four Seasons, but most travelers won't be disappointed. The place deserves an "Excellent" rating for rising above the Katrina disaster and hiring good replacement staff.

Reviews.Title: “It didn't live up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first room I was given had not been cleaned. There were towels on the floor and some other details had not been taken care of. After requesting that it be cleaned up and spending 2 hours in the French Quarter, I came back to the same dirty room. I requested that the front desk move me and they did to a pleasant room. The music of George Butts was wonderful over in the Ritz and the food in the Grill was delicious but lonely with not a single person eating in there besides me. I am glad I had the Iberville experience even if it could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were down to compete in the AAU Jr. Olympics. The whole cheer squad stayed at the hotel. It was very nice with wonderful breakfast and rooms. We would stay again if were to come to New Orleans. Very nice staff and employees.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville Suites 8-20-05 for only one night. We are so glad that we found this place after having some pretty bad experiences on previous visits to New Orleans. The accomodations were exactly as advertised, which were great and the price was most reasonable. The suites are beautifully furnished with everything one needs. The concierge was most helpful on giving us dining tips. Hotel staff was very nice & they have a wonderful complementary breakfast. We will definately stay at the Iberville Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from one of the most wonderful places on earth. We stayed at the Iberville in New Orleans and it was a nice place to stay. Only one problem, the mattress on the sleeper sofa was a little worned out, but other than that the hotel is great. Perfect location, nice breakfast, super freindly staff. For the price, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jello7113
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights after a cruise with our daughter. We arrived way before check in time but we were able to check our bags before our room was ready so we could walk around the French Quarter. The bell service personel were extremely helpful and courteous asking if we needed directions or anything else. We had a King suite. While our daughter said the pull out couch wasn't so comfortable, I found the bed to be one of the best I have slept on in any hotel. When we checked out we were in a hurry and inadvertantly left very important papers in the safe in the room. When we returned back to San Diego and discovered our mistake, I immediately called the lost and found at the hotel. The lady I spoke to, Anita, was so helpful and understanding. She said she would call back as soon as she had the papers from the safe and Fedex them the next day. She was true to her word. I want to thank Anita for going above and beyond for our oversight. I really liked that the hotel was so close to everything. Even in the heat of July it was so easy to walk. I would definately stay at the Iberville Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PhotoBob79
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews, we must have low expectations. For the price we paid, I found the Iberville to be far more than adequate. Our suite was not the largest I've visited, but large enough for the three of us. My son had no complaints about the comfort. Sure we ran into a couple problems, like not enough towels, but that was a case where we wanted more than the average person. I guess if you expect Ritz quality you should be staying at the Ritz not one of their companion hotels. It's less expensive for a reason! The location is perfect. Easy walking distance to Canal Street and the trolleys. One block to Bourbon Street. An easy walk to Jackson Square. One must remember that N'awlins is an old crowded city. Parking is a premium. You have to be crazy to think you are going to drive around the French Quarter, anyway. On the down side we expected a pool which turned out to be at the Ritz ($10 fee). We found the staff helpful. The desk clerk even pulled out the phone book and called a restaurant we wanted to try to find where they were, then marked it on the map for us. We wold not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located and nice looking. If that's all you require, you are all set. However, you would also have to be willing to forgo maid service and polite responses to inquiries. We were out of our room from 10 am to 4 pm - we returned hot and sweaty, wanting nothing more than a rest and a shower before we went back out on the town. To our surprise, the maid had yet to visit our room. We let that go. We were so pooped. We had also asked about a cot to replace the fold-out couch which was too uncomfortable to sleep on and were offered a feather bed to put on top - nice option right?
