However, the feather bed never appeared. We called in the afternoon - its on its way. In the evening - we will get it to you. After returning from dinner - it'll be right up. 45 minutes later - I just gave it to housekeeping. 30 minutes after that - we don't have any - how about an extra blanket? ARRRRGH! The desk people were rude and unhelpful. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Suite's In the Midst of It All”
Reviews.Author: Falenangels
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Iberville Suites early around 12:00 pm and were checked in early. I had reserved a queen suite but upon request of my travel companion was upgraded to a king suite. No extra charge! The suite was spacious and the bed very comfortable. We had an issue regarding how the room had been cleaned and it was taken care of IMMEDIATELY! The maid apologized. We had no problems at all after that incident. I can honestly say that I didn't find one rude person that was employed here. There are plenty of excellent restaurants available at a very short walking distance and it did not concern us in the least that there was no restaurant at the Iberville. This is a beautiful place to stay while visiting New Orleans. I recommend it to anyone wanting to visit the French Quarter. Bring a good pair of walking shoes and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice quaint property, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Iberville Suites and I think the property was just adorable. We were there for the Essence Music Festival and the property was sold out not to mention the city had approximately 250,000 tourists for the weekend. The hotel is on the edge of the French Quarter and about a block from Canal Street. Very accessible to everything and we even walked to the Convention Center. It was quiet but we could walk about 5 minutes and be in the French Quarter. We went to the bar in the Ritz and had a few drinks and listened to some great entertainement. The breakfast buffet was the average, but hey it's included in the price and it beats room service which can be pricey. The staff was very accomondating even though we had no issues. The only thing I suggest to be aware of if you are going for some "Specialty Event" as they put it, they will charge your credit card the full amount of your stay 45 days before you arrive. That was a big shock to us and we do plan to write the Ritz Carlton Corporate office about that. But all in all the property is very nice, clean, and spacious. After all it is owned by the Ritz! We will definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nco2295
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a 5 night stay in New Orleans at the Iberville Suites. We checked in very late - 1:30 a.m., so they did not have our requested King bed suite available. They gave us a queen bed suite and told us to check with the desk the next morning....We spoke with Nicole, and she did find us a King suite which we moved to and loved! The breakfast buffet had many choices each day--waffle's (which you make fresh yourself in one of two irons), cold cereals, oatmeal, rolls, bagels, english muffins, toast, muffins, yogurt, choice of fresh fruit, orange juice, apple juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate.....excellent breakfast included in price of room! The location is perfect! Right in the French Quarter - everything within easy walking distance. The doormen & all of the staff that we came in contact with were very polite and helpful. They say you can use the Ritz's gym (for a fee), and pool, but we never ventured there....I would definitely return to the Iberville Suites, and would recommend it to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, could be great!”
Reviews.Author: DiscriminatingDiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. If you are without a car, the hotel is perfect. Close to everything. Adajacent to the Ritz, the spa and fitness center are very nice. Check out the Ritz hotel bar for drinks and entertainment before dinner. Felt the hotel did not live up to the Ritz standards of cleanliness. The carpet was dirty and stained and when I asked that it be cleaned while we were out sightseeing the management said it would be taken care of. When we returned, we were met with excuses that it couldn't be taken care of that day and offered another room. There was also a smear of blood on the bathroom door and toothpaste in the sink. Ritz management needs to get involved with the housekeeping staff to bring this good hotel up to great standards. Also, the front desk personnel are very unenthusiastic and unfriendly. They don't go the extra mile to make the guest feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MomofHandH
Reviews.Content: Great to have a living room and a seperate bedroom. Traveled with a two year old. Not the greatest crib ever, but she slept great so I guess she would disagree. FABULOUS breakfast every morning. You could skip lunch! Had a problem with our first room and they switched us immediately. We stay in a lot of hotels and we absolutely loved the Iberville.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: buglelinda
Reviews.Content: Our group of three adults enjoyed the short stay at the Iberville. The suite was more than we expected. Lots of room both the bedroom and sitting room. Our son who is 25, enjoyed his extra space for the T.V. He used the sleeper sofa and had a good sleep. The room was above average for everything. I loved the French furniture, the wet bar, the use of a bar fridge for our beer, water, with space for extra food and drinks. I had booked a room facing the courtyard. It is very small, (courtyard), but the room was extremely quiet! Very comfortable bed, bathroom clean and supplied with Body Works.! The hotel allowed us to check out late so we could enjoy the afternoon in the French Quarter for lunch and tour. They also allowed us to leave our car in the car park at no extra charge. Very accomodating to us for everything. The breakfast was very good. I didn't use it much as we had plans to eat in the FRENCH QUARTER. The "really good food" is there, and plenty of it. Don't worry about the close location to BOURBON STREET, as you hear NOTHING. Great place to stay and very luxurious with the Old World Furnishings. My son was impressed. We are Canadians, and have lived in Louisiana for several years, we still enjoy visiting the Big Easy. We completed our visit in BATON ROUGE for a friends wedding. Enjoyed it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Iberville Suites”
Reviews.Author: shannyh1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an anniversary holiday in New Orleans. After careful review of hotel accomodations in the area, we settled on the Iberville Suites, located just one block from Bourbon Street. Although we had seen photos of this hotel and read everything we could regarding ammenities, etc., we were a bit leary of what we would experience because the Iberville is so close to the French Quarter. We were more than pleasantly surprised to find this hotel far exceeded our expectations. The Iberville is adjacent to the Ritz Carlton and full access is granted to both hotels. The room itself, located on the 10th floor was quiet, clean, comfortable, and not a speck of dust was found. The lobby is opulent with French period pieces and a lovely grand piano that softly plays. The breakfast, offered between 7:30 to 9:30AM is buffet style with various cereals, waffles, oatmeal, pastries, bagels, english muffins, juices, fruit, tea, and coffee. There is plenty of comfortable seating. The staff, from reservation desk, concierge, housekeeping, and bellmen couldn't have been friendlier or more accomodating. I had a small request in need a of simple safety pin and within minutes received twenty! We opted to take a cab to various places and never had to wait, they are readily available. We consider ourselves seasoned travellers and are quite picky about comfort and cleanliness wherever we go. We would highly reccommend the Iberville Suites. One certainly gets more than the bargain price suggests!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good First Impression”
Reviews.Author: mack13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had planned our honeymoon stay at the Iberville Suites. I reserved our room about 6 weeks in advance, and called to confirm that they had our room available. When we checked in to the hotel, everyone was courteous and attentive. Our room was not in keeping with our own expectations however. I had booked a Kingsize room and was given a Standard. If you are used to sleeping on the Kingsize at home, a Standard at a hotel just doesn't work. Our Standard matress was so worn out that it sagged in the middle. Neither of us got a decent sleep the first night there. In the morning, I almost slipped in the bathtub while showering because there was no bathmat or antislip strips in the tub. The carpet in the room was not properly cleaned, and the counter tops had dirt and grime on them. I addressed our complaints to the front desk clerk, and asked to speak to the manager. The manager was "not in," so we had to wait until someone came to work. ( I was dismayed that the hotel is run by people who can't make decisions, and no management is there to guide them until they "come in".) I had to call the agency that I booked the hotel through before I got a response from a manager. The assistant operations manager was very apologetic about the condition of the room, and guaranteed that all would be taken care of while we were out seeing the sights for the day. When we arrived in the afternoon, we were once again disappointed, because our room had not been cleaned in the six hours that we had been gone. Once again, I called to speak to a manager. The response was very rapid this time. An attendant was sent within 5 minutes to start cleaning our room. The assistant ops manager came up in person to appologize. She offered us a Non-smoking room if we wanted to move to it. Being smokers, we declined. She then offered us a free dinner and drinks at the French Quarter Bar located in The Ritz Carlton next door. WOW! All our complaints were remedied, but we should not have had them to begin with. I had also arranged for flowers to be sent to my wife as a surprise. The people who signed for the flowers had to be tracked down, as they lacked the common sense to bring them to the lobby. I guess they thought the flowers were sent as a gift to them with my wife's name on the box. Next is the $28.00 per day valet parking ripoff. If you don't plan on doing any driving during your stay, then rent the $18.00 per day parking at the Standard Parking garage across the street from the Iberville. I have stayed at the Sheraton on the riverfront, and had a tremendous time at that hotel. Between the two, my next stay will be at the Sheraton. First impressions are hard to make the second time around. BTW, the dinner at The Ritz Carlton French Quarter Bar was superb. They had an excellent staff, and even adorned our tablecloth with red rose petals. The food was among the best in the French Quarter, and the service from the wait staff was the best we received anywhere in town, period.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter base”
Reviews.Author: thebabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for business in April and loved it. Somehow I ended up with a wheelchair-accessible room, which gave lots of extra space. Don't know how that happened, but it was their call. Room was nicely appointed, clean and very comfortable. I don't remember much of a view, but you shouldn't be spending much time in your room when in New Orleans anyway. It's adjacent (and owned by) the Ritz-Carlton. I didn't use any of their facilities, but I was told I could. The lobby is small and I don't recall a restaurant, but anyone who eats at a regular hotel restaurant in N.O. should get his head examined anyhow. It's close to a zillion wonderful places to eat and drink as it's on the edge of the quarter, but near some of the busiest parts. This hotel is perfect for anyone who wants Ritz-Carlton style treatment without paying Ritz-Carlton prices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Iberville!”
Reviews.Author: Glassgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville during Jazzfest and were very pleased with this facility. The suite was comfortable for the 4 of us and very quiet. They use Bath & Body Works toiletries and replaced them every day. Housekeeping is definitely hit or miss as we had to call down for washcloths every day but they were responsive once called. The continental breakfast was OK. Charging for high speed data was a huge minus, however, the coffee shop attached to the Ritz Carlton had free wireless which made everything OK again. Having the Iberville attached to the Ritz Carlton was a bonus. The spa facility was VERY nice and they bent over backwards to provide exceptional customer service. We would definitely stay at the Iberville again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at the Iberville Suites 5/8-5/13/05. I loved it!! I was worried at first because I had read mixed reviews about the hotel. But everything wound up being excellent. The rooms were nice for the price and the staff was very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. My husband and I are already planning our return vacation to New Orleans and wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked... scam!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip way in advance and booked rooms at this hotel because they had suites. When we arrived, they said they were overbooked and the best they could offer was across the street at the Chateau Sonesta (basically, a casino-style hotel....). Some "upgrade"... no suites, double beds and nasty bathrooms. What a nice first impression of New Orleans. To be honest, I think they do this on a regular basis. A reservation should equal a reserved room - but apparently not in the State of Louisiana! They said that if guests decide to stay an extra day, by law, the hotel cannot kick them out. They sure must have had a lot of people who didn't plan ahead, because we were among MANY who were being kicked nextdoor. (Ya know, at LEAST let me know in advance there's a chance I might not be actually staying in the hotel!) I wouldn't bother reserving a room at the Iberville Suites UNLESS you can get a written guarantee that they'll hold your room. Even then, I don't think they care....

Reviews.Title: “. . . A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Camille1821
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Iberville Suites was okay - not great, not awful. Let me list the positive aspects first - nice continental breakfast every morning and great location. In addition, my husband and I enjoyed the spa located in the adjoining Ritz-Carlton hotel. As for the negative aspects - housekeeping services are hit-or-miss; the bed is short if you're over 5'8"; the hotel doesn't use fitted sheets on the bed so the bottom sheet comes undone soon after your head hits the pillow; and the window treatments, while very nice to look at, don't do a great job of keeping out sunlight in the morning. all in all, i'd stay at the hotel again but would call ahead to ensure that some of these issues were addressed prior to my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 1caroline
Reviews.Content: Extremely happy with our stay at Iberville Suites. Loved the location, separate bedroom with door, very fast in-and-out parking, pretty & clean room, very quiet hotel guests (but there is loud construction outside hotel currently that begins about 6:30 am), complimentary continental breakfast was a nice touch (unfortunately was pretty well wiped clean about 9:15 am one morning). Please note that you can expect to pay a surcharge of $28 per day for parking, $8 per day for high speed internet (these charges are standard for most N.O. hotels in French Quarter). I highly recommend this hotel for those who desire a great F.Q. location and a quite nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Iberville Suites review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having read a number of reviews, we booked a stay at the Iberville Suites based mainly on the pictures shown on the web site. Over all the hotel lived up to the reviews. The only negative we experienced was with the condition of the room. The carpet, and some of the furnishings do need to be refreshed. Also, we had a backup with the tub drain, which the hotel addressed immediatley . The staff was always helpful. The affillition with the Ritz Carlton was a definite plus. We booked a number of tours thru the concerige, and all of the reccomindations were terrific. I would say overall that our experience was positive, and would recomend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Breakfast Buffet, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: MDiablo
Reviews.Content: After reading through all of the reviews I had my doubts about the Iberville Suites, but we were very pleased with our stay. The location is good, not the best in the Quarter, but still a short walk to most everything. If you want to be near Bourbon Street, it's great because it's only a block away, but very quiet. I would suggest staying more towards the center of the Quarter, like between Royal and Decatur. The Omni Royal O is the ideal location in my opinion. Our room was very nice, a small suite with a separate living room area with a TV, wet bar, and small fridge. The bedroom had it's own TV and a view of a non-descript courtyard. I got the impression that there were few rooms with much of a view of anything special. The room was very quiet and the bed very comfortable - we slept great all three nights we were there. The service was fine, quick check-in and check-out, good maid service. The breakfast buffet was nice for a quick bite. The make-your-own waffle cooker was fun. And of course it is adjacent to the Ritz and their spa, where you can get a good massage or just use the facilities for $10.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, best hotel and value in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Mardi Gras in 2001. Initially we chose Iberville Suites because of the price. We were pleasantly surprised to find that because it was attached to the Ritz Carlton, we received 5 star service. Last time we were there, they had the best soaps and shampoos (bath and body works) and the most comfortable beds. We had a quick valet, and whenever we had a problem, the staff was very attentive. We even had an issue, where we locked our valuables in the hotel safe, and forgot the electronic code. Not only did the staff respond quickly, but they were friendly and accomodating in resolving the problem. We will be going back this year for our wedding, we can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Iberville Suites in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wow....Went to New Orleans first part of march 2005. Was there for our anniversary and when booking the trip had no idea where to stay. After tons of research settled on the Iberville Suites which is connected to thr Ritz Carlton. WOW What an amazing hotel and better yet was the location. 2 blocks from Bourbon St so had NO noise in the hotel. 1 Block from canal st Just a short walk through the beautiful French Quarter to Cafe du monde. It was an amazing trip. My wife and I have decided that When we go back we will with out a doubt stay at the Iberville suites again!! What a Great city...the food, music, sightseeing, all the history in that town it is wonderful!!!! We were cautioned about petty thefts and pick pocketers so at night we stayed on well lit streets and had NO problems...actually found everyone there to be extremely friendly! If you love food...then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Thought It Was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: krisinok
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to New Orleans, and this hotel is by far the best one! It is only one block from Bourbon Street, and the suite rooms are very nice. The bed was wonderful, I slept great. My two sons loved the spa at the Ritz Carlton, as did I! We also used the hot tub at the Ritz and their lap pool. The continental breakfast was nice, and included freshly made waffles. For the price, this was a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: flipviet
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans in March 2005. We read the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided on the Iberville Suites. However, we could not get 4 nights at the Iberville. So we decided to book the Iberville for 2 nights and look for another similar hotel for the last 2 nights. After much looking and reading TripAdvisor comments, we settled for the Dauphine Orleans because it was about the same price, and it looked, at the time, seems to be about the same as the Iberville. It was not! The Iberville Suites - Great location. We walked the French Quarter from the Iberville with no problems. Very nice room/bed, very comfortable. Staff very friendly. Breakfast is included with hot oatmeal, cook-your-self walfle, yogurt, juices, hot coffee/tea, rolls/toast fruits, etc. In room wired internet access is $13 from midnight to midnight (1 day). I prefer to have wireless access. Dauphine Orleans - Great location. Just down the street from the Iberville. Very friendly staff. Breakfast is included (same variety as the Iberville). Afternoon tea and sweet at the lounge from 3PM - 5PM. There is a small pool, but the water was too cold. The air vent in the room we stayed in blows the air directly at the head of the bed. So we had to just turn it off and open the window when sleeping. The bed, the sheets and blanket were of a Motel 6 class. It does not have in-room internet access. But does have free wireless internet access from the office, lounge and pool area. Since the cost was about the same between the Iberville Suites and Dauphine Orleans, I would expect that they are comparable. But they are not. I would definitely stay at the Iberville Suites again. I would caution those who may be thinking staying right on, or next to Bourbon street. The street gets very noisy from the evening into the night with lould music from bars and stores and people! Unless, of course, that does not bother you!

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a fine location at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: COLIMON
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a full service hotel, the Ritz amenities provide that (at an additionl cost). But this is really an exceptional value fot those who are willing to venture out but want luxurious accommodations in a prime location at a reasonable cost. The breakfast buffet is mediocre, but who cares, you will end up overeating in NO anyways, so save some room at breakfast. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms far above average, especially for the price. The location is central to everything and you can even use the Ritz indoor pool if you choose.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel - convenient for families”
Reviews.Author: jprothn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Mardi Gras. I find hotel reviews on this site so helpful that I decided to return the favor. The Iberville suites is conveniently located just inside the French Quarter, a block from Canal. We stayed here because the continental breakfast was convenient as we have a 2 year old. (Muffins, make-your-own waffles, bagels, juice, milk, coffee, yogurt and fruit). The hotel is plain and simple - adequate and average. The suites are small - a small room with Queen or King bed, and another small room with foldout. There were two tv's, also convenient with a child. If cleanliness is really important to you - don't stay here. I am not a neatness fanatic, but compared to other stays at hotels (and we travel a lot), the room was barely cleaned. The bed was made and towels changed, but no picking up or vacuuming. We also waited an inordinate amount of time for service when the toilet stopped up. Of course, it was Mardi Gras - but still for $200 a night, they can hire people to clean. And, the hotel was well staffed to boot. Only other thing to comment on was the strange staff. The bellman and doorman are fantastic. The people who work at the breakfast were also very nice. The desk staff though - not a smile among them in four days. I have never, ever passed by a hotel front desk - empty, and not received a smile or a good day or something. It was odd. I have stayed at the Hotel Dauphine and the Holiday Inn on Dauphine as well. For the same money, those two hotels were a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dispite the view of the dark vacant warehouse directly across from our room window, this hotel was wonderful. No it didn't have a full breakfast buffet, but they did have muffins, self prepared waffles, assorted juices, cereals and more. I would definetly stay here again, in fact my husband and I are planning another trip to New Orleans. The rooms are very comfortable, and cozy. We made it to New Orleans on a Monday Morning and parked the car in the garage across the street $18 bucks a night :( . We left that Thursday and had not touched our car. No need to drive everything is in walking distance. Oh yeah, they don't tell you at the iberville suites that parking is $28 a night. The hotel has a great location just one block from Burbon street, and a few blocks from the aquarium, and one block from Canal street. If you need directions just go to the third floor of the Ritz Carlton (which is adjacent to Iberville Suites) go to the concierge, and they will give you a map.

Reviews.Title: “.....Absolutely, without a doubt !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Iberville Suites Jan 14-18. After reading the many reviews of this hotel at TripAdvisor, we were anxious to "live out" our own review regarding the quality of the hotels amenities and the status of the now infamous buffet breakfast. Having previously stayed at other French Quarter hotels, we were prepared for the traditional lack of space and noise associated with a close proximity to Bourbon Street. Let me be the first to say, however, that our experience on both points was very postive. The spaciousness of the suites was just right. The sitting room was perfect for lounging and relaxing after a day of sight-seeing, walking Bourbon Street (1 block away), and 'experiencing' Harrah's. We also experienced absolutely no "noise pollution" from Bourbon Street. The entire hotel was classy and very well-appointed. Finally, the buffet breakfast. No, you will not find eggs or bacon, but, YES, the breakfast is FREE and includes all of the fruit, oatmeal, cereal, self-prepared waffles, bagels, etc you can handle to get your day started...Lisa Johnson made sure of that. Would we stay again???....ABSOLUTLEY, without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sarah2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a New Orleans get a way. We are very familiar with New Orleans. We loved the French Quarter location. Close enough to Bourbon Street yet away from the fray. The rooms were in decent shape. They were not large suites such as an Embassy Suites but there was enough room for us ( 2 adults & 1 child). The rooms were very quite. We never heard any hallway type noise. The bathrooms were very nice. The lobby was spacious. The decor feels like an old New Orleans Uptown mansion. We really enjoyed the feel of the lobby. Everyone was super friendly & helpful. The breakfast was nothing to write homne about but it was something & it was decent. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Fab5Leader
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what I expected. Reviews misleading - it is not all suites. Our room was two beds separated by a glass partition. Rooms and lobby need attention. Poor workmanship in construction and decorating. Staff not knowledgeable - need better training. Telephone system bad. Lobby and surrounding areas need attention. I understand it is great for families and long term stays with children and pets. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Iberville-Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back after a week's stay at Iberville Suites and thought it was great! The hotel is at a great location and is beautiful inside. Although there is a lot of construction, I didn't really find this to be a problem. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The suites were a great value...the Bath and Body Works products were superb and the breakfast was amazing! The selection ranged from waffles to fresh fruit! Overall, I was happy with my stay at the Iberville Suites!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful addition to the Ritz-Carlton. The suites are somewhat small and the furniture is a tad worn, but the marble bath and absolutely gorgeous artwork are worth the stay. The lobby is small but very lovely, and the continental breakfast was worth getting up after a night on Bourbon. The location is GREAT in relation to everything downtown; however, with construction going on currently on Iberville and the Ritz, it can be a hassle trying to access the lobby entrance with your vehicle. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem when the price is right.”
Reviews.Author: funblondiee
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th visit to New Orleans and I know I found a gem. This place is not only beautiful, along with free hot buffet breakfast and close (not too close) to the noise on Bourbon Street. The price we paid was beyond reasonable. Since I've paid more for other places not in the French Quarter. Definitely worth it if you can get a good price for the rooms. Perfect location and helpful staff. I've recommended it to many friends and they've all had the same reaction--A gem! Search around for the best prices on-line.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT call home from the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We reserved a king size bed, and called a week before to confirm. On arrival we were informed that there were no king size and that was a "preference" not a reservation. We got a queen size and it was a nice room. A little worn as another reviewer stated. Maid service was excellent and the front desk person that had said 'to bad' about no king asked us the next morning about our room and I said it should have a coffee table, she had one brought to our room while we were out. The location was great, close enough to activity but far enough away that we had no noise from the streets. One block from Canal St, one block from Bourbon St. Two blocks from the boarding point for the St Charles (garden district) streetcar. As for the visipass for the public trans, you can buy it from the streetcar driver when you board. Exact change only. We made a call to home from the room, direct dial, with the hotel's service charge it was $15.00 for a one minute call.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: mkellerman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Iberville in New Orleans....Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else......Lowes or Le Pavilion are very nice and dont cost much more....Lowes is the newer of the 2 with larger rooms. Rooms at Iberville are very run down and need of repair...this Hotel should not be a 4 star Hotel a 2 or 3 at best.....REMODEL Iberville !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Iberville suites”
Reviews.Author: iceal
Reviews.Content: We just spent the week at the Iberville Suites. Hotel was really very nice. They are working on the the windows of the hotel to make them all hurricane proof. I t was a little noisy during the afternoon. We were out of our room most of the day. We returned to freshen up and nap in the late afternoon. Out for the evening. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were a very clean, furniture a little on the old side. Overall a great experince.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: missnmsy4
Reviews.Content: As a 20 year visitor to New Orleans I find The Iberville my favorite hotel there. It is beautiful, great location, best staff in town and the breakfast is delicious and generous. The staff bends over backwards to get you anything you desire. There's no better place to stay in Nola!

Reviews.Title: “In need of attention”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Poor attention to details, pictures missing in our room, inroom internet, movie and check out services did not work. went two days without maid service. Otherwise OK, but not up expectations of a Ritz Cartlton affiliate.

Reviews.Title: “An Easy Choice When Staying In The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: PMATT914
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 night stay at Iberville Suites. The location is perfect: 2 blks from Bourbon St., close enough to walk everywhere but away from the noise (especially late night on weekends); 1 blk from Canal St. & the Canal and St. Charles Street Car lines which gave inexpensive access to all our planned destinations. The suite was very comfortable. The mini-fridge let us store cold beverages for "chilling out" after a long day or night on the town. The sitting room being separated from the bedroom by the kitchenette & bathroom allowed me to catch some late night t.v. while my wife hit the pillows. The bellmen were very friendly & helpful with directions and dining recommendations (more so than the front desk staff). Concierge service is available from the Ritz Carlton next door (also very friendly & helpful). Best of all, the rates were excellent, under $100 for the week nights (but much higher for the weekend nights!) Complimentary breakfast buffet was well stocked and good. No hot dishes like eggs, etc., but with waffle batter and griddle for make-ur-own waffles. For us, Iberville Suites was an ideal place to stay in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jimmyk64
Reviews.Content: Overall, we're low maintenance travelers. Clean accomodations, a comfortable bed and in-room coffee maker usually leave us pleased with a hotel stay. Our visit over Labor Day to the Iberville Suites, delivered more than our minimum requirements. Our suite was clean when we took possession, and was maintained efficiently our entire stay. More towels in the marble bathroom than two people could use, even with two showers a day. Housekeeping service was caring and engaging. Call any of the guest service personnel, and they answer the phone by greeting you by name. The suite itself was handsome and comfortable. Our bedroom window looked out over a faux-garden: plants and trees placed pleasantly across a third floor roof top. We paid less than $100 a night for our accomodations and consider this a true bargain. When we return to the Crecent City, we will book our stay with the Iberville Suites. No reason not to.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I attempted to stay at the Iberville on August 13. Our train was delayed, so I phoned the Iberville at 4p to make sure that my accommadations were guaranteed for late arrival. I was assured that my suite would be available when we arrived. We were greeted by a very nice Bellman that informed us that our accommodations had been upgraded.(i.e. my suite was not available, they overbooked!!!) My heart sunk; here I am traveling with four other people(a 3 and 7 yr old included) and no suite. Edward did offer an upgrade at the Ritz Carlton, but his offer was for a king room and not a suite. After about 20 min of discussion, Edward magically "found" us a suite. Great right? No, when we unlocked the door the room was already occuppied. We go back downstairs and share this vital information with Edward, who couldn't understand how this could possibly happen. I then asked to speak with the manager on duty. I was only allowed to speak to her after Loss Prevention verified that someone else had their belongings in the room.(30 min later) After speaking with the MOD(Ritz Carlton), who was very apologetic we ended up in a suite at the Ritz-Carlton with complimentary room-service for the evening. The Iberville seems to be a very nice hotel, however I do think they overbook a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At $89 a night, we thought the suite w/king bed was a very good value, especially given the location within the French Quarter. The room was very clean and nicely appointed, and had a large bathroom. We certainly had no problems with housekeeping. It was also nice to have a TV in both the living area and the bedroom, and to have a small refridgerator as well. The only downside was that there is renovation going on, and the construction noise started up rather early. If you are a late sleeper, make sure the construction is finished before you book. The continental breakfast was pretty much the same as you would find in most mid-priced hotels, so expect to go out for breakfast if you want standard breakfast fare. The person at the reception desk was friendly and efficient. The parking valets were also quite friendly as well, and were very quick in retrieving our car (be aware that parking is $28 an night). Since there are so many places to stay in N.O., I'm not sure if we would stay here again, but overall we would have to say that we were satisfied with our stay, and would have no hesitation in staying again or recommending this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Duke89
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel whether you visit with kids or come for a romantic holiday. The king suites are spacious and comfortable and have touches of elegance. If you are patient and respectful with the staff they will work with you. We booked our room through Expedia (excellent rate $85 for a weeknight)) and I guess that the block of rooms set aside for Expedia was on the 10th floor whch was being renovated. The hallway carpets were covered in plastic and there were workers all over the floor. We went back downstairs and asked for another floor. We were given a room on the 7th floor which was supposed to be non smoking but reeked of smoke. Finally on our third try we got a great room in a great location. The staff was very willing to help us out. The breakfast was wonderful and is more then he usual "continental" breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It's as reviewed by most......”
Reviews.Author: c97
Reviews.Content: First thank you to all who provided some feedback on their experience at the Iberville Suites. I just returned from a long weekend (3 night stay) there. Like most reviewers stated, the place was not up to par of a Ritz Carlton hotel, the furniture was old and warn so was the art work in the suites. The breakfast was just a basic continental high carb, served on styrofoam plates and cups. There was no eggs, bacon or sausage. The dinning areas isn't what you see on the website, actually that dinning area is located in the Ritz Carlton. The room was a good size for two people, I enjoyed having a living area to rest and converse with vistors, while my room was a few feet away. So that was cozy and somewhat homely. The service was really average, on one occasion I asked the front desk for assistance on the VisiPass offered by the local Regional Transit Auth. in NO, she had no clue and suggested I contact the concierge. I went next door to the Ritz and before I even got to the desk their front desk staff was ready to assist me. The staff was helpful, they called nearby hotels that provided the service and had them hold a pass for me. Finally, if you are really use to and demand the quality of the Ritz *do not stay at Iberville* but if you want the idea of luxury just for the show then the Iberville Suites isn't bad, unless you can get a suite like hotel for that low price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is "my pleasure" to write a great review of this hotel! I stayed with two kids who slept on the pull out sofa. My king bed was very comfy and the sheets and towels were nice and plush. Bed Bath and Bodyworks toiletries- great! Two tv's so the kids could watch their shows while I watched mine! We had no problems with housekeeping- although we were out walking around the city all day! I could hear the elevator a bit- but it is an older building- not enough to keep me awake- but I would recommend reserving a room away from the elevators. We did have a beautiful view from our room- 7th floor if I remember correctly- just loved it! I ended up staying days longer than expected- so I saved some $$ by parking at the supermarket near the police station during the day and moving my car to the street in the evenings as by then it was free, and close to the hotel as the streets clear out after 5-6pm. We walked everywhere- so you know it was not far to anything as I walked with little kids. We ate dinner at Bubba Gumps a lot as the kids liked it there. Enjoyed the childrens museum a lot. Hotel staff were gracious and kind, comfortable room *very* nice for the price and location- but I do have to say I was there when they had the full buffet- I would miss that for it was truly lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Quarter Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and two children under 7 stayed at the Iberville for 4 nights in mid-june. In town for a family wedding. My husband grew up in NO - he and his siblings know NO and the Quarter extremely well; perhaps that is why we had such a great time. The Iberville staff was extremely pleasant to deal with. While I agree with some minor complaints from other reviews (yes, housekeeping IS extremely slow) overall we had an excellent stay. No, this isn't the Ritz but you get the amenities of a Ritz hotel (spa, exercise facilitites, etc) for just $10 per day - that's per room, NOT per person, and at 139 per night you can't beat the price. The spa is fabulous. The workout facilities are not big but state of the art and the staff doesn't know which hotel you are staying in so they treat everyone the same. Yes, the buffet breakfasts have been discontinued, but a call to a manager of the hotel on this subject and the $25 fee per person for more than 2 adults per room (this applied to other family members in town for the wedding) was waived. We also requested discounted valet parking fees and they were reduced by 50% on the spot! The hotel itself is old but in pretty good shape. We didn't have the greatest view from our 10th floor suite but that wasn't really important for us. The kids had a blast in the resistance pool and we pretty much had it to ourselves. The location is perfect if you like to walk and not bad for cabbing or driving. We will definitely stay there again for our next trip to NO. For those of you considering the Iberville, my suggestion is to get the manager's name before arriving so you have a contact if something is not to your liking. Our experience was that they were willing to do just about anything to make our stay memorable. We dealt with them with patience & respect and they took care of us!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: pjd10201
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in May and, yes, it's a great location (1 blk away from the french quarter), and it is (mostly) quiet , but, it's an older building and "you get what you pay for", as they say. The lobby has plenty of sofas and chairs, but you can see the aged look in the furniture, the walls, the moldings - it's not quite what I had expected. For example, one morning I was greeted by a wet ceiling in the main lobby. Staff had managed to pull away the rugs and place a bucket underneath to prevent further water damage. I could tell that this was not the first such occurrence. The building is showing it's age. As far as the "complimentary" breakfast, well, I never saw eggs or bacon - just fruits, breads, muffins, and, of course, oatmeal! The coffee was well, I really prefer Cafe du Monde. And hey, you can get a decent breakfast just three blocks up the street at Mena's cafe. As far as the room, it was clean, roomy, but the bed had seen better days. The towels were very rough (not quite sandpaper), but they were in ample supply, and yes, the linens were clean (thank god!).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: goyagirll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberville suites on Memorial Day wkend of '04. The hotel itself was aesthically nice. The front desk service was very polite and accomodating. Our rooms were the basic suite, separte living room, separate bedroom and separate bathroom. The kitchen was in between the living room and bathroom hall. I was very pleased to see that there were enough towels and toiletries to last a day. Our view was the courtyard which made our stay very quiet and away from the main scene. The complementary breakfast was very surprising. It is the daily generic muffins, bagels, oatmeal, cereal boxes and Orange Juice but compared to other types of hotels, I didn't have a problem with their complementary breakfast at the Iberville. I would defly stay here again if I choose New Orleans as my destination.

Reviews.Title: “Warning things are not as advertised at the Iberville Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed w/ my family at the Iberville Suites April 11- 14, 2004 based on previous reviews. MISTAKE! Let's start with the complimentary breakfast. It was no different than anywhere else. Muffins, cereal in a box, and plastic ware. They actually confessed that they were not serving specific items like grits, oatmeal, and sausage as a cost savings measure. Housekeeping was sloooooow and incomplete. They didn't clean the room until 3:00 pm on one occasion. On another occasion they did not change the towels. Also, one evening the staff decides to run a carpet cleaning machine at 11:30 pm. Of course called the front desk and the machine continued to run until midnight. Lastly, I valet parked my rental and upon returning it I discovered that the rear molding was damaged. Had to happen at the I-suites lot since we used the car very sparingly. If this is Ritz Carlton service, then they can have it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WelshFamily040
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Iberville on 13th - 15th of April. Chose this accommodation on the basis of reviews from this site, however despite the glowing reviews I have read about them I feel I have to say how disappointing our stay there was. They served completary breakfast -- It was decent but what was on offer daily was the same type of food--same type of muffins, bagels, fruit and cereal in cartons!!. There was no variation at all. What was very was annoying about was all their serving plates and cups and cutlery were all plastic!!! So much for conserving the world's resources!!!I expected better as this as the hotel is managed by the Ritz they should have a t least ceramic if not porcelain serving dishes and decent cutlery. If this was a cost saving measure for the hotel I am afraid that it goes down really badly. The housekeeping service was very slow. We expected our rooms to have been cleaned by at least mid afternoon , but on the second day it took me four phone calls throughout the day and by the time they were able to clean the room and make up the bed & change it was 8PM!! Reception staff were polite but not very friendly. Our room was on the 7th floor and right outside our window as wa workman's lift and every morning at 8 pm the noise generated by this lift woke me up --so much for a lie-in!! The only advantage of Iberville Suites is the extra room one gets with the accommodation provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal. Muddled but friendly service”
Reviews.Author: atlaffinity
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding. The location is great. Walking distance to everything. Also, surprisingly quiet in the rooms. The service was friendly although we had some problems getting our luggage to our room which shouldn't be very hard for the hotel to handle. We never used the Ritz facilities though $10 seems pretty reasonable to use their pool and workout facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Iberville Suites with our 3 children ages 7, 4 & 2 and must say we were spoiled for 5 days! This was a perfect location as we only got our car out twice! You can even walk to the aquarium! Walking around in the French Quarter/Jackson Square (we did Ripleys Believe it or Not!) was exciting but we felt grubby after being on the streets all day and coming home to the Iberville was the perfect complement to the long days! Our room was always stocked with special Bath & Body Works bath supplies each day and we even had a cordless phone in room! Everything was meticulously clean/fresh! Like the other reviews, I agree about it being quiet! We didn't even hear other guests!!! The resistance pool and whirlpool was a great escape from the bustling city and fresh fruit was even offered in the excercise room!!! The full breakfast was eggs/bacon each day and I usually took it up to the room as I am the early riser! The rooms have mini fridges, so extras could be stored. We loved the Iberville Suites and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at iberville was wonderful. the wonderfull doormen/valet who were nice freandly and sweet, they had no problem with the oversized truck with a wheelchair holder on back. when you walk into the entrance to the hotel the first thing you smell is cloves, the decorating is beautiful, then you go up the slowest one story elevator i have ever seen. when you exit the elevator you get the nice lobby, it is decorrated beauitfully and they have a player piano in it, they only complaint i see is the bathroom had no soap? the balconies were beautiful. the room was a bit small but they made up for it with the soft pull out bed. then rooms were clean and the place was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this after reading the reviews on this site. I paid $139 through the hotel's website for a suite. It was by far the best deal I found for a nice and highly rated (AAA 4 star) hotel in the quarter. The suite was a great size (living room and king size bed in the bed room w/ TV's in both rooms) and the breakfast (free, included in the price of the room) make this hotel great.

Reviews.Title: “Simpy Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at the Iberville Suites. From the minute we arrived, we were treated so well by the staff. They checked us in five hours early and were very helpful with directions. The room was fabulous; very large, clean, and quiet. I don't know that you would get as much for your money anywhere in the French Quarter. The morning breakfast was very nice. Our three year old enjoyed the pool and I enjoyed the spa at the Ritz. Room service was very quick and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Friendly Service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When booking my trip through Expedia I was pleasantly surprised to find a 4 star hotel at a really great price. The Iberville Suites was every bit what I expected. The rooms were spacious and well furnished. The breakfast was outstanding. There was more than enough to go around and it was a FULL BUFFET, not just a donut and coffee. It was also a plus being allowed to use the Ritz-Carlton facilities. The hotel is located in the heart of the French Quarter and liteally minutes from nearly everything in the Quarter. However, the best part of the Iberville Suites was the staff. They were warm and friendly and always helpful. My wife celebrated her birthday at the hotel and the staff had just as much fun helping me plan my birthday surprise as I did! It was so nice to say thank you to the staff and hear "my pleasure" as a response. My hat is off to the staff at the Iberville Suites. A hotel is just a hotel unless you have a great staff behind it. Thank you Iberville.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was such a great place to stay. It is part of the Ritz Carlton chain and it lived up to its parent company's reputation. It was about the only place I could find suites in the quarter, and the price I got through AAA (119 a night) was below most regular rooms in the vicinity. Their breakfast buffet was incredible and despite being only a bloc or so off of bourbon it was insanely quiet. I would recommend it to anyone, but especially anyone looking for divisible space.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else but the Iberville ! !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE were so impressed with the Iberville Suites. THe rooms were clean and spacious and the entire hotel staff was incredibly polite , helpful and friendly. The buffet style breakfast in the morning (Complimentary) was wonderful and we had no problem getting a seat . The location was perfect , as it was only 1 block from Bourbon street , yet far enough away to block the noise so we had good sleeps every night.We will definately be back !

Reviews.Title: “Clean, classy, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as part of a package deal from Expedia. We used this website to review the hotel prior to purchasing the package and found that the reviews were accurate. However, our experience was even better than the reviews. The hotel is elegant, classy and very convienently located within the French Quarter. The room was clean and adequately stocked everyday. Staff were also very helpful and courteous. Buffet breakfast was pretty good and room service was even better. Although we did not use the Ritz Carlton services very much, the Concierge was very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pdietznj
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Iberville Suites. I would highly recommend this hotel. Our stay was wonderful. We got this hotel from Expedia.com for only $90.00 a night so we weren't expecting too much. I realized what a good deal it was when we got there. The hotel staff was very helpful and the hotel was nicely decorated and clean. The free breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! Outstanding! Stayed there Dec 11-14 and can't imagine staying anywhere else. Many thanks to the ENTIRE

HotelInfo.Name: Iberville Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 910 Iberville St., New Orleans, LA 70112
